description: The food itself is a 3.5-4 stars. The service brings it to a 5 star. I am always nervous eating at Mediterranean/Egyptian places knowing that the food can be either good or bad/disappointing. The food was good, but I know there is better elsewhere. The mezze platter was good and could tell the different dips were made there. The pomegranate lemonade was refreshing and nice. The tajine was okay, but reminded me of Hong Kong baked rice with pork and tomatoes hmmmmm. Palmyra on Haight seems to be a similar restaurant with different atmosphere.
author: Wesley K.

description:
yo mediterranean at the lounge? LA
yo mediterranean at the brrr? YA
yo mediterranean at the club? LY
yo mediterranean at dinner? ok!
yo mediterranean SALMON WRAP? de
yo mediterranean TANTUNI? li
yo mediterranean KOFTE WRAP? ve
yo mediterranean hit the spot? ry!
author: Dan B.

description:
This is a hidden gem and I considered hiding my review but they earned it. Parking is a bit tricky, but if you drive around a bit you'll find a spot. 

The dining aesthetic is warm and cozy, very welcoming. We dined on a Wednesday night and they weren't slammed so we got very attentive service. I can imagine they get packed on the weekends, as many people stopped in to pick up takeout. 

We started with the Baba Ghanouj which had a perfect smoky eggplant flavor with olive oil and lemon juice layered in. For my entree, I went with the beef kebab and my friends both ordered the lamb having had it before and raved about it. My beef was cooked perfectly and the rice was delicious. We closed up with baklava (of course) and that was also delicious. 

Normally I'm a lush at dinner time but they had this amazing lemonade with pomegranate and I could stop asking for refills. 

The service throughout our meal was attentive and courteous. We'll definitely be back to eat at Layaly!
author: Bianca B.

description: We enjoyed our visit during the hot weekend. The waitress was very helpful and our little boys enjoyed the Kofta Sliders. The got the Mezza platter and had lots of good selection. The dinner was nice and we enjoyed our meal. The place is decorated very nice and the service was great. Thank you
author: Sid H.

description:
Know what? I've never had a bad meal here. And I've eaten here nearly a half dozen times over the better part of a decade. For consistency alone, I think that's an incredible feat.

Not that consistency is everything. After all--you can be consistently bad right? Layalay, however, is consistently good. Maybe not phenomenal, blow-your-mind, but definitely good. I don't think they're trying to be SF's hottest new spot. On the contrary, this is a cozy, well-kept, and nice little neighborhood spot in Outer Richmond. 

Let's talk about a few of those things that are good then. You go with the basics, and you're not going to go wrong. The mezza platter ($15) to begin is a great option. One big platter of tzatztiki, hummus, baba ganoush, shawarma, dolmas, and loads of warm pita. It's an instant win. And, it occurs to me, could either be a meal in itself. Or, this would be a great spot for a first date you're looking to impress. You go in, grab some wine and share this appetizer, chat, fall in love, and come back on your anniversaries. It's a great plan.

Moving on from your fictional first date and back to the reality of the food, I think the Layaly mixed grill plate is as solid of a choice as you're going to find. You get a few different meats (from land and sea) that were grilled, rice, and a salad. No frills, but those herbs infuse the proteins with subtle flavor you won't find elsewhere on the globe. 

I recently tried a couple different tagines, and am happy to report they're hearty and well-made. My latest was a sirloin/cream tagine, and it was described as "sorta like beef strogonaff" which, on a rainy night, is exactly what you want. Served with rice, it was piping hot, rich, and it left me warmed and stuffed.

I think(?) they changed ownership sometime in the last 6-8 years, but I didn't notice much change besides staff. There used to be a server we fondly referred to as "Demi" for her likeness to the actress (Moore, not Lovato) but she disappeared long ago. Happily, the newer staff is just as warm and welcoming.

Honestly, I cherish neighborhood spots like this. It's never crowded, never a scene, but still nice, unique, warm, and just a short walk away.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Came in on a Wednesday evening and it wasn't too crowded. My friends and I were seated right away. The inside of the restaurant was very nice. It was very dim, but it seemed to lean more on the extravagant side. I ordered the steak wrap, which was very fulfilling. The food and service here is great. My server was very kind.
author: Maggie T.

description: Great food, friendly staff and fair price. Best place to try middle eastern food. Recommend for sure
author: Als A.

description: Braised lamb shank was large and tasty.  Hayduri (the yogurt dip) was also quite good.  The rest of the mezze plate was OK.
author: Sarah S.

description: Premium food. Tabouleh is made a la minute. Very delicious  I had a falafel wrap and feta + olives side. It is so worth to try the place is cozy and Mediterranean style
author: Anuta B.

description: Came here with a few friends and wanted to try something new. This place is clean and welcoming. Ambiance is relaxing. Food is delicious, loved the borek rolls and hummus plater for appetizers and the mix grill kabobs were amazing! Also enjoyed the pomegranate lemonade it was so good! Will definitely recommend to friends and family and we will return for sure!
author: RamonaEliza D.

description: Great service, which is not to be taken for granted in this city. Food was delicious and freshly made. the modest Middle Eastern beer selection was a refreshing change of taste. Highly recommended for dates or group dining
author: Joe U.

description:
Right smack dab across the street from Hard Knox southern food is Layaly.

Yelp gives this cute little Mediterranean restaurant four stars ( and it really does deserve it). From the atmosphere, to the wonderful service, and the good food. Layaly is a nice gem.

We had the mezza platter to start with: Hummus, baba ghanouj, tabouli, falafel,  borek and warm pita. All were very good...but the Borek (Fried filo dough stuffed with feta cheese and parsley) was like Lebanese crack...omg.

For our mains we had the: Kofte Kebab which was a mixture of ground beef and lamb, onions and fresh herbs. served with rice and vegetables. Really tender and flavorful Kebabs with fluffy light rice. 

Lamb Kebab Entrée marinated tender cubes of lamb skewered with onions and peppers. served with rice and vegetables. Very tender and sucullent lamb with not too much fat and cooked to perfection.

Dajaj chicken sautéed with onions, peppers, mushrooms and garlic in a tomato white wine sauce. served with rice. This Tajine ( think wonderful stew) was intensly arromatic and rich. The mushrooms and chicken were out of this world. Generous portion as well.

We took home two dishes for two family members that were revolting about dinning out (typical). They had the Falafel Wrap:  falafels with hummus, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles and tahini. This was the best Falafel sandwhich I have every tasted...so yummy and flavorful. They both had french fries with them  seasoned sumac.....they are the best. Crispy fries with that amazing sumac flavor. Only other place I know that does this is in Las vegas.

Prices for dinning out are really reasonable. 

Service was just fantastic. The wonderful lady that helped us always refilled our water, was super pleasant, and just super cool.

Only thing I didnt like, and it is petty, was one of the owners just hanging out playing on his cell phone.

I would highly recommend checking this place out/
author: David G.

description: Their falafel wrap and salad are outstanding! Absolutely love the flavor, atmosphere and service.
author: A M.

description: Absolutely delicious. We are from France and love the Mediterranean food. Layaly is the real deal.
author: julien b.

description:
My girlfriends and I came here to celebrate a birthday on a Wed evening. The place was quite empty. But it was good for us because we got almost an undivided attention from the waitress. All the dishes that we ordered were very tasty and the portions were quite generous. We would definitely go back again. Hopefully business would be picked up more. I will hate to see this restaurant closes.

We ordered the following. 
-Mezza Platter: a good sampler platter of appetizers. Hummus was delicious and the pita bread was served warm. The portion was very generous.
- Stuffed Eggplant
- Steak Wrap
- Dajaj
- Baklava: not very sweet which was what we like
author: Lily L.

description: Came here for an early dinner and had a great meal! We were seated promptly and had good service for our entire meal. We started with the baba ghanoush which was awesome and came with a hefty basket of warm pita! For our entrees, my boyfriend got the bazinjan and I got the pomegranate chicken. Not only were both dishes tasty, but the portions were huge!! We left the restaurant feeling full and satisfies. Overall, great meal, good service, and I would definitely return!
author: Rachel D.

description:
Beautiful, romantic, and lovely!

This place has the best Mediterranean food. I'd suggest coming here. It's super romantic to take a date or it's just great food to eat any day of the night. 

Dine in or take out. Whichever you do this place will not disappoint. The appetizers are amazing. I'd suggest if you haven't came here yet to try the appetizer plate. You get an assortment of every appetizer. All of the food is just so great here I can't even describe. 

I've had all of the appetizers and a salad. Next time I will definitely order the salmon plate. Honestly you can't go wrong with anything here. The mulled wine was decent but not my favorite though. 

Last, the service was great! Our waitress was extremely attentive and ready to help whenever. She was also very friendly as well.

This is such a nice place I think I'll take my parents here next time they're in town.
author: Lori R.

description:
Ordered a Kofte Wrap with fries to go. 

Wrap was very well balanced and made good left overs as well! 

Can't wait to try an eat-in order!
author: Wendi A.

description:
Had dinner here tonight with Family. Firstly, have to say that the restaurant is small, but a nice small with 
An Ambience that was welcoming, comfortable and inviting. Cozy decor. 

Secondly, the waitress was very pleasant and attentive. This is what made her so amazing since she seem to be the only one on the floor working. She took our orders, seated others, brought us our food, took care of takeout orders, cleared tables and took care of the check! Talk about multi-tasking. All with a smile. 

The food: 
I had the salmon wrap. It came with a choice of salad or fries. Opted for fries which were really tasty with just a hint of salt. The salmon wrap was delicious too. My niece had the chicken kebab (I sampled it and it was moist and tender and delicately spiced). Brother had shrimp kebab and his wife had the shrimp tajine.  We shared a pistachio ice cream and chocolate cake for dessert. Both were sweet- but just right. 

I will be back!
author: William Y.

description:
Kind of a hole-in-the-wall toward the end of the restaurant row along Clement Street.

The service is always very helpful and friendly and it is quiet enough to have a conversation.

My father really likes the lamb shank and the tagine.  He lives about four blocks away and this is one of his "go to" choices when I see him.  I usually get the wraps which are "good but not great."  We both like the mezze plate, which is a selection of several different appetizers.  It is big enough (for us) to be lunch for two.

They have a number of beers from different Middle Eastern countries, none of which are that exciting (think mass produced enough to make it to California).

There is a completely different menu for Sunday brunch which we do not care for (my father and I) but the owner, Omar, told us that, if we asked, they can make any of the "normal" menu items on Sundays.
author: Gary A.

description:
The roommate isn't a huge fan of Mediterranean food. So when he's on a diet or working in SJ, I tend to take advantage and order what I want for delivery. Last August 2013, he was on a diet, so I ordered from Layaly via Eat24.

*Mezza platter ($14): hummus, baba ghanouji, tabouli, falafel, borek and haydari, served with pita
*Spinach salad (no feta) $9: baby spinach, tomatoes, mandarins tossed in a tahini citrus dressing
*Layala mix grill (one person) $20: kofte, chicken, beef, lamb and shrimp skewers, served with rice and arugula salad
*Hummus (free with any order of $35 or more, normally $6.50): blend of garbanzo with tahini, lemon juice, olive oil and garlic, served with pita

The spinach salad was the roommate's pick. Not worth $9 without the feta. They should have made it bigger for us since we didn't want the cheese. Also, it had dried cranberries and olives. These were never mentioned in the description and the roommate hates olives.

The rest of the dishes were my choices. The mezza platter was a great way to sample a bunch of apps. I love hummus, tabouli and falafel especially, so I really enjoyed this. The mixed grill was the same. I was able to sample all their meats which was great! They were all flavorful and tender.

Glad there's a Mediterranean restaurant with combo plates that deliver. Perfect for my lazy days when I'm on my own!
author: Elena N.

description: Hidden gem of goodness. We started with the assortment of dips and dolmas accompanied by warm bread. Everything was super yummy the Haydari was smooth and oh so good. We shared the Greek salad which was a good size and prepared perfectly. I had the salmon wrap for dinner which was juicy and cooked to perfection with thin fries that were very tasty. My husband had the falafel wrap and declared it to be the best he's had so far.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Excellent food!  Lentil soup (with a lemon slice on the side to squeeze on top!) was amazing!  Got the sample plate to share and basically licked the plate clean.  
Saw that they serve brunch on Sundays, which is amazing because hardly anyplace I the outer Richmond serves brunch- excited to try it out!
author: Dangerous T.

description: What a gem of a Greek restaurant! Their Mezzanine platter is huge, delicious, and priced well! That could be your entire meal! We also loved the chicken kebabs, which were spiced perfectly and had a beautiful aroma. Will definitely return!
author: Danielle M.

description: Omg so amazing one of my favorite restaurants  food is to die for !! I love the hummus and pita and lamb with salad and rice
author: Makaila L.

description:
Just ordered takeout from here.
Food is pretty good. Baklava portion is small. 

But I nearly broke my tooth on the olive in my Greek salad. They were not pitted ahead of time. 
My boyfriends wrap is also pretty bland. For $40 it did not measure up.
author: Larissa S.

description: This place has the best food my wife and I have ever had delivered. Ingredients all fresh, price for a steak wrap, pistachio salad ( which was huge, included pita and hummus) and vegetable wrap was very reasonable. It was to much food for two of us. Food was delivered fast. Also got fries with both our wraps. After we finished eating my wife said to make sure to bookmark this place. Guess we have a new favorite delivery. Will probably go to restaurant soon. Love the food.
author: David M.

description:
I fancy Layaly but the last time I was here was a year ago and things have definitely changed.

1. They are no longer open for lunch which means no more $7 lunch deals.
2. I ordered my favorite dish - the lamb skewers. THUMBS DOWN. A year ago, their lamb skewers were flavorful and succulent, whereas last night, they were tough and hard. They used to present the skewers on the plate beautifully, while they just place it very lackluster on the plate now.
3. Staff were nice but seemed unorganized and most orders seemed in disarray.

I'll think twice before I come here again.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
*Dined in 5/14/16*

I have grown up in the Richmond my whole life, but I don't know when Layal was established there. Even if I knew, it has only been in the past year have I grown to enjoy Mediterranean food. It's been my go-to when I want to eat generally healthy. 

It's the night before Bay to Breakers and the hubby and I didn't want to eat anything to heavy before our race so I Yelp'd around the area and came upon Layal. I recall walking by it a few times, and one time even looking at the menu but always disregarded it. This time, I checked out the photos and it was an easy decision. [Note: This is a good sign because my husband knows I can be indecisive, and then i get hangry.] I called in to ask about the wait time for 2 and the girl who picked up the phone said there wasn't any wait but she'll put her name down since it looked like people were slowly trickling in. We weren't too far away so it worked out. 

When we arrived, there were a few parties sitting down, with much of the tables open. They sat us down and served us water immediately. On it! We took some time to glance over the menu and started off with the hummus, since everyone on here raved about it :) It was a good thing we ordered an appetizer because the kitchen was kind of slow and they were short a server. Jessica was able to get it done though, so helpful! For our entrees, we ended up ordering the Kofte Kebab (mixture of ground lamb and beef with onions and herbs, served with rice and salad) and the Bazinjan Tajine (sirloin sautéed in a spicy garlic tomato sauce, with eggplant, onions, and bell peppers, served with a side of rice).

The hummus was excellent! So smooth and creamy with the perfect amount of flavoring. The drizzle of the olive oil on top was the perfect addition. The pita bread was so fresh and soft!! You really can't yourself from eating it. Since we had to wait a bit for our order to come out, I asked for extra bread to pass the time, and again, it came out piping hot!

My kofte kebab was delicious! When you cut the meat into bite size pieces, it may appear tough or dry, when you eat it, it's tender and juicy. They know how to do it right! I didn't want the rice and asked for extra salad, and they delivered. Half my plate was covered with fresh arugula with a sprinkle of salt. The tzatziki sauce that came with it was BOMB! Yelpers mentioned that as well. The meat was good and flavorful so I didn't really feel the need to dip too much in it. But I typically don't drench things in sauce or dressing, less is more. Hubbs enjoyed his bazinjan, it is a bit on the spicy side but the amount of spice was good enough where you can still savor and enjoy the flavors of the dish. However, to avoid any upset stomachs, we felt that he best not finish it, since he had to run in 12 hours. Lucky for him, he got to help me with my kofte. 

At the end of the meal, Jessica brought us a baklava for dessert since we had to wait for our meal. What a nice gal! It was good, but it might have given me an allergic reaction. I don't have any known allergies but when I got home, I got a little itchy and was getting red dots on my body. Don't know if it was the baklava cause it has pistachios (something I'm used to eating) or the meal itself. Whatever it is, I'm willing to go back and test it out. It's that good!

So glad I discovered this quiet, cozy, almost hole-in-the-wall restaurant in the neighborhood. Can't wait to try the other items on the menu. Hopefully next time, the service will be a bit faster too.
author: Jenny C.

description:
I came here with my fiancé on a Sunday evening after a nice walk. The restaurant had lots of tables available and we could choose where to sit.

We ordered A LOT of food, but everything was delicious. We had the mezza-platter for appetizer (which is a nice option if you want to try several of the appetizers. Although, it comes with lots of pitta and spreads - like humus -, and only 2 units of the other stuff), the pomegranate chicken (which comes with rice), kafta, and lamb. 

Everything was quite delicious, especially the kafta and the lamb (which was so tender you could cut it with a fork!).

It's a great place to eat, even though it's not the cheapest.
author: Andréia S.

description:
The options for Mediterranean food are pretty far and few between in this neighborhood- unless you want to go upscale and splash out some cash at Aziza. 

I have dined in Layaly a few times - looks like a great space to host s party- and ordered delivery from them a few more. The salmon is delicious and the appetizer platter delivers all the best Med cuisine faves, from baba ganoush to hummus. Healthy dishes on the menu make it a good go to without the guilt.
author: Carole B.

description:
Every time I eat here I feel like I'm being taken on a fabulous trip to the Mediterranean!  

My favorite dish has to be the Tantouni, which is one of their Tajines.   It is Sirloin sauteed in a white wine cream sauce with onion, bell pepper and mushrooms.  However, I prefer mine without the bell peppers. It's almost like the Mediterranean version of Beef Stroganoff, but over rice.  YUM!

Their meza platter is another great item to try.  It has a little of every appetizer (Hummus, baba ghanouj, tabouli, falafel, borek and haydari).   And if all else fails, you can't go wrong with kebabs. 

The ambiance is very pleasant, and the staff is very friendly.  As well as they have a nice wine selection.

However, if your feeling tired or lazy, you can always just order this great food to you.  They deliver!
author: Rose Z.

description:
Overall: 8/10 

Nice ambience, a bit busy but very nice waiting staff. The server was very attentive and welcoming

We started off with an appetizer;

Falafel: Firm yet crisp. Spicy and good if eaten with mint leaves. Good for the price (4 for $5)

For the dinner:

Salmon Wrap: Crunchy wrap with flavorful salmon. Solid and delicious especially for its price.

Shrimp Tajine: Very buttery, smooth tomato sauce. Very good if poured on the rice it comes with. Shrimp a bit spicy but good.

Shrimp Kabob: Good portion. Does not have a smoky flavor. 

Chicken Kabob: Flavorful, Smooth and delicious. Mint sauce on side compliments it. Rice was a standout, light yet filling.

After we had desserts:

Pistachio Ice Cream: Creamy and whole pistachios were nice touch. 

Chocolate Cake: More mousse and frosting then cake. The only dish that did not live up to our expectations but it did not negatively impact the experience. 

Mint Tea (forgot the name of it): Clean and refreshing. Good for drinking throughout the meal.

Very good first time experience. The highlight was the waitress. Will go back soon!
author: Guilliana J.

description:
YES. SO GOOD. 

Service is awesome, food is AWESOME. Parking is a freaking nightmare, but if you can snag a spot, it's just delicious.
author: Barbara S.

description:
The absolute best restaurant in SF. Period. End of story. 

I would come here close to once a week, and I have never eaten something that wasn't amazing. Their hummus is unbelievable (and coming from an Israeli, that's a huge compliment)! Their falafel salad is another great choice as is their salmon and any of their kabobs. 

Great for dinner and lunch, and always wonderful service. We actually ate here so much we become friends with the waitress. (Jessica rules!)

Overall, go here, you won't regret it.
author: Simon A.

description: I love coming here.  The food is really fresh and very tasty.  The owner takes a lot of care to deliver very high quality menu.  I had guests from Jerusalem and they were very happy.  We will go back soon.
author: Abraham T.

description: This is a solid Mediterranean place in the Outer Richmond. I came here for dinner with a friend, and I got the chicken kabob entree which came with rice and side arugula salad. The chicken was flavored nicely, but I really enjoyed putting the tzatziki sauce on it. The portions are huge! I recommend getting different entrees and sharing. The hummus with pita is also good here. I don't think I would come here unless I was in the area, but it's definitely a recommendation if you want a good meal in the Outer Richmond.
author: Steph V.

description:
Great food and hospitality 
This is my second time to visit and I fell in love with their Lamb Shank and Bamya (okra).
author: Fouad A.

description:
The food here is great, the decor is cozy and the service is good.  We came here for dinner and tried the mixed grill and eggplant Tagine.  Both were well flavored and very tasty.  

The ambiance is cozy too, it's a small space but does not feel too crowded.  Our server was really sweet too and gave us some baklava because she said she was really busy and did not give us as much attention as she would like.  I was very content with the service.  Definitely a new fave in this neighborhood.
author: Samantha S.

description:
Groupon can be such a dicey proposition. You never know if you're being lured to a place everyone hates and getting ensnared in a meal best described as tragic, or you're about to discover a hidden gem that you would have never found on your own. Thank goodness Yelp can help you sift through the weeds to figure out your odds for culinary satisfaction. Jamie W. and I just happened to be in the mood for something new last Friday, and I saw the Groupon for Layaly in my inbox. Since Mediterranean is one of our preferred cuisines in eating healthier, I decided to go for the 57%-off deal where we could share an appetizer and dessert and each of us gets an entree for $29. We got lucky because it was really good food properly executed in a relaxing atmosphere.

But first we had to take the 38 Geary from its starting point at Main and Howard. We were already a bit apoplectic by the time we got to the Outer Richmond, but fortunately our window-side table was awaiting us. We started with their extremely creamy Hummus with warm, grilled pita wedges (normally $6.50 - see photo). Absolutely no complaints with that modest starter as it was exactly what we wanted before the magilla of entrees - the Layaly Mix Grill for Two (normally $34) - which consisted of a huge platter of kabobs, two scoops of rice and a cup of tzatziki sauce. Kofte (minced lamb), chicken, beef, lamb, and shrimp, all grilled nicely with alternating cherry tomatoes, bell peppers and red onions (see photo). A skewer of each kind for both of us, so we were headed for a carnivorous coma.

All the meats were tender and moist but with a nice char. Genuinely satisfying. For dessert, we were given the choice of a Pistachio Ice Cream or their house-made Baklava. There was no contest there, and they cut the flaky slab of gooey goodness in half for our respective indulgence (see photo). Service was quite friendly and attentive even as the dining room started to get more crowded. We were happy to receive the Groupon discount, but their more important goal was achieved. We plan on making a return visit sometime and paying the regular prices for their food. Sure, there are lots of Mediterranean places closer to home, but hey, the after-dinner stroll down Clement was nice and leisurely.

FOOD - 4 stars...nothing that creative here, but they can certainly know how to make hummus and kabobs
AMBIANCE -3.5 stars...just a nice neighborhood spot with few frills but enough ethnic flavor to make you aware you're not at a Subway
SERVICE - 4 stars...thoughtful and handled our Groupon with grace
TOTAL - 4 stars...far-flung Mediterranean for sure, but take a Valium for your ride on the 38 and you'll be just fine
author: Ed U.

description:
This place was pretty good! Didn't blow my mind (YET), but really glad to have it in the hood. I think I just have to eat more of the menu items, is all! 

The hummus was very creamy and flavorful. My kebab was great. Now I have to try everything else!
author: Nami S.

description:
Only 4 this time since while I am happy they are getting more business, I think their kitchen is too busy.  Should hire more people.

Friendly wait staff, though.
author: Ai S.

description:
Every time I'm craving a falafel wrap and some hummus, this is my go-to.

Lively music, low lighting and tasteful decor make this restaurant as pleasing to the eyes and ears as its food is to the tongue.

Friendly servers and hostesses, and impeccable food. Parking is a hassle but it's worth it!
author: Morgan B.

description: I cannot believe Layaly ever existed!!! Thank God I finally discovered it! We ordered the mezza platter, feta cheese with olives, mixed grill and eggplant sandwich with fries. A big order but wow was it great! The food was delivered earlier than expected and very warm.  I strongly suggest to everyone on Yelp to eat at Layaly; you will not be dissapointed!
author: Noor S.

description:
Great food here on Clement. Love the Greek salad, kofte kebab (lamb, beef and spice mix), and mezze platter. Service is friendly but slow, as they're usually inundated with to go orders and have only one server. This is why I give it 4 stars and not 5.

Only 15 tables or so. Great gem. Treat yourself. :)
author: Bing B.

description:
Not worth the $. Food was lukewarm and fries were actually soggy and cold. The sad part is I placed an order for pickup, they had me wait because it wasn't ready and it was STILL cold based on a 3min walk home. I got the kofta kebab wrap, meat was ok flavored but the bread was too thin and crispy. Also got the chicken kebab dinner- for $15.00 I expect more food and flavored rice. Instead I got a small arugula salad with too much salad dressing, and a scoop of plain rice with some chicken skewers. 
I paid $28 for the whole meal but it should have been no more than $15 for what I got. Not going back!
author: S K.

description: Ordered from this place once before and they got my order wrong.  On top of that what I did get was so bitter and salty it was not edible.  Thought I would give them another try with something else and same thing, it tastes like they spilled salt in the food.  So salty it's not edible.  Won't be eating here again.
author: Shyam B.

description:
Layaly is EVERYTHING you would expect from a neighborhood restaurant: Quaint, Delicious Food and Friendly Service!

My friends started off our Sunday with dim sim and went onto munch on silvanas (Filipino macarons) and sip on red velvet lattes. Being fatasses, we decide to end with dinner at Layaly because my friend had a Scoutmob - 50% off up to $15 deal. 

Be forewarned that parking in the area is a complete nightmare. There is a parking lot a block away for $6/hour. 

On Sunday 9.4.11, my friend and I came in a little after 6 PM and Layaly was empty except for one couple. We were seated promptly (without reservations) while we waited for two of other friends to arrive.

F O O D
*MEZZA PLATTER: w/ Hummus, Baba Ghanouj, Haydari, Tabouli, Falafel and Borek ($15) - 4 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9KeTKDuHdLMhRFku0HAIxw?select=l-aiPHAOl0jH77o_FAB4zw
We liked and devoured everything on the platter except the tabouli (parsley salad). The hummus and haydari (yogurt sauce) was amazingly rich and creamy. The baba ghanouj (mashed eggplant) was smooth yet still had some texture to it. The falafel had a nice crunchy exterior with a soft center and the borek (fillo stuffed with feta) was like a savory cheese egg roll. 

It was served with warm pita bread which was perfect for sopping up all the yummy hummus, haydari and baba ghanouj.

*LAYALY MIXED GRILL w/ Kofte, Chicken, Beef, Lamb, and Shrimp ($34 for 2 people) - 4 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9KeTKDuHdLMhRFku0HAIxw?select=xiCzw2TLqT2ga_WNAQreGQ
Everything on the plate was packed with flavor and deliciously mouth-watering. The kofte (beef and lamb) was rich and juicy with a subtle gaminess. The beef and lamb were tender and filled with garlicky spices. The shrimp was nicely tender. The chicken, being white pieces was surprisingly very tender and moist. The accompanying yogurt sauce help cut through some of the richness while adding a tangy creaminess. I absolutely loved the rice pilaf as it had great texture and flavor. 

Portion sizes were very generous and the Layaly Mixed Grill could easily feed 3 people. 

S E R V I C E
Our waitress was very approachable and friendly but spread thin because she was the only one in the front of the house. In the beginning, she was attentive but as it got busy, it was hard for her to keep up. They really need to hire additional help especially during peak hours on the weekends. Nonetheless, she did a great job making sure we were ok and that our water glasses were filled.

My only gripe is our entrees took a while to arrive. 

A M B I A N C E / D E C O R
Casual, yet very warm and cozy. The mellow yellow walls and the red wooden furnishings created a very welcoming and charming feel to Layaly. There's also a back patio for hookah. 

P A R K I N G
As previously stated, street parking in the area is a NIGHTMARE. Your best bet is looking for parking a block away on California. There is a parking lot a block away for $6/hour.

With the Scoutmob deal, we each paid $21 (including tax and gratuity) which was very affordable. They even have $7 lunch specials offered every day. 

Other Note(s):
We noticed A LOT of people coming into Layaly wanting to do hookah but they didn't offer it on the Sunday we were there, so I highly recommend calling ahead of time to make sure it's being offered that night. 

Did you know that Mediterranean food is THE healthiest ethnic cuisine according to CNN? There goes another reason to check out Layaly. Sorry, spanakopita does NOT count.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Great food. Always great service. I've had almost everything on the menu and I have been so happy with each meal. They have a $7 wine glass special and sometimes they have belly dancers come during dinner.
author: Nikki M.

description: Delightful food and plentiful. For a couple from Brooklyn, where good Middle Eastern fare is a given, we were surprised and pleased with every bite. The felafel with feta inside was surprise, and the lentil soup was an excellent antidote to the chilly winds blowing outside. This unpretentious restaurant is airy and the woman who served us couldn't have been more friendly. I'd go back, for sure.
author: daniel w.

description:
Good food and good service!!!

We enjoy this neighborhood restaurant.  It has the best waitresses and manager Jessica - knowledgeable, polite, professional, and efficient.  They know the menu in the back of their head.  We eat in or do take-outs twice monthly.  We like the hummus, dolma, salmon wrap, steak wrap, tarjines especially the sabanihk, salmon dinner, and lamb shank dinner.  They have recently raised the prices ($1-$3) and took out the sabanikh tarjine.
author: G D.

description: Deeeeelicious! Arrived super fast, food was fresh and very tasty. Falafel was not overly greasy, hummus was fresh, pita was fluffy, and flavors were on point. Will definitely order again. Only downside: a little pricey for takeout.
author: Kelly B.

description: 2nd visit. Just as good. This is now a destination place for hubby & I.  Yelp wants me to say more (word count) or they won't post this review. Hopefully I've typed enough now.
author: Kim G.

description: I order from here at least once a week. They have great selection of food for great prices and now they deliver  ALCOHOL! I mean what more can you ask for? Great food with wine and beer delivered to your door steps. Highly recommend their tajiens and mixed grill.
author: Yazan Z.

description: We came here for our anniversary dinner. We had reservations at Aziza, but left because we didnt like their overpriced menu and small selection and how we were seated and treated. So we ordered Mezza platter and Layaly Mix Grill. All were delicious. Would highly recommend.
author: Veronica F.

description: Found this place after a long workday, had a great meal with the chicken kebab dinner. Next time ordered takeout brought it home and my daughter loved the chicken. Had been our favorite place for almost a year. The last four or five times (we ordered delivery) we noticed a change in their chicken. The plate comes with 4 skewers arugula salad and rice. Yummy, until some of the chicken pieces were not chewable. First time I thought maybe a mistake, second time I'm wondering why the change. By the fourth or fifth time my daughter no longer liked it, I was just annoyed by it. Unfortunately we will not be eating their food anymore there was a time when this was our favorite place.
author: Jonathan P.

description: Ordered delivery from here, it arrived cold and my steak wasn't cooked enough I had asked for medium to well done as a result I didn't have the steak so just had rice and salad. Was disappointed. My partner had the chicken and it was lovely.
author: Sinead M.

description: First and foremost an excellent restaurant serves excellent food. This place not only meets this expectation but surpasses it with comfortable seating, relaxing ambience and gentle music to make you feel somewhere far away in the Mediterranean.
author: Omran I.

description:
I was initially lured here by an online deal and was very happy to discover one of my favorite places for Mediterranean food in the city.

I wanted to be able to try a healthy variety of their offerings to fully determine which of their dishes I might later come back to try again and everything was SO good that the MEZZA PLATTER and LAYALY MIXED GRILL PLATE ended up being my go-to for every follow up visit. Everything was well seasoned and the meats were tender and juicy. I always ask for extra yogurt sauce because I am ADDICTED to that stuff. I could use it as a dip for everything.

I still recall how the first time I went, 3 of us dove into our meal completely famished and we still weren't able to finish everything because though everything was good, the portions were also extremely generous. 

I wish they were closer, because I would definitely make this my go-to when I start counting calories and choosing protein over carb again in a few days.
author: Asha S.

description:
I order only through grub hub. They used to be great, the food was always prompt, and hot. We live about 15 blocks from Layaly, and lately we've been experiencing 2 hour waits for simple chicken wraps. They consistently over promise and under deliver on their wait times. Today, I waited 1 hour and 45 minutes, ( 25 minutes past when they said they would deliver ) and the food arrived cold. Like really cold. For $40 I got cold food and an almost 2 hour wait. I've been patient because I like their food, but now the food quality appears to be suffering as well. 

I complained to grub hub and got $5 off my next meal. Lame. Probably won't be ordering from here again.
author: cherie g.

description: Have wanted to eat here for a long time. I am usually in the area only at lunchtime when they are closed. So met a friend for dinner last night. The Meza Platter appetizer was worthy. The salmon and stuffed eggplant entrees were average and seemed to have little if any Mediterranean nuance. The most noteworthy aspect of this experience was that the temperature inside was only slightly warmer than the 50-55 degree F outside. The few customers in there were wearing big coats and hats. The waitress was in a hoodie. When asked about the temperature she indifferently remarked that the restaurant did not have a heater. When probed further, she pointed to a small portable space heater elsewhere in the room next to a table with the only other customers. Should have walked out right then. Ordered and stayed but really regret it. Really tacky.
author: Noel S.

description: Maybe i got them on a bad day? But man, the hummus was way off as was the babaganoush.  Not sire if I will try again, seems like two dishes they should be able to get right.
author: Rex L.

description: Gf got the Chicken Wraps was great price $12,  good amount of fries(good seasoning) decent sized sandwich. I got the tabbouleh... I wanted something light,  $7 it was nothing but parsley, and very faint amount of Bulgur wheat... OK,  everyone does tabbouleh a little different,  but I got it in a pint container that was 3/4 of the way full... So basically a cup of chopped (well seasoned)  parsley for $7...guess you have to make up some food cost somewhere... Won't be getting that again.
author: Nicholas P.

description: I really like Layaly. I've been there for brunch, take-out, and dinner. I enjoy their shakshuka and turkish coffee. Service was very warm and kind.
author: Ryan Y.

description:
Ordered from GrubHub at 8:45 tonight and was told the food would be ready between 10:15 and 10:25. A long time to wait but with a long night of work ahead it seemed worth it to have something reasonably healthy. 

I get an e-mail at 10:05 that Anton is on his way with my food. Awesome. I only live 11 blocks away. 

45 minutes go by and there is no sign of Anton. I get in touch with GrubHub and find out that my food was delivered to the wrong place. Super confusing since neither my doorbell nor my phone rang. My apartment is also easy to find and I've never had any issues with delivery in the past. And really, who accepts food they didn't order? This guy didn't even bother to get in touch with me when the recipients seemed confused? I'm sure you can just chalk it up to laziness at the end of the shift. 

Now I'm deliriously hungry, have wasted so much time and energy, and still have a ton of work left to do on an empty stomach. To top it all off it's too late to order from anywhere else. 

Thanks for ruining my night.
author: Caitlin N.

description:
After reading some reviews, I was reluctant to dine here.. But I'm glad I did because my veggie kabob was delicious!  I don't even like mushrooms, but the ones they grilled had a nice, meaty texture.

Service was friendly and, at least the time I dined here, atmosphere was calm and quiet.  The prices are reasonable too.
author: Vira P.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I've eaten here, or delivery from here, many times and have been consistently delighted. Their babaganouj, stuffed eggplant, and mixed kabob are all very yummy! 

Maybe the best part of the dining experience at Layaly is their perfect napkin hats. Go ahead, you can wear the hat. I did. 

I am sad that according to some reviews they have not always provided the best service. I've personally never experienced any off-putting behavior from the staff.

Anyway, I haven't written many Yelp reviews, but I thought I'd write one for Layaly after being so happy with them :D
author: Rae B.

description:
This is the second time I have been here. And last Friday was with 3 friends and my bf and we all had wonderful meal! I ordered chicken wrap with salad on side and the the first time I was here I ordered the lamb chops. 
Everyone ordered different things and had a great experiences.
The service is great, the price is reasonable and the place is super clean!! 
We are going to go back and all my friends are raving about it!!
author: Ty N.

description:
I love it when online deals stretch my boundaries and bring me all the way to Outer Richmond - I hardly come out this way but I know the restaurants out here are yum too!  

We had:

* Mezza Platter (Hummus, Baba Ghanouj, Haydari, Tabouli, Falafel and Borek with lots of grilled pita to pile on your mezza - mmm, it was hard not to totally devour everything and it was a lot! My fave was the falafel, baba ghnaouj and borek)
* Layaly Mixed Grill Plate (Kofte, Chicken, Beef, Lamb, Shrimp, Zucchini and rice - this was a generous grill plate, I was rather full from the mezza platter, but I enjoyed the chicken and zucchini very much, flavorful, tender, filling, it is going to be good as leftovers tonight too)
*  Baklava (sweet, crispy, I could only have a bite because I was so full, but will enjoy it as leftovers tonight as well)
*  Glass of Zinfandel from Lodi (nice combination with my meal)

Our waitress was super friendly and she took the time to explain everything on the menu, the origins of the dishes, the pricing on our receipt after the online deal was calculated.  Really really lovely dining experience all around.  I would definitely be back.  Nice find!
author: Maile N.

description: Layaly is my favorite spot in the Richmond. My biggest problem when I come here is its hard to decide what to get. Every one of the appetizers sounds delicious, but my favorites are the borek (filo dough with feta and a yummy dipping sauce) and dolmas. I love the pomegranate chicken tajine, unique sweet flavor, and I think the kofte kebab is my favorite entre (it's a combination of beef and lamb). Their wine selection is great and they always have a house wine for $5. They also have wraps which look really good! It's a great place to have a date night :)
author: Kylie B.
Steffie H.

description: Ordered delivery and everything was fantastic. Quick delivery time and everything was fresh and tasted great. The falafel wrap and lentil soup were both were so good I wanted more. Although a bit pricier than other locations, the quality shows. I was so tired of getting mediocre Mediterranean, Layaly was a nice change! Good stuff.
author: Nathan L.

description:
Best mezza platter I've ever had. You really have to love how soft the pita is, first of all. It's a perfect complement to each of the "dips" on the platter. The hummus is amazingly creamy. The haydari is perfect - like a yogurt/cheese hybrid. The baba ganouj was delicious and a little smoky in flavor. Tabouli served as a nice garnish but was a little too tart to eat on its own.
As for the entrees, I would suggest trying the mix grill. The steak and the lamb were a little tough to eat but all the meats (shrimp, lamb, shicken, steak, kofte) were well seasoned. The arugula salad on the side was really tart but we cooled that down with the leftover haydari.
The braised lamb shank could have been a little less bland but it could not have been tenderer. Unfortunately, the couscous that comes with it was dry, so dry. You really have to combine the grain with the meat juice to make it edible. 
The baklava at the end of the meal was definitely good, but a little too over-honeyed for my taste. Still crispy and exactly what I'd expect, though.
Good service for the first half of the meal anyway (when it's not busy).
author: Ruobin W.

description:
Ordered delivery from there the first time the other day. Food came fast enough and it was mediocre. The most disappointing thing was after stressing I have a severe dairy allergy numerous times, one of the dish was smothered with cheese and the salad came with ranch dressing. Of course that went right into the garbage. I'll just assume whoever got my order was in a bad mood and wanted diarrhea to befall upon me all night and not because they didn't know what dairy means... 

Not ordering from there again.
author: Aubrey Z.

description: Bravo! This is by far the best Med food I've been able to find in SF. The lamb kebabs had me falling on the floor. So so good. and this was delivered! I'm totally making the effort to eat here in person very soon!
author: Peter R.

description: This is seriously the best middle Eastern food I have ever had. Everything I've ordered is amazing, especially the stuffed falafel salad.
author: John F.

description:
I'm not usually a huge fan of Mediterranean/Greek food. It can get kind of bland in my opinion. Layaly has turned me into a believer! After a late lunch here, I have bookmarked it for the future cravings I'm sure to have. 

The Mezza Platter was a good amount of food and came with a heaping pile of toasty warm pita points. The Kofte Wrap was also above par thanks to a thin pita wrap that was grilled to provide a nice crunch. The side of fries were cripsy and seasoned to perfection. Opa!
author: Rachel Y.

description:
Ate here for the second time yesterday with my coworker.
A dazzling lady with perfectly painted on eyeliner takes our order.
A bathroom in Inner Richmond that isn't the pits. 

Affordable wraps with full flavor and the perfect sauce. I'm picky as hell, "extra this, put this on the side, oh and x, y, z"

The lady nailed it, my coworker not so much but who even cares about him (haha) mine was astonishingly delicious and a good deal, making it even better.

Our order took a while and there were only a few people in there so make sure to only come during off hours for the best service. (I've never done grubHub, so sounds like you'll have to get off your bottom and just walk over.)
author: Alice ..

description: We love middle eastern food but haven't yet found anywhere in SF that has "scratched that itch". We had really high hopes for this place having travelled there specifically. I'm afraid it disappointed a little. Service started off well & became slow, they forgot our appetizer & brought entres after a long wait, they then basically told us we had 15mins to eat our appetizers. It was fairly stressful dining in the end to be frank. On the plus side the food was pretty good & in generous portions, though the hummus was a little creamy for our tastes. We ended up boxing much of it up (aware that we were getting evicted at 9pm!) & took a baclava to share at home, but unfortunately it was minuscule.
author: Fi M.

description:
Had a dine-in experience here and it was great food! No wait for a seat either in the evening. I normally get kabobs when ordering Mediterranean food. Although our meal did include the mixed grill kabobs, that turned out not to be the highlight of the meal. Deciding to try something new, we went with a couple of tajines (clay pot) and they come with a side of rice. And it turned out to be a nice surprise. Here's the lowdown:

Dajaj tajine (Chicken, onion and mushroom in a tomato broth) - Delicious and best dish of night
Tantouni tajine (Beef in a creamy white sauce) - Great flavor and beef was really tender. Second best dish of night
Bazinjan tajine (Beef and eggplant in spicy tomato sauce) - A little spicy but good. Beef was also very tender
Mixed Grill (Beef, chicken, shrimp, lamb) - Didn't get much lamb in this entree and meat was a bit charred. Yogurt dipping  sauce was good. Ok dish.

Good experience and would love to come back to try more of the tajines...
author: Ali F.

description:
I've been to my share of mediterranean restaurants in the bay area, and this one is top notch. Very few places in the city compare! 

From the housemade tea, hummus, and tabouli, to the warm and scrumptious wraps, I highly recommend Layaly. They have great delivery service as well.
author: Kathryn D.

description:
I got this delivered. I pondered the whole time if I should order a Diet Coke with it and then eventually went with no. If I would have ordered the Diet Coke, it would have been the best part of the meal, hands down.

The lentil soup was decent, but I wouldn't order it again. The falafel and borek were equally chewy and tasteless. I was so excited for the chicken wrap, and it tasted like something I'd order at an airport kiosk. The chicken was dry and the tzatziki sauce was watery and gross. 

There was a house salad and that was good. Too bad it was only one corner of my plate.

Ew.
author: Sam D.

description:
Extremely disappointing. Overpriced. Lied to me about the amount of food we were getting. Extremely rude girl on the phone when I called back to ask why my order seemed smaller than it was. With all the amazing places to eat in this neighborhood, why do I have to settle for poor communication, rude staff, small portions and exorbitant prices? 

Never eating here again.
author: Susie C.

description:
We love the mezza platter here. The usual suspects (tabbouleh, hummus, tsatziki, baba ghanoush, falafel) plus these egg roll type things that seem a little out of place, but are fried and crispy so I'll take them.

We've had some hiccups with delivery, but they are usually fast and efficient.
author: Alex L.

description:
We stopped by Layaly a couple days ago and were really impressed with the awesome Mediterranean cuisine they are cooking here. 

My boyfriend and I started with the hummus and pita appetizer, which was really filling and delicious. The pita is warm, and the hummus creamy- just how I like it!

My boyfriend ordered the Beyti for his entree, and though I didn't get to try it he said that it was really yummy. The way that it is cut makes it almost look like an appetizer, so perhaps if you want to eat something lighter this is a good option. 

I ordered the pomegranate chicken tagine. I'm grateful that the waitress gave me a heads up about this dish - the sauce it is cooked in is a pomegranate molasses, which is very tart. Once you know this, it's easier to taste the nuanced flavors of the tart sauce, savory chicken and onion, and earthy mushrooms over rice. A dollop of tzatziki rounds out the flavors as well. The portion was big enough that I had leftovers to take home.

The waitress was truly kind and wonderful, especially because we came in 30 minutes before closing. We will definitely come back to try more of the yummy Mediterranean dishes at Layaly!
author: Liz G.

description: Decided to go to here for dinner with the fam.  The service was great.  We ordered the combonation kabob plate and eggplant tangine.  Both were delicious and very flavorful.  The server mentioned they were going to serve brunch soon so looking forward to trying their food again.
author: Mariam A.

description:
I can't comment on the quality of the food, but I can comment on the quality of the SERVICE ... VERY BAD ....

I ordered food at 6:19 pm.  I know this because I ordered online through GrubHub.com (a product I've used successfully, without incident for years).  When the order was processed, I was notified via text & email (at 6:20pm) that my order would be delivered to me between 7:30-7:40pm.  

At 8:20pm, my order had NOT BEEN DELIVERED.  I decided to cancel my order because Layaly had failed to deliver on the small, typical 1 person meal I ordered.  #COMPLETE_FAIL  (There were no special changes to the order. This was a standard 1 person order off their menu (1 dinner, 1 lentil soup, 1 hummus)).

So, 2 hours after ordering I have NO FOOD and will now eat something crappy for dinner.  #VERY_DISAPPOINTED #TOTALLY_SCREWED_UP_EVENING

GrubHub, at 8:59pm, was able to confirm that after 30+ minutes of trying to contact the restaurant, they were able to CANCEL my order.  Now, 6 minutes after my order has been officially cancelled (and 2 hours and 47 minutes after I clicked the order button), I am posting to the Internet that Layaly's service was VERY BELOW AVERAGE tonight.
author: M S.

description: We love Layaly. Freshly cooked and tasty food, the lamb and Kofte dishes are amazing.
author: Kate M.

description:
YUM!

I LOVE that there is Kibbeh on the menu.  These were delicious but could have been a bit crispier.  However, not many places have KIbbeh and it is one of my favorite dishes. 

I also got chicken kabobs which were good. Chicken was well cooked and flavorful.  Rice was as well.  I didn't care for the salad served with both dishes. 

Nest time I am in the neighborhood I will be back.
author: Katharine A.

description:
We ordered Babaganoush, Hummus and a vegetarian Tajine. All three were okay and well presented but they were missing a certain Je ne sais quois. It was edible but left no impression on me.

 The service was friendly and the place was pretty clean. It's the first place I've seen that charges for extra pitas.
author: Ravi C.

description: Not bad for a dinner break food joint, it was intense. I never had food so good and so price worthy.  The food was really real meaning I actually felt like I was in some kind of Mediterranean city eating the food. It sure beats all the Chinese Islamic food in my town. Come here early to eat otherwise you would be waiting your head off. Aside from other parts of SF which have the super elite food this is a good alternative.
author: Michael W.

description:
Rice has orzo in it and they have no gluten free rice options. 

Appetizers were bland and dry. Kofta Kabob was good enough- only because it had a char flavor and enough salt

Cucumber slices were good. 

Service was feisty and rude.

This place should be 3.5 stars (or less) not 4.
author: S...... p.

description:
This place has great food, great ambiance, and great service.
I neglected to get the name of our server when my boyfriend and I went in for dinner the other night but she was so attentive, nice, and accommodating that it really just made the night go that much more smoothly. 
We had gone in with a Groupon deal and the server was very nice about it and didn't give us attitude about it like I've heard other restaurants and their servers would. She clearly stated what the deal included and was humble enough at the end to offer to change the standard 18% tip that was usually included with it. I declined.
But about our food.. birthday boy ordered the mixed grill, I got the braised lamb shank, and we had the hummus with steak to start. I have to say, that hummus was the best I've ever had. The lemon that they added in it really offset the fatty meaty steak perfectly. That plus fresh soft pita, is heaven. Boyfriend's dish was good; he kept expecting it to be dry and overcooked, because it looked it, but it wasn't. Everything was done right. Same goes for my lamb. It fell right off the bone into the scrumptious broth that I kept ladling over the accompanying fluffy couscous. YUM+ME! :P
I also have to add that we weren't feeling very well (but I had to take him out for dinner on his special day!) but we both ate a lot. That's saying something.
Bottom line: This wasn't our first time there and it will definitely not be our last.
author: Karen C.

description:
Got take out from here for the first time. Owner was very friendly. The kabobs were excellent especially the chicken and shrimp.

Only drawback was that the hummus was a little bland. 

The yogurt dip with dill, etc will make me come back for more.
author: Igor K.

description:
The food was alright.  Dinner entrees are pricey for what you get.  The lamb kabob was really tough and chewy; sea bass tasted frozen and dry even under layers of too much sauce.  Love their mint tea and crab cake appetizer tho.

**Please read the fine print before purchasing a Groupon for this place.  Tax and tip are NOT included.  They automatically charge you 18% gratuity, but service was good, so I didn't argue with that.  

The only thing that felt weird for us was that they charge you tax based on the pre-discounted amount.  So instead of charging tax on the $32 I paid to Groupon, they charge tax on the total $54 of what the food was worth on their menu.  (If I buy a pair of jeans onsale for $20, do I pay tax for $20 or the original $60?)  Overall you end up paying close to $50 for the Groupon deal, depending on what you order - which isn't much of a bargain.  

I'll stick with their regular menu next time.  Their stewed dishes (not included with Groupon) are way better anyway.
author: Kris L.

description: First 15 minutes we just sit on the table remaining looking around. Next 15 minutes waiter talked to us and got our order. Next 45 minutes, we waited for out food. Mixed grill for two and an appetizer. I bet it would taste good if they did not burn it. It literally was like a charcoal. It was a big disappointment. Never again
author: Hasan Y.

description:
Food was OK, service was not.

I went here last Saturday with a friend, drawn in by the good Yelp reviews. The waitress was friendly enough, but completely messed up our order--blamed me for the mixup--and almost gave our lentil soup to another table (which might have been understandable, if there were more than two tables.)

We ordered a lentil soup, one chicken wrap with no tomatoes, and one falafel wrap. After 15 minutes we got the soup (barely!) and after another 20 minutes, we got two falafel wraps. I was so hungry that I just ate it anyway.

The wraps were OK, but nothing out of the ordinary. Certainly not worth waiting almost 40 minutes. You'd do better at a hole in the wall shawarma joint.

The waitress was nice enough to give us complimentary baklava for the mixup, but I won't be coming here again.
author: Aaron E.

description:
I'm reviewing Layaly for their Groupon, since I've purchased it three times now!! 

This place is great, and I would pay full price any time. They're right by my house, so my partner and I go here for a great date night. We always come home happy and full, with dessert in hand to enjoy later. 

When I've come here, I never need to make a reservation, but I could see them getting filled up on the weekends. I always get the Mezza platter, which comes with dolmas, falafel, yogurt dip, pita, eggplant spread, and fried cheese triangles. Half the things on the plate, we both can't eat, so we usually just bring it home for friends, but we love ordering it anyway. The food is always prepared fresh, and never seems frozen...waitstaff is amazingly kind, and very attentive. 

Mains for us are usually lamb and grilled salmon over rice. Always steaming hot, and aromatic. I love that the veggies served with it are well-seasoned, and only JUST cooked.

Prices are really reasonable, and the groupon comes with dessert (baklava) that you won't even be hungry enough to eat! The wine list is pretty expansive, and they do takeout/delivery if you're not up for leaving home to get delicious food. 

Come on a Friday or Saturday to see their beautiful belly dancer! She's very sweet. :3
author: Charlene S.

description:
Had lunch here after a few hours of plein air painting a Baker Beach.  
We had the Mezza Platter ($14), Feta and Olives ($3) and Lentil Soup ($4). They had wine by-the-glass and they had happy hour house wine for $5 per glass.
Prices were reasonable, food was good, service was good, wine list was OK.
If we are in the area, we would go back.
author: Carol H.

description:
I went with my brother and mom on a Groupon deal that included 1 appetizer, 2 entrees, and dessert. 

It was all really delicious and the portions were generous. 

We ordered the Mezza Platter to start and then the chilean sea bass and the mixed grill. My brother ordered some sort of lamb soup in a clay pot and said it was good. 

The waitress was really nice and attentive and advised us to order the sea bass early since it takes longer to cook. 

A really nice restaurant and would consider coming back if I'm in the area and want Mediterranean food.
author: Alison N.

description:
Mezza platter, delicious! The falafel was soooooooooo good even though it wasn't chickpeas, it's garbanzo beans, it's fried and not greasy! You get 4 dips, the veggie looking one, eggplant, hummus, and yogurt and unlimited pita bread. 

I ordered the layaly mix grilled which came with beef, ckn, lamb, and shrimp skewers on top of this tortilla wrap and had grilled veggies. OMG it's hecka good, ordered for two was $32, but it's decently priced bc you also get two scoop of rice and the skewers were almost 2 of each kind. 

The beer was good too, they had two that was good, one was Almaza and forgot the other one. 

Overall the service was nice, refilled water and what not. The only thing that sucks is parking. It's SF, what do you expect right?
author: Minerva L.

description:
I have eaten at this great restaurant before, hence I had no problem requesting delivery.  Sadly, the food took more than an hour to arrive, it was ice cold and very disappointing.  I ordered the chicken skewers served with rice and arugula salad.  Normally the salad has a fabulous dressing with feta cheese.  The arugula salad was only a sea of greens, the chicken was very bland (in the past it had onions and other veggies on the skewer, but this time only chicken) and the rice had absolutely no flavor.  I also ordered the hummus with pita.  The pita was ice cold and actually tasted stale.  One piece was rock hard and went in the trash.  Not sure what's up and generally I like to give the benefit of the doubt, but I know I will only eat there in person if I go again, as it was a waste of $30 with a tip for cold and terrible food delivered.  

I hate giving bad reviews, especially to restaurants that are usually fantastic!  Not sure what happened tonight. . .
author: Bev T.

description:
We got a Groupon for this restaurant after reading the reviews.  Unfortunately it didn't live up to its billing for us.  The meal started off well and the service was excellent from our waitress all evening.  

My review takes into account the prices which are fairly steep (you'll pay about $46 even with a Groupon not including drinks or extras) so expectations are for it to live up to other options.

The appetizer was very good which was a hummus with Sirloin dish though the meat had a bit of grizzle the dish was quite savory which left us with high expectations.

We ordered the mixed grill plate and Sea Bass.  The mixed grill was fairly bland and the meat contained so much grizzle couldn't eat that part.  We felt it lacked any real flavor or spices though I'm comparing it to those I've had in the South of France while the Sea Bass was indeed pretty good.

The Baklava was so so.  

So for us the food 2 stars
The service 4
The decor 2 1/2
The value 1
author: Tom L.

description:
Being lazy, I decided to order in via Eat24hours.com and found Layaly which is just down the street from the house.  

I ordered an falafel wrap with green salad and lentil soup.  The food came within 45 minutes of ordering so I was pleased.  The wrap was quite large but, OMG, it was sooooo good.  The lentil soup was something I could eat every day.  

Everything was tasty, fresh and totally affordable.  I could barely finish it but I didn't want to save it and have hard wrap the next day so took my time and ate it all up!  I was full but not stuffed, which is a good sign.  

I have to try the other things on the menu and will do next time I am lazy and wanting Mediterranean food.

Yum Yum!!
author: Janette F.

description:
Wonderful, flavorful Mediterranean food with great service. My mom and I split the mezza platter which was great- hummus, baba ganouj, falafel, borek, tabouli, and we substituted the haydari (or something like that) with the dolma. It came with a lot of  warm and soft pita bread. 
My mom ordered the kofte wrap and it came with a salad. The kofte meat was definitely the highlight of the wrap. 
I ordered the tantouri tajine- sirloin in a white wine cream sauce with peppers, mushrooms, and onions. It was some of the best meat I've ever eaten. I don't know how they get the sirloin so soft but it was amazing. Really great spices. And it's served in a cute clay pot and comes with rice. 
The service was also great. The waitress with the pink hair was super nice and helpful. The food came promptly and was served with a smile. 
I'll definitely be returning here soon.
author: Jenn A.

description:
I'm so sad writing this review.  This place has so much potential to be a great Mediterranean restaraunt.  The ambience is relaxing and welcoming the decor of the restaurant is appealing and there is a wide variety of dishes listed on the menu . . . . . they don't just focus on falafels.  

I went to Layaly last night with two of my girl friends.  We showed up around 7:45pm and there were about five other parties eating.  We placed our food order around 8pm and then told the waitress we needed a little more time to decide on a bottle of vino . . . . . . at 8:30 she returned to take our order and we didn't get our Pinot till about 9pm.  The wine was good but seriously I was worrying about driving at that time because I thought the place closed at 9:30.  At this time there was only one other party in the restaurant waiting for their food . . . . . the other tables had their checks.

We got our appetizers (Greek shrimp and Dolmas) at 9pm.  The Dolmas of course were cold . . . . so was the shrimp!  The plates were good, but not fantastic and let me emphasize the shrimp was COLD.  We finally received our entrees around 9:30pm and we were starving, we got the Musaka, and the Beef, Chicken and Lamb Kebabs . . . . . . They were all COLD.  The Kebabs were charred, I know they cooked them on a grill of some sort why didn't they bring them out then!?  The Kebabs at least weren't ground up meat it was all sliced but I hate cold food I feel like I'm eating left overs.  This restaurant NEEDS TO INVEST IN A FOOD WARMER or bring the food out right after it is cooked instead of making you wait 1.5 hours for it.  Again at this time there was only one other table of three people in the place . . . . ?  And I didn't see any to-go orders go out so I have no idea why it took so long.

So much potential, the menu and decor are both appealing, the ambience is great . . . . but you need to wait forever to get your food and when it comes out it's COLD.  Also, there was no soap in the bathroom so bring your hand sanitizer for the chef if you go =/
author: Erin B.

description:
As i am eating cold mediocre falafel i write this review.


It is 9:15pm and we literally ordered dinner TWO HOURS ago at 7:10 pm and it just came to our door. 

Not only is the food cold but it is pretty bland and dry.


It ruined our evening- waiting for two hours for some shitty food. Wish i went to hayes and kebab.

And the delivery guy was not even apologetic. Del hositizee yahmar
author: Kasie S.

description:
I religiously consult yelp when choosing a new restaurant and it's about time I write a review! 

I came with a friend and we ordered the hummus appetizer, which was less garlicky than you might find a store-bought hummus but that I loved, and came with a good amount of pita. Halfway through our meal the waiter even came over and asked us if we wanted more pita. Not gonna lie, as poor teenagers, we were worried it was going to cost us extra but it ended up being free! 

My friend ordered a sirloin tajine without either of us knowing what a tajine is. She ended up enjoying it as the beef was really tender and even the rice tasted good on its own. 

I ordered the falafel wrap with fries, my go-to at Mediterranean places when I'm not looking to drop more than $10, but it was so underwhelming. In the past month I've eaten falafel wraps at 3 different places and this was definitely my least favorite - it was just bland. Also, the fries I had were SO salty that even when I wiped them with my napkin I still didn't want to eat them, like how do you mess up fries?!

Food eh, service eh. Overall, I would not make a return trip. Not worth the splurge. (yes, $$ restaurants are a splurge for me haha)
author: Sarah S.

description:
Since I I have started working in the area, the mezze platter at Layaly has been an almost weekly staple of my lunch hours.  The Tabouli is fantastic... lots of parsley and minimal grain, the way tabouli should be!  I LOVE the Baba Ghanouj and eat it sans bread by the forkful... those two dishes alone make a pretty fierce lunch that will keep me coming back again and again.  However, in addition, I have enjoyed the tajine plates, kabobs, and salads as well and have not been disappointed... though, in the end, I mostly go back to the tasty variety of the mezze platter.  The service is always friendly and warm, though the kitchen can definitely move at its own pace at times (meaning, don't expect to pop in and out for a 20 minute lunch), and if you need a caffeine jolt to make it through the rest of your workday, take a moment for the delicious coffee.

If you're in the Richmond, this is a solid restaurant for a midday or evening bite!
author: Kathryn E.

description: Amazing amazing amazing. So nice I said it thrice. This place is awesome. Favorites: mezza platter, any type of kebob platter, pita & hummus.
author: Nick S.

description: I have to read things more carefully.  When it said "Grilled", everything was grilled!  My bass was grilled to perfection, but it was still grilled.  Everything seems to be  blackened.  Grilled would not be my choice.  My friend had the kebab.  It was okay.  The grilled veggie was my favorite, melts in your mouth.  We ordered the baba ghanouj.  It tasted burnt to me, but I was told it was suppose to taste like that.  It was explained that it was "smoked."  I still taste burnt.  We had the Groupon for $29-one appetizer (crab cake) and two entrees and one dessert-Baklava-it needs some more pistachio or nuts.  We still had to pay $24 extra, 18% tips added whether you like service or not.  Tax and whatever extra you ordered.  If we didn't have the groupon, we would have paid $84 for two and we didn't even drink.
author: Helen L.

description: Mezza app platter was excellent with a lovely presentation.
author: Roger Y.

description: Best Greek/Mediterranean food I've found in the city. The chicken and falafel wraps are delicious, along with their hummus and pita. I usually do takeout -partly because I live down the street and partly because sometimes it smells like cleaning products in there. But hey, at least they are cleaning! As far as food and customer service, I have only good things to say!
author: Karina N.

description:
Went here on a Groupon recently with some friends. The food, for the most part, was just mediocre. Our waitress was very nice (hence the extra star), but overall it was disappointing. The musaka (which was recommended, so two of us ordered it) was especially bland. And although the mezza platter was good (not great), you don't get much for the $14. I don't think any of us will be returning. 

p.s. As other Groupon users have noted, an 18% tip was added onto the bill, but for us it was clearly listed, so no accidental double-tipping.
author: jane b.

description: Be aware that the pomegranate chicken can be very heavy on balsamic vinegar. Overall, I would give this place 3 stars.
author: Michael L.

description: I came into this place with average expectations, and they were well met and more. I walked in and was greeted warmly by the hostest and a very relaxed atmosphere. We were quickly served and I greedily dove into my dish. "WOW, THIS IS EXCEPTIONAL!" I remarked. I ordered the chicken kabob and when I bit into it, my mouth exploded with flavor. I went to Layaly, and I fell in love. 10/10, I recommend this place to anyone, come here for a great chicken kabob and a very relaxed atmosphere!
author: Elias B.

description:
A and I came here for a late lunch on Saturday.  There was only one other table occupied.

I ordered the Beef Kabob plate and A ordered the Kefte plate.  Each dish costs $8 and they were the perfect portion size.  They come with salad, a scoop of rice, and two kabobs.

Quick, cheap, and delicious. 

I want to come back and try dinner.

Oh, and try their Pomegranate Lemonade.  Yum.
author: Kris L.

description:
WOW!! Ive been looking for a good mediterranean restaurant for a while. Finally I found Layaly. They serve really delicious  food. 

I went there with three friends in a thursday night.  the waitress was really helpful and she suggested the mix kabob and it was GREAT. I highly recommend this place.
author: Haitham A.

description:
Only ever came in for lunch, the specials are a reasonable value with salad or fries.  Usually do the falafel wrap, some cacik and feta and olives on the side.  Have always wanted to try one  of the tajine entrees.

Service is friendly and with a smile.  Everything is neat and clean, which at some other places is taken for granted.

Never found it too busy, and that was usually lunch on weekends.
author: Ken B.

description:
Have ordered through GrubHub a number of times and things were great until the last few times.  The chicken was delivered completely raw.  Not only is this dangerous, it's pretty disgusting to bite into raw chicken.   I called the first time it happened and spoke to a girl who was very apologetic and told me that they were training cooks and would refund my money.  Two days later, i was refunded, but only $10!  For a $40 meal that was ruined, to refund me only 1/4 of the price was pretty petty.  

Ordered again tonight and while one meal was fine, the other had raw chicken again.   They need to either hire more or better cooks.  At some point someone is going to get sick from thier food if it is not cooked properly.   I contacted GrubHub to let them deal with the restaurant this time.  Not sure I'll order again.
author: Christiane G.

description:
[M]ona: 3.5 Stars
[W]ayne: 3.5 Stars
Average: 3.5 Stars

+ Reasonable Prices
+ Filling
+ Good Portions
+ Accepts Credit Cards

- Slow Service
- Dark
 
[W] We came here because Mona had a restaurant.com certificate from here and it was a great deal. If you come here, I suggest just to stick with the appetizers because you get a lot of different choices to choose from and it's kind of inexpensive to try out many things. So tonight we had nothing BUT appetizers and man, I think we had a little too much haha.
 
[M] We ordered the Borek ("fried fillo dough stuffed with feta cheese and parsley") http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9KeTKDuHdLMhRFku0HAIxw?select=NXVBpB01xZBkdoZOYuGYpQ, Cacik ("Yogurt English cucumber, garlic, mint") http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9KeTKDuHdLMhRFku0HAIxw?select=pbLNNiUlk5C8gIIun2FOPQ, Falafel ("garbanzo with herbs and spices, fried served with tahini") http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9KeTKDuHdLMhRFku0HAIxw?select=oCZIOGfyYBySHDEsocekpA, Garlic Fries http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9KeTKDuHdLMhRFku0HAIxw?select=Tx34Ian7ImSDpfxoOupb_w, Mezza Platter ("hummus, baba ghanouj, haydari, tabouli, falafel, and borek") http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9KeTKDuHdLMhRFku0HAIxw?select=HfDL2S2ZVOI7jwyYWkMJ1Q and a side of rice http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9KeTKDuHdLMhRFku0HAIxw?select=QTDSx9QtiSg9PvJ7aL_6vw.

[W] I personally didn't like the Cacik because the dip was wayyyyy to sour for me. Mona liked it on the other hand. It looked like some sort of thicker dip but it just had a little too much lemon or lime juice in it. 

My 2nd suggestion is that if you get the Mezza Platter, DO NOT get the Falafels also. The platter already has the falafels and the 2 on the platter was already enough for me and Mona. 

[M] The Falafels tasted good at first but it was too fried for us. The insides were tasty but weren't really enjoyable because it's like eating something really burnt and crispy on the outside. 

[W] The other dish that was really good was their Rice haha. You're probably saying Rice? How can that be any good? But yea, trust me, IT WAS GOOOOOD. You really have to taste it to understand me. 
 
The nice thing about this restaurant was that everything comes with some sort of dipping sauce which makes a big difference because if it didn't, I think everything would be extremely dry. 

The only thing that bothered me was that the host was more attentive to his customers in their little secret back room. I guess this place has a hooka lounge in the back because people were walking out of nowhere from the back of the restaurant. That was kind of weird in my opinion because we're sitting in a restaurant and here comes some stoned people walking out of nowhere. I think they should have another entrance for those folks. That lead to another problem which was not being attentive to your other paying guests i.e. US.
