We were done eating for a while and nobody was on the dining floor to assist us. So we just had wait until someone came out of the hooka room I guess. I guess that service could've been better. Oh well.  3.5 Stars.
author: Mona C.

description:
I always give people/businesses a chance to redeem themselves before making any harsh judgments, and I must say that Layaly went above and beyond in making up for a crappy delivery experience with them.  Last night, it was raining and they were slammed & apparently dealing with some employee issues, so my grubhub order came an hour after the ETA and was cold and missing items.  I called about it this morning and was pleasantly surprised when I got a call back.  Not only did I receive an apology, but also a free delivery of lots of delicious food AND a bottle of wine.  I hadn't experienced this level of customer service, well, ever.  I think my faith in humanity might even be somewhat restored.  
Also, their food is great!!  Thanks Layaly!!!
author: Nicki L.

description:
We came here well on a double date because 1) the bf didn't want to eat any more asian food (weird i know) and 2) he was working so we needed to eat somewhere on the Richmond side of stuff. 

I ordered the lamb and the boy ordered the salmon kebobs. It was REALLY good. Lamb was so tender and delicious. The salmon was delicious as well, very well cooked and portions are really big, but oh so good.

Overall, we had great service, and a wonderful time with friends.
author: Nina Y.

description:
My boyfriend wanted to come here after driving past this place a lot. Took us a while to figure out where it was... because he had an idea of where this place was but not exactly sure. We almost gave up looking for it but I told him to try one more block and we found it! 

We came here for lunch and my boyfriend wanted the baba ghanouj while i wanted hummus. So we ended up ordering the Mezza Platter as an appetizer. We were amazed by how much they gave us and it came with a basket of flat bread. I didnt want baba ghanouj because i didnt like eggplants, but it was actually really good. My fav was the hummus and baba ghanouj. The haydari was ok... the mint made me think of toothpaste... and the tabouli had parsley in it which I dislike. The falafel was yummy though and so was the borek.

I ordered the Falafel Wrap and it was sooo yummy. it was a little dry but not too bad. It has hummus inside but it was even better when I added more hummus (from the platter) and baba ghanouj. I ordered fries with this and was amazed how well the fries were cooked. The outside was crispy but the inside was really really soft.

My boyfriend had the sauteed chicken. I took a bit of it and the chicken was cooked really well, but I think it should have more flavor (or maybe i didnt eat enough of it.) My boyfriend enjoyed it though, he finished the whole thing.

This place is really good. Definitely will come back.
author: Alicia W.

description: I usually don't like Mediterranean food, but today I was feeling adventurous and decided to order some food from this place. For my surprise it was delicious. Loved it!
author: Ana Carolina J.

description: Have ordered from here in the past and liked it. Tonight delivery took almost 2 hrs. They called and said the driver had just left and would be here in 10-15, then called 15 minutes later to say the driver was another 10-15 out. I was calling to cancel the order when he called. I excitedly dug into my food and found a chunk of beef in my mixed grilled vegetables.
author: Kathryn H.

description: I love this place. They deliver, and the food is always awesome! Huge portions. The mezze platter and the chicken kabob plate is enough for two for sure! I love the bubaganoush! The chicken is grilled perfect.
author: Alicia S.

description:
Service was outstanding.  One waitress doing EVERYTHING for the whole restaurant.  Came in on a Thursday and place was packed with patrons.  More and more people filtered in but the wait was negligible.  We had reservations and were seated right away.  

As full as the restaurant seemed, nonetheless, the waitress was extremely efficient and remembered to follow through on every request.

Food was GREAT.  We enjoyed the Rack Of Lamb, Beef Kebab, Chilean Bass Entree, and Grilled Shrimp Entree.  Food was outstanding although the portions for the bass was a bit small.

For appetizers, we had the Hummus Billahm and the Crab Cake.  The hummus dish was really tasty.  I would order that one again.  However, the crab cakes came as two patties and did not stand out an anything extraordinary.  That dish felt overpriced and not worth it.  

I would come again to this restaurant.
author: Victor T.

description:
This is my absolute fav Mediterranean restaurant in the city! I don't even care that I have to circle around the neighborhood for parking. It's that good. I love their Mezza Platter as it has an array of different treats, like hummus and taboulah. Forget about the rest of their menu! Well, their Mixed Grill is amazing! Oh, and not to mention their desserts! Drools. 

Did I mention that their portions are typical American? As in ginormous? After a Bikram Yoga Seacliff class, two girls can fill up on the Mezza Platter!!! 

This place is soooo good that I have converted my "hard-to-please" friend who has a strong preference to frequent Chinese restaurants only! That is all! Just go to Layaly's already!  

And the cherry on top is that they have excellent service! My water glass was always full. :)
author: Mabel Y.

description: Everything we had was delicious. Everything. My friends said it was the best Mediterranean food they had ever eaten and I have to agree. So many layers of flavor with plenty of garlic and lemon and olive oil in all the right places. And to think most of their entrees are only $8. You can't go wrong with this restaurant. Service was friendly and attentive. I will definitely be back.
author: Melissa H.

description: Had a wrap, very bland. This is food court food, nothing great.  Actually, I had better tasting food at the Stonestown food court. Will not return.
author: AL H.

description: This place has a nice atmosphere, I definitely recommend this pace for lunch and dinner. The food is really good and fresh, also the prices are not bad. I ordered the chicken kebab plate and baba ganoush, both were great! I can't wait to come back! Go here and give it a try!
author: Tom T.

description:
UNDER NEW OWNERS!

Service is enthusiastic and very good. But the food has slipped a little, not quite as exciting as our first visit in Feb 2010, and the portions have been reduced a little. Kebabs (we tried three different ones) were a little overcooked this time, although the cubes are good-sized.

Mezza platter was good, but the borek is not as interesting as before and tabouleh was good, but did not excite us the way it did back in February. The baba ghanoush (eggplant), kefir cheese, and hummus are still excellent, however, and the pita triangles are soft and warm.

After our first visit we ranked them ahead of Oasis in Pleasanton, a similar restaurant (although the menus are quite different). Now - they are a tad below Oasis, although still very good.
author: Jean K.

description: AMAZING!!! Breaks my heart to not see this place more busy! Usually the only people in the restaurant. The portions are big! The quality and taste of this food is out of this world! My favorite is the Mezza Platter. I hope this place never goes out of business or I will cry because it's hard enough to find an outstanding, thirst craving Mediterranean food as is. Favorites: Tzatziki dip, dolmas and the spanakopita egg rolls. The chicken wrap and chicken kabob plate.
author: brook f.

description:
My friend knows the owners and have been here a few times for the meza platter and some delicious wine

I've Ordered:
+Baba ghanoush is made VERY well
-Ahi Tuna salad 
-Vegetable kebob
-Meza platter

The restaurant is very clean and the owners are very sweet and sincere.I would have given this place 5 stars, however when I placed the order to go it was a different experience. It says on the website it will arrive in about 45 minutes or so.........but it took over an hour and when the food arrived it was cold. When my friend called to check up on the order to make sure it was fulfilled (we ordered it online) the lady on the phone gave my friend an irritated attitude. 

Conclusion: This restaurant makes their food with love and passion. However, don't order it togo unless you like eating cold food.
author: Julia D.

description: This is my second time here.  The first time I came, I had the lamb shank which was very good.  I was very disappointed the second time I came here and had the lamb kabobs which was so tough I could barely chew it.   I thought I was going to choke.  Lastly, we ordered the baklava for dessert and all we got was these two tiny little sliver pieces.  Boy do they skimp.  I doubt I'll be coming back.
author: Terry S.

description:
3.5 stars * My friends decided to make a dinner date at Layaly at 8pm Monday. Not know what type of food this place served, and doing what must of us do, I YELPed it. Mediterranean... I was never a big fan on Mediterranean. I always found it bland and empty. However given a 4 stars and knowing mediterranean food is one of the healthiest diets around (watching what I eat lately). I wanted to give it a taste. 8pm this place was quiet. Then again aren't most place quiet around this lower Clement?


Friend 1- Beyti ground sirloin, and lamb, wrapped in lavash bread, tomato sauce   $13

Looked like stuffed meat wrapped like a burrito and cut in half, topped with tomato sauce. Tomato sauce was good. The meat wasn't too greasy. Mouth size. Good.

Friend 2-Layaly Mix Grill kofte, chicken, beef, lamb and shrimp $24
 (he would get this...) 

Me- Kofte Kebab ground beef and lamb (4), onions, and fresh herbs   14

Very simple ground beef and lamb kebab. I couldnt tell visually which kebab was beef or lamb. Came with a side of wild rice. It was delicious better than I expected. Right texture and flavor of the meat, with the dipping sauce BOMB!

Mezza platter hummus, baba ghanouj, haydari, tabouli, falafel, and borek   14

A MUST TRY. Hummus was my favorite. Just the right amount of salt. Baba ghanuj didn't have much flavor, haydari was good and creamy, and the borek was not memorable to me and looked like a skinny a fried egg roll. 

I have to give this place 3.5 stars

3.5 stars- Nice place you can take a date here. Food was higher than my expectations, flavoruful, variety on the meun., and the dished come out  like works of art. HOOKA!

-1.5 stars- Service and food was little slow. A group after us got their food before us?!, little on the pricey side for what you get in portions.
 

I'D come back best Mediterranean I had by far... BTW its also a Hooka restaurant. Though I didnt smoke the hooka, when I go back for hooka i'll updated.
Cheers!
author: Brent W.

description:
My God. I love this place. There is absolutely NO REASON AT ALL why this restaurant isn't packed to the gills every night. The food and service here is simply top-notch. We get the mezza platter every time and it never fails to amaze us how delicious everything on it is. My personal favorite dish is the braised lamb shank. It is absurd how satisfying and wonderful this meal is. 

Bottom line: stop reading these reviews and just eat here already!
author: Raymond P.

description: A couple of nights ago, I was very tired so we decided to order in. We picked Layaly. This was the first time ordering from there and I must say it was a great find. the food was good, we had the chicken wrap and kebab and off course Baklava. Everything was made to perfection. The service was great also. the food was delivered in record time. I especially liked the fact the food was still warm and in tact when it arrived. Sean the  Driver was very nice and pleasant, this being our first time ordering from Layaly, he actually spent time telling me about the food. Next time I will order is recommendation of Fatoush salad and the side of vegetable. Thank you Sean.
author: Timothy R.

description:
The Skinny:

Really great food
great presentation
great service - our waitress was very friendly and warm
Restaurant plays nice cultural music (for example, not a fan of listening to rap music at a Thai restaurant)
Seating was comfortable - Monday night was quiet, we had the place to ourselves

Details:

We got the mezza plate which has all the usual middle eastern suspects on it - hummus, tabouli, falafel, tzatziki, etc - all yummy

I had lentil soup which was delicious and a Greek salad which was good (light - not oily)

Interesting note: they have nightly specials for only $10 which, last night were two choices: pomegranate chicken with rice and a steak special with veggies and rice. My picky gf liked the chicken.

We intend to return. Grab the restaurant.com coupon before you go for your first time.
author: Chris G.

description: Please update your timings on yelp. Drove all the way at 4 PM and you guys were closed
author: Neha M.

description: Awesome place for Arabic food . Coming from Arabic background , I find the food could be better that what I have eaten back home ... It's really a place worth to be visited
author: Yousef A.

description: I ordered from here again and was very pleased. Got the Mezza platter and it is the best spreads I've ever had! Everything was great and I asked for no cheese and they totally omitted it. Yay!
author: S. M.

description:
Dropped by for lunch while shopping in the neighborhood. The place was virtually empty 1pm on a Sunday. Ordered one of the "lunch specials"--lamb kabob, rice and salad, and a Lebanese beer that I'm fond of. I asked for the lamb as rare as you can get it--just sear the outside.

The waitress/hostess (there seemed to be only 3 people working in the restaurant) was super attentive and very friendly. The lamb was deliciously seasoned, but cooked medium well, and there were only 4 tiny 1" square morsels matched with 4 slices of grilled sweet pepper total--split across 2 skewers. The rice was unseasoned (albeit a dozen or so grains were yellow as if they'd been scented with some sort of stock.) The salad was well turned out with unusual greens and a tasty dressing. 

The caveat? $11 for that plate. Seriously overpriced. Will risk a dinner visit for comparison purposes, but unless you've got money to burn, or are trapped in the Richmond and can't hit up say... La Mediteranee, not recommended.
author: Ninotchka D.

description:
I've been here a couple of times with my girlfriend, and it is a solid restaurant.

The exterior is a a bit nondescript, but the interior is quite nice. It is very clean, fairly simple, but nice.

My girlfriend loves the salmon, and I'm a huge fan of the kofte. If you're not sure what you want, there is a mixed grill plate that comes with several different kinds of meat. That plate is served with rice.

In addition to the rice plates, they do also have wraps and tajines. This is definitely not a cheap place to eat a quick dinner, and it isn't exactly high class dining, but it is a solidly middle dining experience. Definitely a good place to eat and worth a try if you're looking to try something new. It also makes for a great date spot.
author: Tonichi L.

description:
Turkeyhopper.

Lunch was nothing to complain or rave about. Wrap featured plenty of grilled chicken, veggies, hummus (on request) and a side salad, but it was nothing I'll remember a few weeks from now.

Turkish coffee finish was a good call.

Prices are as you'd expect in a sit down restaurant. Ten bucks for the wrap. Service was as kind as before, perhaps a little forgetful on the water and napkins.

Most memorable will be the conversation.

The Tablehopper (you don't subscribe? fix that: www.tablehopper.com/) recently returned from Turkey with plenty of recommendations on things to do and places to eat. Very timely. I'm going shortly.

Dinner is still recommended. As is the Tablehopper.
author: Jason B.

description:
So sad to hear that they no longer have hookah but that was obviously to accommodate the SF ban.

In any case, the service is awesome! And food was super tasty. I ordered the kofte kebabs which came with a rice pelof and grilled veggies and my friend ordered the lamb with couscous. The lamb was especially flavorful. Also, we ordered individual glasses of wine and they gave us our second glass for only a penny! I've been here before but it has been a while. Their food has always been good but I think it has gotten even better! Definitely coming back :)
author: Alex M.

description:
Come here only if you have hours to wait!  Don't come if you are starving, you won't get your food quick.

Foods ok, I tried the hummus with steak (the best of the entire meal), Greek shrimp, mixed grills, pomegranate chicken, and a few other.  I agree with some other reviews, the kabobs are slightly too burnt.  

Services - they do have enough servers to manage in house customers, but the kitchen does not have the capacity for  in-house guest + to-go orders.  It took a loooong time for food to come out!!!
author: Jen C.

description:
First impressions are important, and Layaly did come to the forefront as a pleasant and tasty experience worth doing again. We had lunch - falafel salad and chicken kabobs. Both were tasty, although I would go a little lighter on the craisins in the salad. Falafels were light and tasty, as well as the chicken. I saw several delicious-looking plates come out, so I will definitely go back to try them.

Service was pleasant and relaxed, but efficient. Layaly really is a neighborhood gem, and a great food adventure as well.
author: P C.

description:
I got tricked to come here by their deal on Scoutmob - 50% off up to $15 but what they don't tell you is that's only valid for dinner. Had I known, I would've much rather went to Gordo's or the new Russian place near by today. 

The restaurant was completely empty, during lunch on Friday which seems reasonable as I don't see too much demand for sit-down lunches in the Outer Richmond. The food still took ~15 minutes to come which tells me it's made fresh but also that I might've not made it back home on time for my meeting.

I got the kofte wrap and dolmas, both were pretty good and the wrap came with a salad. I have nothing bad to say but also nothing wow'ed me there.
author: Tatyana K.

description: I ordered delivery tonight at 7:12pm and it arrived at my door @ 8:33pm. Now, I completely understand a busy Friday nights but come on now. I called 3 times about it and to say the guy on the other end was aloof is being kind. Shockingly bad phone manner and the 4th time I called they did not answer the phone at all--really, they did not answer the phone! This was the 4th time I have ordered because the food is solid for delivery but the poor customer service tonight has cost them a customer.
author: Corey T.

description:
We've eaten lunch here two days in a row now :) The service is great - friendly and hospitable, water glasses never empty. The atmosphere is classy and elegant. The food is delicious! The chicken kabob is the best ever - large chunks of all white meat chicken, perfectly marinated in something delicious, cooked until a bit crispy outside and juicy and tender on the inside. Yum and so flavorful!

The labneh was AMAZING. The hummus and Tabouli were great, and the pita was just right - soft, fresh, and warm.

The portions could stand to be bigger, but everything was delicious and the staff/owners were great. Definitely recommend.
author: Ashley S.

description:
Bummed to pay this place a visit only to find out that due to some sort of city ordinance, they no longer serve Hookah here. :(

But if you can ignore the fact that the Hookah attraction has closed, you'll still come to find that they have delicious food. The dips on the Mezza Platter were zesty and creamy, the Felafel were hot and crunchy, and the lamb was flavorful and tender. 

A great place to go for reasonably priced and delicious Greek cuisine. Zeus would be proud.
author: Jeffrey J.

description:
Came here by accident, which was probably a good thing to begin with. I was drawn in by their "$7 lunch special." I thought, what a deal! The last time I had Med. food, it cost me my current paycheck, and the paycheck after.

I didn't expect much quality or quantity wise due to the price, but I was pleasantly surprised. I got the sauteed chicken plate and it came with a nice helping of rice and chicken. It was tomato based and had a lot of nice flavor... And it filled me up!

The staff is very friendly and attentive, another bonus. I wouldn't come here all the time because parking sucks, but if I'm ever in the neighborhood for lunch, this is definitely a place I'd wanna go to.
author: Sara K.

description:
Here we are . . . December rolls around again and it's time to celebrate Sis' s birthday.  What will we be eating? . . . Thai again?  Oh no!  She searches through Yelp and chooses Layaly.  Why?  She loves lamb and she already knew what she wanted to order even before arriving at the restaurant!  . . .  The Mix Grill???!!!  It was an excellent choice and Layaly did not disappoint.

Calling to make the reservations, a delightful lady with such a personable and soothing voice quickly answers the phone and takes down our info.  We're off to a good start!

It was a Tuesday night and we had great parking karma, finding a space less than half a block away.  Layaly is a quaint and comfy place and we were seated quickly.

The meal:

*  Hummus - A very generous serving, presented as a mound with a beautiful swirl like a huge frozen yogurt, and topped with an olive.  The hummus was smooth and the tartness was perfect!  The server even gave us an extra serving of pita bread!  Nice!

*  The Layaly Mix Grill - What a meal!  Sis and Mom ordered this for two, which is a better value.  Each person gets a kofte (ground beef and lamb), chicken, beef, lamb, and shrimp kebab with onions and peppers, along with a hefty serving of rice and grilled vegetables.  OMG!  Who can eat all of that?!!!  Well, Sis did! . . . That shows how good it was!  Mom didn't have quite as big an appetite and had to bring her leftovers home . . . and given an extra serving of the cucumber yogurt sauce.  Thank you!

I sampled a piece of each of the different kebabs and found the chicken, beef, lamb, and shrimp all to be tasty, tender, and juicy.  Delicious!

*  Kofte Kebab -  My order which is a mixture of ground beef and lamb with onions and herbs, along with bell peppers.  You also get a serving of rice and grilled vegetables.  I found this a little drier than expected but I found the meat to be tasty with the slight gaminess of the lamb.  Dipped in the yogurt sauce and it was yummy!

Layaly's menu is quite extensive and includes other entrees such as fish, shrimp, various lamb dishes, eggplant, and musaka.  They also offer various wraps, tajines, appetizers, and soups and salads.

Thank you Layaly for the delicious meal, excellent service, and enjoyable birthday celebration!  We will meet again!
author: Karen L.

description:
The food and the service are both fantastic. Two of us had the meze platter which we thought was excellent. The baba ganoug smokey and creamy, the tabouli full of good fresh Italian parsley, and the huumus perfectly spiced with garlic. This was accompanied by some excellent soft, warm pita.
We then had the mixed grill for two and the flavors were wonderful, each different for the chicken, shrimp, lamb and beef. We are big eaters and could not finish everything.
We had five glasses of wine and felt the price for everything was very fair.
author: ted t.

description: Ordered delivery from Layaly for the first time on a whim thru eat24 and I have to say we enjoyed The Best dinner tonight! Delivery was faster than expected and the food was so good and fresh. Their prices are steep but I'd definitely order again.. maybe with fewer choices to lower the tab, but the quality is worth it. Very good food, not one miss.
author: Christina B.

description:
Randomly chose this place for our girls night out and glad we did. The food was really good and it wasn't loud or crowded even though it was a Friday night, so it was great for us to catch up with one another. The service was very friendly and when asked if it was enough food, she was honest and even told us not to order more.

- Ahi Tuna Salad: excellent! light and the citrus dressing was good
- Layaly Mix Grill: kofte, chicken, beef, lamb and shrimp were all good and flavorful. beef and lamb were my fav's
- Salmon: tender with a nice crust
author: Linda C.

description:
My wife and I need to thank GroupOn for bringing us to this excellent Mediterranean restaurant. 

My recommendations below are based on our picks during our visit: 

Appetizer
Hummus w/Sirloin-(Delightful appetizier to begin the feast) 

Entrees-
Lamb Kabob (Generous portion size which may be good for 2 people) 
Mixed Grill ( Again-generous portion that provides a sampling of all the great meats they have to offer) 

Dessert-
Baklava (Not the best I've had but fairly average for what it is) 

Wish we could have hit the place for lunch as opposed to dinner. The generous portion sizes along with the excellent service was one for the books.
author: Sanju R.

description:
Great food!
The meze platter. Lamb in every possible configuration. Veggie stew stuff. Yum. I'm hungry just imagining these dishes....

And because this place is typically (surprisingly!) empty, they offer great service by default.

My boyfriend and I went three times and had the same waiter/owner, who delivered a special brand of comedic entertainment. This guy should do stand up too.

I've heard the city has shut down the hookah bar in back but for a time that was also great entertainment.

We've been more recently and there's a new waitress working. She made a few mix ups with our meal (for a larger group), but the personalized service, excellent recommendations from the house, and low key atmosphere make this our go to place for a chill  'date night' in the Richmond.
author: Ek M.

description: Fortunate to have the new Sunday brunch. Great reviews all around our table. Especially the potatoes! Excellent Arabic Coffee as usual. And extra pleasant experience due to graceful, friendly server. Second time there. Definitely will be going back to this fine little spot in the Richmond.
author: Peter H.

description:
Just got Layaly delivered for the first time.  Admittedly the food is good, but the portions are TINY for the price.  Seriously, the Mezza plate is itty bitty.  You can get 50% more of the same dish at Park Gyros for half the price, and that is not at all an exaggeration.  I can always eat the PG leftovers for lunch the next day, but definitely not going to have anything left over from Layaly.

Sadface.  The food is really good...just not worth the much higher price.
author: Dale M.

description: This is for delivery since we haven't actually made it out there yet. The wraps are super tasty and huge (it usually provides two meals for me). I love their Layaly Mix Grill and hands down, their hummus is trully coveted in this household. Oh yes, and of course the dolmas. So while I haven't tried just everything yet, I can't wait to because it's all been quite tasty.
author: Shauna S.

description: I had passed by a million times and finally tried it out. Really good! Grilled mix plate was awesome.  Perfect for 2 to share with the Meze sampler.  Romantic inside, friendly cool hostess. Price is right and I noticed on grubhub they even deliver!
author: Chelsey G.

description: Great falafel! Definitely use the Scout Mob deal, it's crazy cheap then. Love this place.
author: Malkov D.

description: One of the better Mediterranean places in the city. Flavorful & accommodating with substitutions to make entree on the healthier side. Chicken kabob dish and hummus is great!
author: Lina G.

description: Great place. Came here with the whole family and also do take out. Good kebabs (had lamb and chicken), mezza platter and drinks. Good size portions and friendly service.
author: Jason O.

description:
One of the best Middle Eastern Restaurants in town.

I went there twice and we got to try a big selection of their food.
Try the crab cakes, they are different then any crab cake you've ever had!Delicious!
My husband had the Lamb, it was beyond delicious!We loved it!
I have the Chilean Seabass, one of the best seafood dishes i ever tasted.The sauce the chef makes is perfect!

Also the presentation of the food is superb!
It's a little quiet place on Clement, so if you want good middle Eastern food, and a cozy environment, you need to visit Layali!
author: Catherine K.

description:
READ THIS BEFORE YOU BUY THE GROUPON!
scenario: 2 people, for dinner at 5 when they open, in an empty place.

This place gouges you  with a mandatory 18% tip on your bill because you are a groupon customer!!! The waitress factored in the tip including the tax!!! and said that it was on the fine print of the groupon description. I ordered a separate dish to go and her calculations came to around $100 for a $29 groupon + $14 takeout. Being so shocked, I paid it and checked the "fine print" later.  What a shyster. All I can surmise is that the restaurant is so chintzy that it acts in bad faith to recoup the money back that they lost from the goupon deal. 

I would NEVER EVER GO BACK NOR RECOMMEND THAT ANYONE GO THIS AWFUL PLACE!

btw, groupon says that they will respond back within 24 hrs when you call or write. It's been a week and half now and no resolution there. Thanks for nothing groupon!
author: kim y.

description: This was quite a disappointment. I've had Mediterranean food before and it was great. While the appetizer sampler was good. The main entree beef kabob was TERRIBLE. Very bland and very tough to eat. It was quite a let down, my boyfriend never had Mediterranean food before and now he never wants to eat it again! This place ruined it for him
author: Krystal M.

description:
For $20, you can get a really good, decent meal.  The kebobs might not look like it's much meat, but towards the middle of my meal, I could barely finish my first kebob. 

Clean, bright and warming.  Excellent dishes and made me a fan of Mediterranean food!
author: Nancy S.

description:
You know what?  This place is good.  Really good.  Doesn't really look like your neighborhood 'comfort' food place, so you never see this place packed.  Too bad.  It's really good stuff!

We shared the Mezza Platter that came with hummus, falafal, baba ganush (sp?) tabouli, and other tasty treats.  Comes with a big bowl of flat bread.

For entrees, hubby and I shared the Mixed Grill for two.  Wow.  Two skewers each of their kebobs - chicken, lamb, beef, shrimp, and kofta (mix of lamb and beef).  Comes with two 'scoops' of rice and a special yogurt sauce.  Everything was cooked perfectly.  All the meat was tender, and went perfect with the sauce.  We brought half of it home.

Apparently, we had order the same thing, about 3 years ago, but I totally forgot how good it was.  Or maybe it's better now?  I can't imagine not coming back to this place in three years if it was this good.  Anyway...

My parents ordered the rack of lamb (i think it came with 4 or 5 chops!) and the braised lamb shank.  Delicous!  The lamb shank was soooo flavorful, and fall off the bone tender.  Dad loved it.  The rack of lamb also looked amazing.  I'm surprised it came with that many chops.  Usually you only get two.  

Dinner for 4, plus drinks, $110.  Not bad!  Plus leftovers for 2 people.  Can't beat that.

Don't know why we waited so long to eat here again, but it's a new neighborhood favorite.
author: Denise M.

description: We had a groupon which was a great deal. We sprung for the Mezza Player Appetizer ($5 extra with the groupon- but worth it to try everything) which was promptly brought out to us. Our server explained what everything was which was helpful. We both had the mixed grill which was also delicious. But the best part was dessert. We chose the baklava which was amazing. By far one of the best baklavas from a restaurant I have had. I highly recommend this restaurant! Enjoy!
author: Kaitlin M.

description: Delish! I ordered an entree, side and appetizer and it was more than enough for 3-4 people. Decent price and prompt delivery! They must be reading the yelp feedback. Will definitely order again for my hummus, baba ghanoush  and Adana kebab fix.
author: Jessica E.

description: I wish I could give them a higher rating, because the food was delicious.  The Mezza Platter was great to share with so many different but excellent flavors. I really enjoyed my kofte wrap.  Unfortunately my enjoyment was very reluctant as they took over an hour and 45 minutes to deliver my food! This is after they had quoted me with an hour maximum delivery time.  If they had just been honest with how long it would take, I would have waited to order from them on a day they were less busy and ordered something quicker.  I understand that sometimes delivery will take a while, but I can't stand when restaurants aren't honest about how long it will actually take.
author: Ryan C.

description: The hummus is a tasteless paste. The grilled items & tagine are good, but the food is inconsistent: some orders are fantastic, and some tough & flavorless.
author: Akasha A.

description: Happy Day! Darius and I went to Layaly Mediterranean grill after reading the Yelp reviews and the two dishes we shared were definitely good but not great. I should have stuck with my plan to have a wrap as they seem to get good reviews. The restaurant  is easy to find and it was easy to find a place to park. I thought our waitress was wonderful--and the service time was pretty good. The place was fairly empty for 5PM on Saturday. I live in Los Gatos so want to experiment with the hundreds of good restaurants in SF but I definitely recommend you try Layaly if you like Mediterranean food.
author: Patrice W.

description:
This place is awesome! I highly recommend:
Lentil soup- soooo yummy 
Mezza platter- delicious and huge 
Fatoush
Chicken kebab
The fries are a MUST!! 

Check was about $50 before tip which was great considering the quality and quantity. We were only two people so we had plenty of leftovers for lunch the next day =)

Nice decor and great back room. Unfortunately they do not have hookah anymore!
author: Dana S.

description: This is one of my go to spots in my hood when I feel like a glass of wine, greek salad and some smokey baba ganoush. Servers are always friendly and usually a little slow. Place is always clean, they have an ok wine selection and decent menu pricing. They never rush you so it's a nice spot to chat with friends. Love the Mediterranean platter and greek salad, have never tried an entree.
author: Cec D.

description:
This is for their DELIVERY service:  Layaly = "Late Always"

Nearly two hours (despite on-line order which said 50 minutes), stone cold upon arrival (cold shrimp, yuck)...  So, we sent it back. 

All this after several calls to the restaurant where we were assured it was "on it's way." Since we live 5 minutes away, when another 20-30 minutes passed, we knew something was amiss. Furthermore, the woman we spoke with was of absolutely no help - even after 3 calls, she had absolutely no empathy and continued to lie and say it was "almost there"... it wasn't.

To top it off, because we sent it back, we are now having to contact the online order company (Open Dining) in an attempt to get the credit card charge reversed.

While we've had good food from Layaly in the past, their delivery service is HORRIBLE and although this is the first time I've Yelped it, this was not an isolated incident. To varying degrees, this has happened two or three times before.
author: Walter A.

description:
This place is good but I feel they would do much better if they became a reasonable dinner option in terms of cost. I walk  by daily and rarely see more than two tables seated and frequently none at all. Perhaps they have a later crowd.

The hummus is great.

Dinner for 2 including tip $50...I can get better food with larger portions down town for $18 for 2
author: John D.

description: Delivery was fast and food was good, although not scrumptious.  Perhaps I didn't order well, as the lavash-wrapped lamb dish wasn't covered in sauce as I'd been expecting and seemed a bit dry to me.  I'd order from them again, but would read the menu item description more closely first...
author: Jan C.

description:
Terrific Mediterranean Grill with freshly prepared and healthy dishes. 
This place has some of the best grilled vegetables I have ever tasted! 
Great, great, great choice if you want light, satisfying, and delicious dining!

They offer lots of choices of appetizers, salads, soups, and entrees along with sandwiches during lunch. 

Their recipes for their dips and marinades all taste so original, with superior care and attention paid to the quality of preparation and service. 

You just gotta try their flavorful rice pudding for dessert!
author: Richard T.

description:
Great food, great consistency, great service. I always order the lamb kebab here, in one form or another, and it's always been good. 

The Layaly salad is refreshing, I order that with lamb too. 

I've only eaten in once, the service was great. Most times, I do take-out, service was equally great. 

It's been my go-to place for dinner for the past half a year or so when I was too tired to cook or go out, and they've never disappointed.
author: Evelyn C.

description: A heartfelt thank you to Jessika, who served us, Sauri and Jose who cooked, and anyone else who was involved in making our nearly 3 hours of culinary delight as good as it was.  I was very impressed with the attractive plating and appearance of the food itself, it conveys the message of creativity and carefulness in preparation which indicates you folks love what you do!  In turn, the food tasted very good as evidenced by the nearly licked clean plates.  The chocolate cake was delicious and the cardimon laced coffee was a lovely surprise!  Thank you for making our evening such a delight!!!
author: Marian B.

description: I came here after I read the reviews , I love the Jordan food they have here, it was a great to taste the flavors they have here
author: Seaera T.

description:
I'm only go here for the hookah since its the damn best damn hookah lounge I've been around the Bay Area. I recommend not to order food their if you are trying to save money. They only give you small amount of chicken kaboob and it taste too plain. 

       Both hookah and service is god damn great! The dude come by and ask if the hookah need cleaning or more coals. They clean their hookah daily and take care of them. There a backyroom with a roof tent cover over the room from the harsh element. After 9pm or 10pm when they stop serving food, you can smoke in the restaurant.
   
*They don't serve hookah anymore since the stupid law in SF took effect.
author: Richard C.

description:
Last night my boyfriend and relatives came to this spot to check out the Hookah flavors that his sister so raved about as well as the food.
I enjoyed the appetizers here..your best bet is the MEZA platter and ask for extra pita bread. the baba ganouj from what my sister tells me is also good. I love the back patio deck setting for the open air Hookah. The chocolate mint and kiwi strawberry was pretty surprising. I'm no hookah expert and last night was my first time, it was different and pleasant. I would definitely come back, their service was really good, price is reasonable, although portions are a bit small. the place is new so we got there a bit to early to sit in the back area where hookah was available. The back area opens at 8pm and if your coming in,... suggest you call ahead of time to find out. I will definitely come back with my fam here.
author: Ateh M.

description:
We discovered Layaly a few years ago, and it never disappoints. We've been back several times, and they also deliver to a wide area (for free).

Start with the hummus and warm pita. It's creamy and not overpowering, and all too easy to eat too much before your meal arrives. The borek is also a good starter.

There are so many good entrees to choose from. I recommend the Beyti, the Chilean sea bass or the Kofte kebab. 

Good value for the price.
author: Monarch B.

description:
My friends and I came here for the hookah bar. We initially planned on having dinner here but the menu looked pricey. The place was supposed to close at 10 and we got there at 9:50. The guy set us up and told us they usually let the customers stay 10:30 to 11:00 at the latest. He was very friendly and checked up on us regularly. We ordered sex on the beach which was very fruity but I liked it a lot. 

The only thing keeping me from giving that last star is the favoritism. We arrived first and the group of attractive ladies got theirs set up first and he even gave them some cool thing to make bubbles! I was jealous. Anyway, it was only $15 for four of us. I'm not sure what the rate is based on though.
author: Tiffany P.

description: Mediterranean food is the best. Ordered delivery not expecting a lot and was blown away, time to go in for a real meal!
author: Mark C.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for dinner last week with a Groupon offer which was an appetizer, 2 entrees and a dessert.
We ordered hummus with sirloin (appetizer) and it was amazing. I wish I had it for my entree!
Our entrees: salmon (for me) and lamb shank (for my bf). His was amazing, mine was not. Hardly any veggies and the salmon was DRY. 
Dessert was baklava. It was good, but I love anything sweet.
Prices weren't too bad and it's a perfect place for a date. My bf said their lunch is great. I would give this place another try, just don't get the salmon unless you want to massage your throat to swallow it down.
author: Christina R.

description:
big fan of this place! been here twice now and definitely still recommend.

lentil soup - 3/5 stars
sirloin hummus - 4/5 stars probably would have just gotten the regular hummus as it's a lot extra for just some beef on top
chicken skewer - 5/5 stars the meat was heated to perfection
okra clay - 4/5 don't think the menu says but it also includes beef
author: Janet Y.

description: Went back. Every single thing I had complained about was fixed. Fast service, warmer (we sat right next to the fire place), tip not added on automatically. Food was great. I'd go back, let that be the tie  breaker and the deciding visit.
author: Sarah D.

description:
The chicken kebab was probably the best I have ever had and for 7 dollars.......Wow!!!

The appetizer platter for 14 dollars was a little steep considering you only get 4 side dishes to go along with your pita bread.  I would probably just get the hummus by itself the next time.  
The pita bread came out warm and fresh and the hummus and was great.  The portions are a little small.  You will finish the whole thing and probably be still a little hungry after.

My other two friends had the salmon and it didn't taste as fresh as it should.  Overall, I would definitely come back for the kebabs!!!
author: jason g.

description:
Food is serviceable.  Nothing too amazing but decent and at a good price.  If you eat in they also have some decent wines.

Definitely a good option in this neighborhood for a quick meal.  We always try to order without rice and they always fail to meet the request.  Not easy if you're trying to eat paleo which Mediterranean usually offers.
author: Jeff S.

description:
I don't know why this place is always so empty. The menu's a little dull on first glance, but the food is always very good and very nicely presented. Just get the greek salad or a kebab and you'll be surprised at how good they can be. The service is usually excellent and friendly as well. 

Really, my only complaint about Layaly is that - despite the warm, inviting atmosphere - it can feel pretty lonely in there some nights. So go eat there already!
author: Charles B.

description:
Been meaning to try Layaly for a very long time.  Husband and I finally stopped in for lunch earlier this week.  Our meal was okay but at this point, I am not sure we will be back.  

We ordered the olives and feta, the kofta kebab, and my husband had the kofta wrap.  First of all, I wished the olives came before our meal rather than with our meal.  But then, they weren't very exciting anyway--the feta tasted a bit strange to me (I just visited Greece recently and had A LOT of feta and it was so much better than this).  And not to be nitpicky, but the olives tasted like the ones I buy in Costco in bulk and sit in my fridge for several months,  

As for our actual lunches, they were fine.  We both thought the meat was pretty good.  And service was fine as well.  But overall, we both agreed that if we are the mood for Mediteranean flavors, we would much rather go to Troya on Clement.  Oh well, glad we at least tried...
author: Yvette H.

description: Wooooow, the best middle eastern place in town, their kobabs are so good, and the have delicious appetizers,  dont forget to taste the freshly made desert (baklava ), definitely coming back again and again
author: Will H.

description: Got the mezza platter which was excellent, the lamb shank was great (beware, the portion was massive, and I didn't even come close to finishing it). My friends got the Dhanie and Dajaj tajines which I would highly recommend as well. The prices were quite reasonable as well - would definitely go back
author: Karthik K.

description: Groupon was a good deal. Hummus with kabob for appetizer (yum.) stewed lamb (double yum.) lamb kabobs (okay). No sea bass? Bummer! Will call ahead next time. Waitress/Hostess super nice about the Groupon. Groupon works funny so at the end of the night, we paid about $20 bucks for taxation on the total, which means the 1 appetizer, 2 entrees, and dessert (baklava, btw, was amazing) (Groupon $30) was $50.
author: Vicki T.

description: We had a terrible experience. We spent over $30 on two main dishes and one appetizer and there was hardly any food. The smallest portion sizes that I have ever seen. We had to get a second dinner somewhere else because we were so hungry. STAY AWAY FROM THIS RIPOFF!
author: Olivia D.

description: Went to see a friend belly dance.  Two of us split a bottle of wine, lamb chops and mixed grill for one.  Meats came with rice and small salad on the plate.  Definitely enough food. Both chops and mixed grill items were very good, tender and juicy.  Service was fine.  Parking in the area is a challenge, although the waitress told us about an evening lot close by.   I'd call and find out about the lot.  I found a parking spot 4-5 blocks away.
author: Linda S.

description: Went there was my wife last weekend because we had a Groupon. What a find?!! the place was very nice and the food with really good. I had the Mix Grill and my wife had the Chilean Sea Bass both were really good! Definitely going back agin, even though it's a little far from where we live!
author: Bassam M.

description:
Solid three and a half stars. I ordered food on Seamless. It said an estimated 15-20 minutes. I took a shower and headed over. Probably got there 25 minutes after placing my order and I still had to wait another five minutes. There were guests inside the place, so I'm not that pressed about it.  The lady with blonde bangs was super nice to me and I appreciated that. 

The food was delicious. I got some lamb dish and it was so good and filling. It came with couscous and I wish I had more of whatever sauce the lamb covered in. I've never had Mediterranean food before so I can't really judge it against other Mediterranean restaurants, but the food was so good that I will definitely go back and try something else.
author: k h.

description:
Yeah, it's a real wonder this place limps along as badly as it does. The location is prime, but it just doesn't seem to pull in the customers like Hard Knox and Sakura across the street. 

The mezza platter, mixed grill, seabass, sides -- all excellent. It's not just your typical near/middle eastern fare well executed, either. A lot of thought and effort goes into the seasoning and preparation producing vivid flavors and a quality presentation. The grills and kebabs are just great -- strong flavors and aromas, and nothing is overcooked (and that includes the chicken). 

With so many crap "Mediterranean" places in the Richmond/Sunset -- Al Masri, El Mansour etc. -- this place really stands out for its quality and value. Now if only people would give it a chance. They even have Almaza, for god sakes! Go!
author: Wally N.

description: Good hummus and falafels. Lentil soup was really bland. Chicken wrap wasn't great - could have made it at home. Good ambiance - sat on some cushions which was cozy. Service was friendly but slow.
author: NS P.

description:
**OVERALL RATING:  4 STARS ****

So the other evening, on a quest to find parking on Clement, as we circled the block 5-6....7 times...we had "thought" we were aiming to go to the Indian place across the street (but we'd been there many times before and already knew what to expect).   Finally, the parking goddess bestowed on us a great spot...as we're exiting my lovely auto, we spied "Layaly" from across the street with it's "Under New Management" sign...I had been to Layaly maybe 2 years ago and had enjoyed the meal...but frankly hadn't gone back because I have alot of other great places to go for Middle Eastern food and the parking stinks! 

Anywho...our group opted to go to Layaly...there were only a few tables occupied as we entered...very nice decor, banquettes on both walls, lots of tables and chairs but not so jammed in you have no privacy while dining...the kitchen is in the back corner (you can only see part of the kitchen but definitely hear the sizzle  = )    The man who greeted us was very friendly and seated us immediately.  Here's what we ordered:

2 Al Hamra's (Lebanese beer) for my friends and a glass of Estancia Zin for moi.    The beer was tasty, the wine was ok...and not a very generous pour at that...My friend, after Beer # 1, wanted to switch, the very kind waitress said the other beer choices, my friend selected, they were out of it!!!  (They only have 4-5 beers to choose from as it is, so they definitely have to at least stock what's advertised)

For appetizers, we selected:  

Haydari:  yummy garlicky yogurt dip*****10 STARS
Hummus*****5 STARS!! Creamy dreamy!!
Dolma    3.5 STARS (a bit soggy)
Falafel:  ******5 STARS

A Greek pita bread was served with these appetizers, warmed up, it's a bit thinner than Arabic pita and it was very good!! And plentiful!

For entrees:

Mixed Grill for me (Shrimp/Chicken/Lamb/Kofte  kebabs) interesting presentation, came with rice (very very small portion)  the meat was tasty...well spiced, the lamb was a bit chewy but the rest was quite good...I sensed it wasn't QUITE as hot (temp wise) as I would like...if you think of Chevy's fajitas, etc...where the meat arrives at the table just scorching hot...that's what Iike) It also came with grilled veggies...the tomatoes/onions/peppers...very tasty!

My friends both had Chicken kebabs...said the chicken was really good/tasty, but they too remarked on it not being super, just off the grill hot! Also lamented the rice portion was too small.

For dessert, I had the Kunefe (10 stars!!!! so DEE-LISH)
My companions ordered a plate of baklava to share and felt it
was a very small portion and not the freshest...not horrible or stale, just not that super fresh baklava that you expect and look forward to.

All in all, I would give Layaly 4 STARS!!!  It's a light/airy space (with a GREAT hookah back patio that stays open til 12-1am with tables/chairs/music/video screen)  a  young energy, comfy seating...
Arabic music playing in the dining room was really really good...not too loud but loud enough to hear it and appreciate it, totally matches the decor/energy.

Things to work on:

-  Keeping good inventory of beers offered
-  Slightly more generous wine by the glass pours 
-  Getting the food to the table, SUPER hot
-  Make the rice portions a bit larger...not enormous but enough to satisfy a very hungry person and/or to accompany the leftover kebabs(And at those prices)
-  work on having MORE dessert selections and whatever you offer, make it super fresh/generous.

It's a new venture for the owners, only operating since October 2009...so perhaps they are still finding their way....definitely will go back again to see if they can earn the 5th STAR!!  = )
author: Karen S.

description: Awesome Lunch & Dinner. Delivery is fast and efficient. They've only messed up my order once. The owner handled it personally, delivered the correct item himself & let me keep the extra entree! Tre the meza sampler and the prawns are amaze-balls! Great Groupon too!
author: nic c.

description:
My husband and I had dinner here using Groupon. All in all, the food was delicious. We ordered the mixed platter, sea bass and one if the appetizers with hummus, which were quite good. We also enjoyed the ambiance and atmosphere there. The customer service was proper. However, a couple of things:

1) No customer likes it when the tip is automatically added to the bill (18%). At least, we were satisfied with the service and had read this from previous customers' reviews, so we knew what to expect.

2) the entrees came out sort if cold...

3) the food is overpriced...$4 for an inch size square baklava. The tea was $3.50 as well.

Note: they made a mistake and brought us somebody else's appetizer. They took it back, but after I mentioned I had already tried it, they let us have it...thank you, very nice of you!

Our bill for 2 with the automatic tip and tax came to $50 with Groupon. I only had tea out of Groupon selection. Quite pricey, considering we had a Groupon..

Would recommend this place, since the food was good and it is important. Be ready for a high bill though!
author: Mary E.

description:
I was a loyal Layaly customer for years. Just tried again under the new management and was unfortunately disappointed with some of the changes.

I have always ordered the meza platter and it was delicious. The new version is lacking punch - and especially missing the Squash Dip and Red Ezme and Tabouli components. The Bourek which were a new addition were too chewy (maybe lost their heat in transport). The falafel were ok. It all tasted pretty one dimensional in comparison to the original meza platter. The portion was distinctly smaller (especially since there were fewer items) and only $1 cheaper than the original version.

The Layaly salad was also altered and not improved upon. First,  when composing salads you want all the components (minus the lettuce) to be about the same size. In the new Layaly salad, there were 6 inch long ribbons of carrot (bad idea), and 1/4-inch diced cucumbers (way way too small) and mixed leaf salad that was ok but none of it worked together as a salad. The original Layaly salad had mint, parsley and scallions, and smaller crisp pita - no carrots - it just had a brightness and textural combination that worked. The dressing is the same (thankfully), but it was more a green salad than anything remotely Mediterranean. 

Just kind of bummed out about the changes and not sure this will merit another trip across town - which by the way I am willing to do for epic food.
Maybe the hookah is the "hook" now
author: Mariangela S.

description:
I liked the food. The guy was nice. The place was neat. Everything was clean.  The girl was strange though. I bet she's somehow related to the owner though..or else she would've been fired already! She's gotta be the slooooooowest waitress/table setter/server I've ever seen! It's like she's so concerned with the way she looks while doing everything...it's unbelievable.  

Well, it doesn't matter I guess cuz the rating isn't about her...it's about the food and overall feel.  I just had to comment about her because she was kind of annoying me...just floating around me so slowly while i'm eating, it was damn distracting, like watching a sloth move.  I wanted to pull out my whip and start whipping her to speed things up.  But more realistically, I wanted to just grab everything from her and do it at my lightning speed so that the whole tormentingly slow scene was over with already! so that I could enjoy my meal without feeling weird about a slow moving sloth slugging about.

did i mention the food was good though? yea, it was.
author: Tu L.

description: Got the moussaka- everything's homemade inside the dish and it was delicious! Also good to note- Layaly's moussaka is vegetarian! To make it perfect, it could've had a little more spice, in my opinion.
author: Haley P.

description:
I loved the food, and the atmosphere.. even the timing being served was a well above the norm, considering the food is really at a nice deal.   Maybe I was really tired, but what I might have as the greatest gripe is the darn darn DARN menu.   Its night, the light is kind of low, you are tired, you weary, you get your glass of water and then you get presented with a menu.  My gosh.. this menu, which is written in a font next to impossible to read, plus its very hard to understand.    I couldn't tell where one meal ended and where the next meal began.  I saw $13 but never been there before, i couldn't tell if you got this giant spread of everything in one platter or what.    So after the explanation, the waitress was so kind, and helped me not feel like a total rube.   

-so the appetizers come flying in, then also the main course.   Tasting away.. the food is delicious.   Rice, veggies, and I had this lovely trout.. it was indeed spectacular, with lovely color and taste.   Like I said, thirteen bucks later.. awesome deal. 

Ill be back here.
author: Tito Y.

description:
I'm not a hookah smoker, so I can't comment on the quality of their hookah, but I will say that I like this place. Good staff and great food, especially the Baba Ghanoush...yummm keeps me coming back.

Anyways, here is how I sum up my 5 stars.
+1 good food
+1 great staff
+1 clean
+1 hardly ever crowded
+1 I'm coming here even though the parking is a pain, so this place must be good.
author: Narina A.

description:
$7 Lunch Special due to new management!

My co-workers and I came here for lunch and we all had the lunch special. The choice was between chicken kebab or stuffed eggplant. I ordered the chicken kebab. We also ordered the pita and hummus as an appetizer. The hummus was delicious! It was creamy with a dash or oil and seasoning. The food came relatively after we finished our appetizer. The chicken kebab entree came with rice, salad with goat cheese, and yogurt dipping sauce for the chicken. It was yummy and I would come back for the daily lunch special! If I come next time, I want to try the falael balls.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Good food and good people (this is what my 7 year old daughter wrote).  Consistent food and service.  Always easy to get a table.  Friendly staff. A go to neighborhood place for our family.
author: Jenny R.

description:
Layaly's fairly clean, presentable, and the staff's super friendly.  The food's served on the plate in an aesthetically pleasing way, but, alas, like the food itself, it's nothing to write home about.  The Arabic coffee comes in a tiny cup and is more of a Turkish coffee.  Overall, proportions aren't to American diner standards, but in its defense, this isn't that sort of establishment.  

This is definitely a good place to stop by when you're in the mood  for a light meal while spending time with friends.
author: Sam W.

description:
I was told by the ownership that it is under new management as of three months ago, and I am not sure how relevant the rest of the reviews here on Yelp are (anymore, at least), so here is my experience with the place as-of one day ago.

I called at around 3PM to check if they were serving hookah and inquired about the flavors.  The person on the other end of the phone was very polite and even asked in how long they can expect me so that they can get a new batch of coals ready.

The front of the restaurant is mostly reserved for sit-down dining, and is very cozy and quaint, with the back dedicated to hookah (although I am sure they still bring food back there).  The back is fully enclosed, but is still outside (basically a deck with a roof and walls).  However, because they have a patio heater, it never got too cold.

The hookah I ordered (peach) was brought out very quickly.  It was well packed and had a good flavor to it.  There was no shortage of coals as the owner was bringing by more every 10-15 minutes and checked to make sure it was heating right.  

In addition, we had two glasses of Arabic tea which complimented the hookah and helped keep us warm.

There is a screen on the wall with a projector hooked up to a broadcast of football (soccer) games, as well as an XBox 360 (which patrons are allowed to play).  If you go there with four or more guests, you can ask for a deck of cards to play Tarneeb (a popular Arabic card game). 

Overall, I am glad this place exists.  If I still lived two blocks away, I would frequent it almost daily.
author: Serge S.

description:
I enjoy the food at this neighborhood restaurant.  I have tried many different Middle Eastern food and the Kofta @ this place is the best.  It is tasty and juicy as well. The steak and lamp kebab are very good as well.  I also enjoy the eggplant Hummus.  Some reviewers complain the price is a bit higher than average.  But I will argue that the food is of better quality at this place. 

In summary, good food, always has open table means I will go back for sure.
author: Benjamin H.

description: Good food and wine, but bad costumer service. The waitress push us out if the place
author: Irving S.

description:
My friend had a flyer that advertised their $7 lunch special so we gave it a go. We ordered 2 of the kofta kabobs (beef & lamb), stuffed eggplant, 2 chicken kabobs (surprisingly really juicy!), sauteed chicken (my friend's like this one although I thought it was OK). The portions were smaller than I expected but the food is filling enough since it came with fluffy pita and a delicious side of salad. 

The price especially high for the portions on our mezza platter, which was an appetizer sampler, as well as high for the side of hummus and baba ganoush that we got. I didn't get to try everything since we did family style among 6 of us but what I did try was good. 

I'm glad they deliver since parking is such a pain in the city but I think I'd just stick to the lunch specials since they're more reasonable.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
Do not use a groupon here.

Everything was cool except they charged tips for a party of two.  We were going to pay at least 18%, but it was an insult to charge insinuating that people who use

Groupon

are cheap and won't tip.

That's almost never happened to me.

The mousakka was good.

The desert was too small even for a nice restaurant.
author: Ron A.

description: Love this place. A true life-saver for nights when nothing but a Mezza plate will do. Free delivery PLUS 20% off if you order from the webpage. Delicious. The chicken soup is really unique too- great shreaded chicken and warm broth. Love, love, love
author: Jenni D.

description: We stopped for dinner here last night because we were in the neighborhood and drove by. It looked nice from the outside so we decided to try it. What a wonderful place. We were greeted with real warmth and treated superbly by the waitress. The food and ambience are perfect for a quiet dinner. I had the lamb shank, it was excellent (and huge!). The chicken kabobs were also delicious, as were all the side dishes. And the prices are very reasonable. We'll definitely be back.
author: Howard B.

description:
I love that this thing was listed under the category of 'hookah bars'.  doesn't smell like one, and every time i've been here, i've never seen anyone bust out a hookah.  But what do I know?  

I know this!
It's meh/A-ok.  But not 'meh' enough for me to say, don't go.  If you're coming out of your neighborhood to get Mediterranean, or you've got no experience with Mediterranean, come here once, but find a place that tops this, which I'm sure SF has.  Excellent Mediterranean food is worth finding.  

HOWEVER, if you live in the neighborhood and want to eat something with lots of vegetably goodness and not a lot of fat sliding all over your plate, here is the spot.  Portions are not so huge that you leave this place feeling like an insta-self-made-type-ii-diabetic. 

Atmosphere is ok, nothing amazing.  Beer selection totally totally totally meh.  However red wine selection decent and not a complete rip off.  So there you have it.
author: betty b.

description:
Thanks to Groupon, we tried Layaly & loved it.
The food was 5-star, though we were annoyed when the service lapsed for 35+ mins. while the chefs frantically filled a HUGE take-out order.
Nevertheless, when the grilled rack of lamb (4 delicious lamb chops, medium done) was served, they were downright heavenly in taste and tenderness.  My friend's mixed grill was excellent as well.  
We had wanted the Chilean sea bass, but they were out.  We were told that they sometimes run out on a Monday evening.
We also had the very satisfying shrimp appetizer and house-made baklava.
Yes, we'd go again.
author: Vera P.

description: Hands down the best Mediterranean food I've had. Everything I've tried is delicious! the chicken kabobs are juicy and tender, made to perfection. The staff is super friendly, they make you feel right at home. I love this place!
author: Yael T.

description:
I'm updating my review. I love this place. It's great for dates and bringing friends to. 
The server with the bright and cool hair recognizes us now and is always friendly. Amazes me how they usually only have one server for the entire restaurant so it makes sense that it gets slower when they're busy -but coming from the service industry myself, can completely understand. 
We always start with the mezza platter - I swear they have the best baba ganouj.
Their pita can be a hit or miss though. Sometimes it's a little hard and crunchy, and other times it's soft and chewy and delicious. It really depends what day of its cycle you get it on.
My entrees change with my mood. Sometimes the Tuna Salad is what I crave and it's so good. Perfectly seared Ahi with yummy greens, mini mandarins and cranberries. 
Or the Tajines are perfect for a cold, rainy or foggy San Francisco day. Sort of like a tomato stew with whatever protein/veggie combination you can think of. 
Baklava is delicious and they have a good wine selection - although I'd love to see more "Mediterranean" wine choices. My philosophy is, "when in Rome" so I love to try wines from where my food was inspired from.
They've started making unique cocktail drinks from wine and sake. They are worth a try and are very yummy. I got the Ginger Panda (a little different name and inspriation for a Mediterranean restaurant) but it was very good.

Like I said, we love coming here and will for a long time to come!
author: Natasha V.

description:
Came here on whim one day, and to be honest with you, that was a damn good whim. 

Excellent service, we had no idea what we were ordering, and the waitress clearly noticed this. She walked us through the menu and offered suggestions, which i might add were amazing suggestions that we loved.


Order:
- Mezza Plate (A+)
- Some other assorted Mediterranean dishes (B)

I wish I could remember the names of what we ordered after the mezza plate, but i suppose that's how good the Mezza Plate actually was. It could very well be their signature dish, that's how its represented in my mind at least. 

I will definitely be back, I will definitely be ordering the Mezza plate again, and I will definitely remember what i order so i can update this post. 

[APPROVED]
author: Eric T.

description:
We have ordered delivery a few times here and the food (kabobs, lentil soup, hummus) are pretty good.  The kabobs especially, but their consistency needs some work.  I have received delicious soft pita one delivery and hard obviously microwaved crunchy pita on another delivery.  I have received a full container of soup on one delivery and half a container of soup on another.  And when I mentioned this problem to the woman who took my next order she didn't apologize and provide exceptional customer service by saying she would ensure I received a full portion . . . instead she made excuses  . . . not what a customer is asking for.  Customer service 101.

Layaly . . . I cant recommend you to people because I don't know if you are having a good day or bad day.

Work on your customer service and consistency.
author: vanessa f.

description:
This place is awesome, Mohammed Awesome (our waiter). 

We went in for hookah last night around 10 and stayed until past 11 (although they're supposed to close around then) there was still another group smoking too, and they let everyone stay.  

We got the guava and mint hookah (thanks to other yelpers who recommended it) and it was gooooood.  The mint was refreshing while there was a light taste of guava in it.

This afternoon we decided to get food here since we loved the hookah so much.  We got Kibbeh, Pita and Hummus, Dolma, Falafel and a beef and lamb kebab.  Very good.  Ahh soooo good. Our waiter was really really nice and attentive too.  He remembered us from the previous night so he told us to check out the back hookah room after our meal.  So we did and it's pretty sweet back there.  

Mohammed Awesome was also there chit chattin it up.

Layaly is great, the food and the ambiance.  But, what really makes this place memorable is the staff.  They are friendly and personable.  I would go it just to kick it with them!

I will be back, for sure!
author: Marisa R.

description:
Absolutely some of the best Mediterranean food I've ever had in my life!
5 stars for the food & service. We were fortunate enough to stumble upon this place after visiting China Beach & were blown away with how tasty everything was! We live in the East Bay, so it's a bit of a trek into the City, but after only 3 days we already have plans to return.
author: AirhornAnnie B.

description: I've been on a Mediterranean food kick lately and my fiancee realized this and bought the Groupon for Layaly. Its really close to where we live which was great. We went kind of early for dinner on a weekday which was nice cause we were seated right away and got parking right out front. The food was delicious and our waitress was super nice and patient with us when we couldn't pull up the code for the Groupon right away. We ordered the Mezza platter even though we had to pay full price cause it was excluded in the Groupon... everything was soooo good. We ordered two different fish dishes which were good, but when I go back, I will probably go with the falafel wrap. All in all, great experience and will definitely return.
author: Becky J.

description:
I live nearby and wanted to try for a while...  the girlfriend and I know nothing about Mediterranean food so we were always hesitant, but we finally went in yesterday.

It was empty, but then again, it was 3.30pm on a Tuesday. The server was nice enough to explain the food.
The only thing in the menu that looked familiar was fried calamari; I wanted to order it, but he told us they discontinued it because it was not popular. Well, good thing because they now have a shrimp appetizer instead with a white wine sauce and some other herbs and feta cheeze and it was excellent!

Then we got what I believe is typical Mediterranean food: a chicken kebab plate and a shrimp on a stick plate also. Both very good. It comes with a little yummy salad and some rice; we usually frown upon any rice that is not Thai jasmine rice, but this was really good.

I tried some Turkish coffee at the end, which I have never had before. It's good, but strong (even though I like strong coffee) and they were nice enough to give me a cup of extra hot water and an extra cup so I could let my girlfriend try a little.

I wouldn't say it's cheap, but prices are more than fair for that amount and quality of food. They told us they have a Hookah lounge in the back but we didn't have time to check it out... oh well, I guess we're just gonna have to come back then!
author: Vithiet L.

description: The food here is fantastic and the prices are reasonable. I've had two different servers and both were so hospitable and friendly. I really enjoyed the chicken kebab and the chicken wrap. The meat was tender and juicy, but very flavorful. I also loved their yogurt. They are open for lunch and the lunch prices are a great deal.
author: Natalie S.

description:
We crashed this spot on Saturday night around 11 pm - my friend Amr called ahead.  My crew of 10+ people... Mohammed - the owner? Was nice enough to keep the place open after hours for us.  People had some Sheesha, coffee and I had tea - which was ok.

The Amr Diab blasted, the board and card games came out and the conversation flowed - we brought the baklava and it was nice and chill.

One thing that would have been nice is if the coals were taken care of more on the Sheesha.. some of my friends were disappointed in the fact the coals would go cold...and not be noticed.

Still mad props for the hook up!
author: Alicia A.

description:
I was amazed to find such appetizing mediterranean food way deep into the avenues.  This place was a shocker to me for many reasons.  For example, the food is excellent and reasonably priced. And, the place is never busy, at least the couple of times I have gone there. 

The quality and freshness of the food is made clear with each bite. I've tried a lot of Meza platters and this one is by far the best!  Other favorites from my group are the chicken kebab, lamb kebab, and my favorite is the eggplant dish, its vegetarian. 
There are a limited selection of desserts, but they're all tasty, however some being better than others, namely the chocolate cake, mmm good.  My only disappointment was the last time I was there I had the turkish coffee and it tasted watered down and not very good.  Although, the time before I had it it was good.  I highly recommend this  place.
author: Molly M.

description: Excellent hummus, fantastic lamb, and some little slow-cooked beef stew stuff was also good (don't remember the name, it's in the bottom middle of the menu).
author: Frankie S.

description:
Quickie review after the change in ownership: same food, same menu for now, but about a 1/3 more food. Figuring its about $15+ for a kebob plate, that's a welcome change.

And they deliver now! Whoo! Meat on sticks to my door!
author: Stacy J.

description: Hubby and I just moved to the Parkside and found an awesome Mediterranean place that delivers! Enjoyed the mixed grill plate for two, as well as dolmas, feta and olives, delicious baba ghanouj, and yummy cacik which is a yogurt cucumber sauce. My husband loved the warm pita bread (I'm gluten-free)... All delicious! Delivery was earlier than quoted on Grubhub.com and courteous as well. A bit on the pricey side for delivery but worth it. Just looked them up and found out they are a hookah lounge too! Planning to eat and hookah in person soon!
author: Rosie S.

description:
We came here after being swooned in by their $7 lunch special, and left feeling that it was an okay experience. Not something we will be back to, but one that we were happy we tried once.

In terms of the food, we ordered the chicken wrap and the chicken kebab. The chicken wrap was very dry. Still decent, but clearly the weakest aspect of the meal. The chicken kebab on the other hand was great. It was juicy with a wonderful mix of spices. The meal was complimented with fries, rice, and a salad that came between the two entrees. The fries and salad were good, but the rice was a little overcooked.

As for the location, it was a little dirty inside, but nothing serious. The service was great though.

All in all, the place was a-ok. Its very pricey for a dinner option, but a decent one for lunch to try something different from other restaurants in the immediate vicinity.
author: Sami R.

description: judging from the other reviews I may have just got them on a bad night, either that or they don't put in much effort for delivery orders. Out of three things on order, everything was overcooked, the lamb was practically charcoal and even the tuna for the tuna salad that they had attempted to braise, was instead dry and overcooked.
author: Dov B.

description:
WHY IS YELP DELETING ALLLLLLLLLLLLL MY REVIEWS?! WTF IS THIS BULLSHT!?

SOME GREAT MEDITERRANEAN FOOD!!!!!! The food was sooooo goooodddd. I had the lamb kebob, and the lamb was cooked JUST HOW I WANTED IT TO BE COOKED! I also got some fries, yea i kno thats not the best thing to get but the fries were sooo fuckin good. Perfectly seasoned and the lamb kebob just got better. I was hoping the hookah wouldn't be shitty like A LOT of hookah bars in the city AND IT WASN'T! They really catered to my specific taste of hookah and how i liek to enjoy it. Also, its not some worker setting up the hookah, its the owners and they set it up SOOOO GOOOODDD. I will definately come back for hookah. It may not be a strict hookah lounge, but the set up is so much better than a lot of hookah lounges in the city. Also, some of the best arabic/turksih coffee in the city!!!!!!! Just becareful not to burn your tounge and spill ur coffee all over ur nice shirt XD
author: Hubert L.

description:
I came here for a friend's birthday dinner last week. We were expecting to have a fun dinner with friends and then head to our respective homes. Little did we know we would still be there over four hours later!

It wasn't just the company I was with that made this night great...the restaurant played a large roll. We started off with the mezes platter with toasted pita bread that I adored. Then we got the shrimp (excellent!) and the crab cakes. I ordered the mixed grill - it was so huge it also made for a great lunch the next day. I tried my friend's beyhti (sp???) and I would for sure want to share that with someone next time! 

The servers were WONDERFUL. So much personality and just added to the fun of the night. We capped off the night with a couple hookahs and some dancing. They even taught us some hookah tricks with soap water. 

At the end of the night, we were even able to hook up my friend's ipod to their speakers so we could listen and dance to one of his playlists. 

Oh! And $10 corkage for wine was much appreciated! 

I already told my friend that I hope she doesn't mind that I totally plan to do my own bday dinner there later this year! :)
author: Jen N.

description: Excellent food, great service. Exceeded our expectations, even baklava was fresh and delicious.
author: Tata A.

description: Food is good but bit pricey for neighborhood restaurant. The mixed appetite platter is great.
author: Hiroshi F.

description: Ordered from GrubHub. Food came an hour BEFORE the estimated delivery time very hot. They included a second Greek Salad in the bag (yum, lunch for tomorrow!) and everything was in reusable containers. Couscous, salad, and pita were great. I've found my new go-to place!
author: Kim K.
