description: My wife and I love this place and come here every so often. We've been here for lunch many many times and might stop by for dinner one of these days. Their kabob combo plates are awesome.
author: Vlad F.

description: Stopped in here for lunch last Saturday.  Could not have been better.  Everyone left their plates about as squeaky clean as you can.  I had the salmon kabobs and can't wait to go back and enjoy them again.  Service was efficient, friendly and the food was, as I said above, utterly delightful.  Next time, fattoush will be in the mix along with those delicious salmon kebabs.
author: Donna H.

description: I have been here a couple of times and it gets better each time.  This time I tried the hammus and it was delicious.  I like the presentation and the staff explained what each portion was on my plate.  :)
author: Manhav B.

description:
This is the type of place you don't want to Yelp, cuz you want to keep it a secret for you and your friends...

Friendly, attentive, warm service

Simple, authentic, welcoming atmosphere

Fresh, filling, delicious food

Sweet, pleasant, interantional background music

*Bonus, there's a nargile room in the back with good music and a big screen to watch international soccer!
author: kelly b.

description: It's definitely surprising how quite this place can be sometimes. I've always had a great experience when coming to Layaly's. The service is impeccable. The waiter is always super friendly and tosses a few jokes back and forth with myself and whoever I have gone with. The food, although not 5-star quality, is above average for Mediterranean food in the Bay Area. I also love the fact that it turns into a hookah bar at night. Parking is a little bit of an issue, but what part of the Richmond is easy to park in anyways?
author: Eila S.

description:
Hands down, the most populated restaurant in the outer Richmond on Clement last night. 

We were a bit weary when we arrived at 6:45pm, and there was only one other group. However, throughout the course of our dinner, the whole restaurant filled up, and there were people waiting for our table. Obviously, Layaly has "been discovered." 

Why is this place so great? 

First, it's a family business. My mom loves playing the, "Oh, I bet that guy is the father, and those are the children. Oh, and she's so skinny. I bet she's a vegetarian." 

Second, the menu is simple and straight forward. Start with the $15 mezza platter, then pick a kabob. My parents had the kofta kabob (on the dry side, but it means that they are lean!), while I indulged in the mixed grill (two shrimp, kofta, chicken, and lamb). They are served with rice or fresh fries, and a salad to start. The sweet cheese dessert is totally worth the wait. YUM! And the house wine (merlot or cab) is a mere $4 per glass. 

Third, the interior is warm, inviting, and clean. I love the wood and light fixtures. 

Pick up and delivery are other options.
author: Misha F.

description:
Let's just say that I'm amazed of how unique and creative this place is. This place has a really nice combo of a restaurant in the front and a hookah lounge in the back. I'm a huge fan of Falafels and haven't had any for years so I decided to get it with some side of fries. Presentation was neat, customer service was excellent, and the food was great. 

Next time I'll be back for some Hookah.
author: Isaac B.

description: Absolutely delicious & wonderful service. A more formal dining experience compared to King of Falafel (which will remain as my fave, but this place is a close 2nd). Will be returning to Layaly next time I'm in the neighborhood!
author: Lynn m.

description: Mezza platter was good.. Main course was not that great.. may be we ordered the wrong stuff!! But, it was OK!
author: Neetha V.

description:
Excellent service and food was great!   we were a party of 4 so did family style so we can try it all!  

Order two appetizers-
 1) Hummus Billahm-sirloin, onions, peppers served on a bed of hummus- delicious!   
2) Mezza platter- comes with 4 small types of hummus- roasted eggplant,  garbanzo blended with herbs & spices, parsley with tomatoes, and onions, & a fried fillo dough stuffed with feta cheese and parsley.  I didn't care for Parsley, so  this was just "ok" for me. 

Tried 4 Entress: Chilean Sea Bass, Lamb Kebab, Beef Kebab, & Chicken Kebab..
All were good, except Chicken was a tad on the dry side.. but then again, most chicken are!  

Baklava:  Average.. not outstanding ...
Overall we had a wonderful dining experience  with excellent service! 
Yes I would come back again!
author: Susie C.

description: Great food great service! kabob dinner for two is just right with enough to take home!
author: Akiliano T.

description: GREAT lentil soup, just ordered it to-go but the online ordering feature was prime.
author: Lauren K.

description: Had this delivered for the first time tonight - AWFUL.  The pomegranate chicken smelled so god-awful I couldn't even stomach trying it.  The vegetarian couscous was so bad - honestly it seemed like cooking school 101 failure.  The phillo/feta appetizer was meh, very bland.  The lamb shank was ok - definitely the high point of the meal but I've had much better before.  I ate half of it and didn't want to eat anymore.  $65 and I ate about $10 worth of food and will throw the rest out it's so bad.  And what can you say about a Mediterranean place that can't cook couscous well?  How did ANYONE give this 4 or 5 stars?  Totally beyond me.  Go to La Mediterranee if you want good Mediterranean food - it's miles better and the entrees are probably $10 cheaper per plate.
author: Michael D.

description: Tried to use a Groupon that I had purchased.  The initial presentation was great.  My pre-purchased Groupon included an appetizer, two entres, and dessert.    We got our appetizer and dinners.  Then it got a little busy.  Our server decided that we no longer needed any service.  Her tip was already guaranteed.  She had other "real" customers.   Even after I walked up to the server station and pleaded for our dessert and the check, we were still ignored as she attended to other tables for several minutes.   Finally when she did come over with our dessert and the check, she put them on the edge of the table, leaving our large used dinner plates still in front of us. As she did this, she explained that the tip had already been added to the check total.  I said I wanted someone to take our used dinner plates away, and this was regarded as some kind of excessive request--I mean after all, I was merely a Groupon customer, not a real customer.   The wretched service ruined the whole experience.  Avoid this place.
author: Philip R.

description: This is by far the best Middle-Eastern place in the Richmond. Came here with my buddy before going out on a Saturday night to grab a quick bite to eat! However, after looking at the menu, it was game on! I had the chicken wrap, lentil soup, beef kebab, and baklava. The food was well prepared and presented. The seasoning on the meat was subdued and not overpowering, yet present to the palate. The chicken was well marinated and complimented beautifully with the traditional yogurt based tzatziki. The lentil soup had a good amount of cilantro and ginger to give your senses a real kick. And the beef was medium-rare and absolutely amazing. This place deserves five stars - no doubt!
author: Taj M.

description:
Layaly serves good mediterranean cuisine with a California twist.  Recently, I went here for dinner and have been keeping this place in mind for a special occasion.  My friend who has been busy at work with travel was in the neighborhood so we went!

For starters, we got the Meza platter.  The platter includes 6 different dips such as hummus, baba ganouj, squash, tabouli, and a couple others.  Falafel is on the platter too.  I like how it was served with pita triangles.

For our entrees, we each got the beef kebab and mixed kebab.  The mixed kebab was served with shrimp, beef and kefta.  You are given a choice of rice or French Fries.  I chose the rice which had pine nuts (very good).   Both kebabs were very tender and delicious.

For dessert, you are given a choice of mediterranean selections or California cuisine selections.   We each had the kunafe (cheese pastry served with crushed pistachios and light syrup) and a dulce de leche (I think).   The kunafe was a bit oily but the other was pretty good.  Both desserts were topped off with Turkish coffee, which was not as strong as I've had it but still very good.

Although Layaly was out of some items (like the grilled fish, lamb and baklava), what we got as alternatives were very good.  Will give their lunch menu a try too.
author: Janet H.

description: Been here twice already, the service is good and the lady that helped us was great at recommending wine and food. I always get the mix grill platter- mixed grilled meats-chicken, lamb, beef. The appetizer Mezza Platter of various dips are wonderful. The protions are real good and the prices are reasonable. This place is small and cozy, not too busy but can get loud (which did not bother me).
author: X X.

description:
Nice clean and color-coordinated inside (except for the amateurish paintings of Venice) that gives a tasteful impression.

We went very simple one early Tuesday evening: One mezes platter and one mixed grill dish. Seven dips with olives and chicken peas arrived on starter plate, arranged in a circle were a few spoons of delicious taste experiences such as Baba Ganouj, Hummus, sauted tomatoes, et cetera - all came with warm pita bread pieces. Yummy, specially the very white dip that tasted plate-lickingly fantastic!

The main course was succulent lamb, shrimp and beef/lamb-ground meat from a skewer with what I would consider the ultimate French Fries. They were not frozen, but fresh and crispy! A salad of fresh romaine and tomato pieces on the same plate rounded things up.

Including tip, we left the place with a check of less than $35---mind you, we only had ice water and no coffees/desserts (the Creme Brulee served in a chocolate cup looked maahvellous!) and we did share the two courses we'd ordered.

Service was prompt, courteous and not overbearing. A perfect small meal of Mediterranean Cuisine and a great place to have a conversation!

We'll be back with a bigger hunger and space for two desserts...
author: Wolfgang S.

description: The wrap special with french fries is great and under 9 bucks for dinner! It's pretty quiet in there during the week so I take it to go on my way home from the office. Hit the spot!
author: Ashley A.

description:
I found my dish at Layaly to be only ok. I ordered the "tender beef" dish which was more more rubbery rather than tender, but the red sauce it came in was good. My wife ordered the vegetable kebab which she enjoyed. 
One thing that kind of bothered me was that we ordered our dinner and then ordered a starter salad. We only found out later that our dinner came with salad. Ideally, it would have been nice for the waitress to remind us while we ordered.
Prices are reasonable, and our waitress was friendly, but not a place I'm dying to go back to.
author: Steve H.

description:
Really cute inside--yay! not too many people in there--hmm why? 
food-good, not excellent, but definitely solid and filling. 
service--excellent, helpful. i would definitely go back for more! and i loved the meat, and the yogurt. and the homemade knafeh. oh and the mint tea! yum yum
author: Natasha F.

description:
Service: Good, attentive. Waitress was helpful in recommending what kind of wine my friend and I should choose for our meals.

Food: Tasty, good portions.

Price: It was okay, a little on the pricier side for me, but I think my meal was worth it.

Atmosphere: Simple, somewhat classy, but clientele could dress casually.
author: Helene K.

description: GREAT Middle Eastern Food. Top ingredients. Very good execution. Nice ambiance. Good background music. Attentive service. Portions are too small, though.
author: Ayala K.

description:
Tony and I just stumbled upon this place while driving down Clement, trying to find some place to eat at before heading to the beach.  We took a look at the menu posted outside and as soon as we spotted a "People Love Us On Yelp" sticker, we were convinced.

We came here for lunch, and  their lunch special prices are very reasonable.  We ordered the Meza Platter to share, Tony got the Grilled Eggplant Sandwich, and I ordered the Falafel.  The presentation of the food is really nice, but my falafel could have used a little more flavor.  I took a bite out of Tony's eggplant sandwich though, and it was delicious.  If I wasn't feeling pretty full from the meze platter and pita bread, I probably would've swiped his plate.  A girl's gotta do what a girl's gotta do.
author: Jen L.

description:
This is the most lovely Mediterranean place in the Richmond!!
They have very delicious and fresh entrees, desserts and a lovely modern decor. 

Put aside the food, when you walk into the restaurant, ask about the following...

The secret to this place is the fabulous hidden hookah bar in the back patio ran by the super nice owner Bara. Bara operates the hookahs from 8p - 12 am M-F and 8p - 2a Sat & Sun. The place is very chill and relaxing, offers a GREAT variety of hookah flavors, beers and wine. It is not so popular because they don't advertise and so not many ppl know that there's a hookah bar in the back.. well.. now you know and I think it's better than that place on Haight - noisy and you don't get to sit at the tables to hookah til after 10:30 pm.. wth is up with that?
author: Catalina C.

description:
Yelp failed me. How could a place with such great reviews have such terrible falafel??

Burnt, heavy, and tasteless = not my idea of deliciousness. Although the sampler platter was arranged very beautifully, the dips on it were also just mediocre. Mediterranean places should, as a rule, have AMAZING hummus and falafel, and Layaly disappointed on both fronts. If my friends and I did not have a restaurant.com certificate that made our meal really cheap, I would probably have been more upset about paying so much for such disappointing food.

The fries that came with my friend's sandwich were really good though. But I wouldn't recommend a kind-of-pricey Mediterranean place to someone for their awesome fries...
author: Karen L.

description:
Fantastic.  Everything just fantastic.  
Went on a weeknight, so it was pretty empty  (which I never mind...empty=better service)  
Got the Borek-fried fillo dough stuffed with feta cheese and parsley.  Seriously, if that description doesn't get you, let me say that this was possibly one of the best things I have ever eaten.  I dreamed about it for night afterwards.  
Also got the Layaly Mix Grill-kofte, chicken, beef, lamb and shrimp.  Very good quality meats, nice grilled flavor, and excellent spices.  That being said, I am not a huge huge meat fan, though my companion is.  He loved everything on this platter.  Personally, I could have just have like 8 orders of the Borek.

After dinner we went into the back for some hookah.  Totally different atmosphere.  Very relaxed, with group of arabic guys sitting around playing cards.  Projection screen with the arabic top 40 music videos playing.  We got ourselves a deck of cards, ordered a hookah (with Lemon Mint Shisha. Good, I also recommend the watermelon flavor) and tea.  I have to note, I am not a smoker, and I hate the feeling of smoking (cigs or other).  However, this is smooth, cool, and easy....as sign of a well packed hookah, which is an indication of a great hookah bar.  Well done. I think we sat there enjoying the atmosphere for over an hour.  Great way to spend an evening.
(The only possibly complaint is that you are not allowed to eat where you smoke.  Oh well, I guess it is a permit issue)
author: Anya W.

description: Just finished a Layaly takeout dinner and it was really terrible.  We've had food to go from here in the past and it was usually good, but tonight it was so bad that we're done with this place.  We ordered rack of lamb rare, and it was beyond well done, totally shriveled, dried out and tasteless.  Also got a mezze platter, and it didn't taste fresh and the pita bread that came with it was dark brown and so hard you couldn't even bite into it--we could barely break it in half.  Everything was lukewarm.  The whole meal had obviously been prepared, then left to sit out, then reheated in the microwave on "High", then sent out for delivery on a long, long voyage.  Sorry, but this place isn't what it used to be.  Too bad, it used to be really good.
author: Nancy K.

description: Seriously, where's the flavor?  I went there for lunch today and spent about 20.00 on a flavorless chicken wrap and the eggplant spread. Meh!  No flavors and so expensive for lunch. Why didn't i go elsewhere???  Plus, the sparkling water was of course Pelligrino, hello 3 additional dollars for lunch. But the table water was warm. yuck.
author: Shelley K.

description:
Why isn't this place more packed?  The food was great here.  The place is clean and comfortable.  The staff are very nice.  

I shared a baba ghounouj with warm triangles of pita bread and had the Layaly burger - ground beef and lamb with lettuce, tomato and a side salad and yogurt sauce.  M. got the mixed grill and it was good but I think mine was better!  Great for lunch or dinner.
author: Betty L.

description: I have ordered the same takeout from here before naan, hummus and grilled shrimp.  It has always been nothing special but OK .  Not tonight.  Naan was so hard I could have used it as a frisby.  Shrimp was over cooked.  Last time I order from here.  Bleh.
author: Sunny P.

description:
I finally found great Mediterranean food in SF. Awesome food, fair prices and good service. The Chicken Pita sandwich served at lunchtime is excellent. A generous portion of white meat chicken rolled into 2 crisp servings of pita, makes this one of my favorite sandwiches in the city. 
Two thumbs up!
author: Zach D.

description: Went here randomly and we had a great time, atmosphere was nice, quiet and the food was awesome!
author: Larry B.

description:
I have one thing to say about this place: Om nom nom nom.

This place is clean, the service is excellent, and the food is absolutely delicious.  The lunch specials are a great deal, but the dinners are a little expensive, hence the one star off.

Their hummus is freaking amazing.  Kebabs are also wonderful.  The best part by far?  Their dessert.  My friend and I had no idea what we wanted, so we told our waitress to surprise us, and she brought us some baklava (some of the BEST I've ever had) and the tres leches cake, which was a-ma-zing.

I'm sad that the place doesn't get much business.  It's a clean place with great service and food.
author: Tori S.

description: Mmm tasty!  thumbs up for the kofta kebab and rice - oddly enough cranberry juice was a nice accompaniment (i wasn't loving the wine list).
author: Julienne G.

description:
Let me set the scene: Got off work late. Tired as hell and even more grumpy than snow white's dwarf. Picked up my best friend. My stomach was eating itself inside out from hunger. We wanted Mediterranean food. And FAST.

I was disappointed when all we could find was this fancy restaurant. It didn't look fast or cheap. I was so hungry that I was invested the minute we started looking at the menu outside. Ordered a humus plate for appetizer and my friend and I ordered a beef and lamb kabob and split them. The food (despite my irritable demeanor) was amazing! The meat perfectly tender, the french fries tasty, and a delicious salad. Oh, and the pita was warm and delicious.

I was pleasantly surprised, the food was great. I do however, wish that there was a take out falafel place around the richmond/sunset area so I could get my humus fix quickly (maybe i should just hook myself up to a humus IV....that would be quick....)
author: Molly W.

description:
Being Lebanese I am jaded. So this place is also Lebanese, the french fries are a dead give away. Sitto always served fries/rice, sometimes both. This place is good, but it depends on what you order. 

The hummus was made with 100% olive oil, they use plenty. Not reduced with vegetable oil. The bread was warm and very flavorful.

The Seafood offering of the day was excellent. It was a huge chunk of Bass grilled perfectly, brushed with what must have been olive oil and lemon and something else? Like something you would find at a top notch seafood place, priced accordingly. Served with assorted grilled zucchini, grilled ripe sweet tomato,  bell pepper choice of an excellent moist rice or FRIES, all seasoned to make your mouth water. 

They need to change their meat supplier. 

I ordered the Lamb Kabobs- ehh, lamb is lamb. I ordered it medium rare. The meat was only ok. Not as tender as you would expect and not as flavorful either. I was disappointed. It was seasoned ok but not fresh then again its fall, this time of year lamb is spotty.

Total bill was over $50!!! no drinks. Wow. Sitto would have blanched!
author: William H.

description:
Even though it's only a half a block away from my apartment, it took a while before I finally tried this place. What a delightful surprise! Tried the lunch special sandwiches and the appetizer sampler. Really tasty food! Also had some tasty beer that I'd never had before called Almaza.

Best way to end the meal there is with the Turkish Coffee. So delicious!

I'm disappointed that I didn't know about the back smoking patio with the hookah, it sounds fun. I'm going to check that out the next time I go. 

Also, the restaurant was very clean with a nice decor, and the service was fast and friendly.
author: Chelsea H.

description:
This place is good.  I was originally going to give them 5 stars, but I went back again and was going to give them three, but I figured I'd take the average.
The wait staff is nice and friendly, although for some reason the second time I was there, the owner (?)/host didn't seem to remember that we had previously engaged in witty rapport so there was a few awkward moments.
The good: I enjoyed the spartan, yet neat plating.  The food was tasty too.  I had the shrimp kababs and then the kofta kababs  (The kofta tasted good, but I have nary a clue how it should taste, but it filled up).  I also enjoy the tight little mound of rice you can get, that even stays together after a couple of forkfuls.  Nice.  The rice pudding was good too, as well as the falafel, which is what I was craving when I went in here.  You'll leave full and happy, but not over-full or overjoyed.

The bad:  The house wine tasted like the best balsamic vinegar that I had ever had, however, I couldn't really put it on my salad, so there you go.  Also, I wouldn't get the baklava.  There are better things on the dessert menu (which eerily reminded me of the fluoride menu that my old dentist gave me in my early childhood.  Weird.).

Notwithstanding, the place is way better than I had hoped and better than some other restaurants in the area, which I plan to review shortly.
author: Ricky R.

description:
it's not a place to go once, it's a place to go periodically, everyday, and never get enough, why:

1. the food is addictive, in a nice way, really good dishes out there, they know what they are doing
2. they are very friendly, amazing service, with a smile stuck on their face all day long
3. it's a place to chill after 9, a place to hangout and listen to some arabic music before 9, amazing place to dine all day long
4. it's my personal favorite in SF, GIVE IT A SHOT
author: Amir E.

description:
LOVE this place. Great food, great apps, great service. Clean restaurant, and the service is wonderful.

I loved their rice pudding, and really enjoyed their fish special.  I will go here again - it's one of my new faves!
author: Jennifer U.

description:
My sister-in-law and I, in the last-minute decicsion (since we initially wanted some Italian, but they didn't open for lunch) opted for this neighboorhood restaurant. And it was such a great experience!

Here's my breakdowns:

1. The food & services: This is my first time to have a mideastern meal so I have no comparision! We came around 1pm so it wasn't crowded at all. The service was fast. The waiters were very friendly and helpful. We had mezes platter (see my photos) for appetizer, it was very good. Then we ordered the "lunch special" items: Lamb Kebab, and Eggplant stuffed, $7 each (I believed!) The lamb was so tender! Then we had the "Kunefe" for dessert. 

2. The dessert: OMG! I had Buklava many times before, but this dessert is my favorite now! It looked like a slide of salmon at first, but when I used the folk to get a piece, its cheese filling was just like from pizza, and it's kind of hard to separate it from the whole thing! It has grated pistachios on top. It's so rich. I loved it!!

3. The price: It cost almost $40 for 1 appetizer, 2 lunch specials, and 1 dessert!

I'd give 4.5 stars for the food, 5 stars for service, 3 star for the price. Overall, it deserves 4-star rating! And I'd come back very soon with my friends!
author: Vivian L.

description:
GO TO LAYALY! Like Betty l, I have no clue why this place isn't more packed. They're open for both lunch and dinner on the weekends (not sure about during the week). 

They make a number of middle eastern dishes but with a twist. They have on their mezza platter the ordinary hummus, baba ganouj, falafel, etc. but they also have ezme, which is traditionally much heavier but they made it similarly to the baba ganouj but with roasted red peppers, DELICIOUS. They also have a squash puree dip as well, it was fantastic. 

My husband had something called Biety (?)  Kebab which was a twist on Kafta...wrapped in a pita-like tortilla and with a sweet tomato sauce on top (served with raita).

They have had a great write up in SF Gate 
http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/chronicle/archive/2007/12/05/FD1GTLH3V.DTL

I would hate to see it close, the family that runs it is so sweet. Go patronize this neighborhood gem!
author: Carson H.

description:
Ambiance was quite nice.  I liked that the front windows and the sky light let in a lot of light.  I personally like the natural light.  

Waitress was nice, but seemed a little fake to me.  I guess it's okay since she didn't exactly talk shit in front of my face... hah she walked to the back to bitch to the chefs because my friends and I sat there for like two hours for a lunch.  I don't feel bad because the place was pretty empty and we ordered quite a bit of food.  

Okay, so this place would have gotten maybe a 4 because the food was decent and the place was really clean and well-lit.  

Since this IS a Mediterranean restaurant, I expected some damn good falafel.  But nooooo.  The falafel looked like big balls of turds.  They were burnt on the outside and totally mushy on the inside.  Basically, bad falafel = bad restaurant.  

MAKE BETTER FALAFEL!
author: Anna T.

description:
I've been to this place a handful of times and cannot understand why it is always a ghost town.   For the quality of food, this place should be jumpin'!  If I had to live off any food for the next year, it would be the Meza Appetizer Platter.  If you're like me and can't decide between the babaganoush, the tasty-as-hell squash dip, the hummus, the tabouli, the roasted red pepper/eggplant, and the tzasiki, you can have it all on the Meza Platter.  Love it!  Their lunch specials are pretty good and I recommend the Layaly burger (served between a pita bread).  The turkish coffee is a good ending to the meal, but all their desserts are phenomenal as well.

I deducted one star only because their backside patio kinda' sucks.  It's dark, has picnic tables, and simply makes me feel like I have stepped into mafia territory.  I think if they spruce it up a bit, it could be a big hit.
author: Bharu J.

description:
Finally, I passed up India Clay Oven and tried Layaly.  It took some effort 
since I LOVE Indian food and the great buffet there.  It was rather late in the afternoon, though, so I crossed the street and decided to indulge my hankering for baba ganouj.  I walked into a completely empty restaurant and was greeted warmly by owner, Maher Damous, who hails from Jerusalem.

I was very impressed with the cleanliness of Lavaly, everything neat and in order.  He handed me an extensive menu with dishes, he explained, from Jordan, Lebanon and the Mediterranean.  There were choices to suit all tastes.

I settled on a cup of lentil soup which was tasty but a little bland.  The 
meza platter was utter delightful and so beautiful, I regretted not having my camera with me.  It was so visual, with its mix of colors and textures.
Each scoop was delicious - hmmus, baba ganouj, tabouli, haydari, red ezme, falafel, and a yellow squash dip, served with pita bread.  I would never come here without having that meza.  Fit for the gods.

I finished off the meal with an excellent Turkish coffee and a tres leche 
cake - I've had much better tres leche.  I suspect their baklava, made on site is superior.  Next time, I will go with the baklava.

I will definitely return in the near future - with a friend - so we can sample more of the menu.  They have assorted kebabs, grilled fish, and an extensive sandwich menu, as well.
author: Carmen H.

description: There's a saying in the South, "Makes you want to hit your mama," that is only spoken after having eaten something truly spectacular.  I've loved every falafel, shawarma, and feta pita I've ever had in my 16+ years in SF, but the chicken wrap from Layaly makes them seem like so much cardboard.  Bursting with crisp, fresh vegetables, and loaded with tender-yet-crispy chicken which had been subtly spiced and obviously cooked over an open flame.  The falafel was also superior (ate one of those in the same sitting,) and the dolmas were great, but the chicken wrap, well, you know how the saying goes.
author: Sid B.

description:
Okay, so I may have already written a review for this restaurant but it is amazing! They have definitely come a long way since they first opened and I am so glad to them getting business. 

Their food presentation has definitely improved and seems like they are trying new things in their recipes. The sautes are great to have when you are sick or having upper respiratory problems but they are EXTREMELY filling. I realize that may not sound very appealing but trust me, go there when you are feeling icky and have a saute. I guarantee that you will come out filling nice and warm and at least a little better. 

Every time we go we get the same waitress. I believe it is only her and the waiter. But she is always nice and the service is always wonderful. 

As much as I love this place I really wish they would improve their dessert menu and their nonalcoholic beverage selection.
author: Kayla H.

description:
If you're new to eating Middle Eastern food then this place is perfect. The menu was very generic and catered to an American audience. Not a place to go if you're looking for traditional Middle Eastern dishes. 

Ambiance: Warm and inviting, not super dimly lit, but no florescent track lighting. The walls were painted a subtle cream color and there was art along the walls. They played Arabic music which totally gets you in the mood to eat (and dance).

Food: The basics koofta and kebabs. They do have a mezza platter as an appetizer where you can try about 4 or 5 different dips along with a couple falafels. 
            Presentation was very nice. They took time to decorate with mint and stacked the kebabs very nicely. 
           There was enough food, but not in abundance. Arabs like to EAT and so i think a good measure of it being a real Arabic restaurant is how much of something you get. 
            Inexpensive wine that pairs nicely with all dishes!!

Service: Attentive and very friendly.

I would recommend for first time Middle Eastern eaters. However, if you want to try more traditional dishes I would go to Oasis Grill or Fattoush Restaurant in Noe where you can get mansef and fasolui.
author: Rana A.

description: Fresh, delicious middle eastern cuisine. I went with a large party and the waitress was attentive and patient. Her recommendation of the Lebanese beer to begin with was "spot on"! The hummus, stuffed grapes leaves and pita bread were sublime. I had steak kababs and they were flavorful and delicious. All ten of us were very pleased with the food and the service was exceptional. Can't wait to return.
author: Veronica A.

description:
Another gem in the Outer Richmond Clement area. We were walking around the neighborhood looking for a new place to eat. The restaurant is clean and nice and our waitress was really sweet.

We had a glass of the house wine for $4 (sweet!). He had the beef kebabs and I had the Chicken Tekka (mine were better). We shared the butternut squash hummus (a must!) with pita bread and the feta cheese and parsley deep fried with filo dough (you can skip that one). Our meal overall was really yummy and filling. Appetizers are about $4 and the entrees run anywhere from $13 - $24.

I would definitely recommend coming here on a date or to hang out with a couple of close friends.
author: Jane C.

description:
I just moved to the neighborhood and after a hard day of moving I decided to check out what was around the block. I stumbled aupon Layaly. 

My friend and I were served by the owner and he was so courteous! I ordered a beef kabob and bab ganoush. It was my friend's first time trying mediterranean food and he liked it. The rice was real nice, i personally would've liked the beef to be a little more rare but it was still tasty.
author: kimy l.

description:
The food is here is quite tasty.  The spring roll filled with cheese is a great bite.  The various dips they offer are very tasty.  I find myself combining dips and smashing a falafel in between the pita. Yummy!

The french fries they make are actually done right! Nice and crispy. I wished they had truffle oil to lace it with, or some kind of Parmesan creamy dip. The Combo platter will give you a whiff of the many things they have.  I find the lamb very tasty on one visit, and sort of under seasoned the next.  

The kofta -or ground meat sticks if i got that wrong, are what gets me coming back here.  I love the meaty texture and flavor of the bite.  Chewy, herbacious, with the light acidic tang.  

I was lucky to have tried the Chilean Sea Bass one night and that was a great skewer.  Perfectly cooked, charred, and paired with a nice grilled tomato.  The sweetness of the tomato match great with meaty fish.  I just wish there was more rice!

All in all, the food is tasty, prepared correctly, and fair priced.  The atmosphere is warm, the service friendly, and dining area is not too loud.  I've walked into the back patio which was very spacious, exclusive, and intimate.  The covered patio, is stocked with heat lamps and plenty of seating, enough for about 30 people.  They also have a projector too.  I understand they do catering and private parties.  It be nice to have a celebration here someday.  This is food done right.
author: Phat Hippo L.

description: So Layaly has changed ownership recently and they've been doing a great job so far lately! The food has gotten better. The lamb kabobs with rice and grilled vegetables are delicious! I LOVE THE RICE HERE... the flavor of the rice is so good. What's in it????? nom nom nom nom! Layaly also becomes a hookah bar at night! Great place to hang out after hours!
author: Brian P.

description:
Shoot I should have taken a shot of the place.  It's way out on 25th and Clement and it was a nice charming little place.

We got there early as I was dining with my pops who was spending his last night in SF until he headed home to 'Bama.  

Anyhow, we both got good meals, my dad got the stuffed eggplant which he liked although it was packed with so many flavors it was hard to enjoy each individual ingredient.

I had something that was beef and lamb all rolled together into what looked like sausages on skewers.  The meats were very tasty and more filling that it appeared when the dish first landed on the table.

Overall a good deal - the two of us had salads, our entrees and a beer apiece and it was just about $35 plus tip.
author: Gene X.

description:
Good food, great service.  

Can be quiet inside, sometimes can be noisy - it really depends on how busy.  Hit or miss.  

Not a lot of quiet and clean middle eastern places in the city who want your business.  This place does.
author: Dong T.

description:
As you probably know, "Mediterranean" covers a large range of countries and cooking styles that are similar, but also subtly unique.  The cuisine of this restaurant hails from Jordan.  

The falafel sandwich has just gotten better now that they are wrapped in a thin lavash bread instead of the thicker pita.  The falafel balls are perfectly flavored and nice and crunchy.  It also includes hummus which is not very common which makes it more filling than others.  Though I have yet to find a falafel better than Truly Mediterranean.

Oddly enough, the french fries you can get with the sandwiches are the best I've ever had.  They apparently use special fresh potatoes and a double-fry them to make them perfect.  I only with they would give you something to dip them in other than ketchup.

The Layaly Salad is very flavorful for a fairly traditional salad that is served with crispy pita chips.  The olives in the salad are certainly amazing.  I'm not even a big salad person.

I really like the Turkish coffee.  So why Turkish coffee?  Apparently it was the closest the owner could find to his favorite from back home.

Their baklava is also the best I've had.  Very rich in flavor and an awesome flaky texture with fresh ground pistachios on top. Mmmm!

My only complaint is that the Clay Oven is right across the street.  Layaly is the healthier, cheaper, and quicker option, but the greasy, exploding flavors of Clay Oven are sometimes too hard to resist.

I give this place 4 stars because all the food I've had has consistently been great, the staff is very friendly and accommodating, and the facility is very clean.  I haven't ventured into the alcohol or the dinner menu yet to feel comfortable giving it 5 stars, but I'll update this if I do!
author: MS C.

description: I love Layaly, I ordered a lot of time and I am never disappointed.
author: Jenna M.

description:
I have been wanting to go to this place for months since I walk by it all the time on my way to and from various other places on Clement. Finally, I popped in for lunch with some friends this Saturday.

When we walked in the place was dead (I don't think they get a lot of lunch traffic on the weekends). So we got a good table right by the window and they started up the culturally appropriate music just for us. I really like the atmosphere in this place. There is good art on the walls, and the large windows make it seem very open.

 I think the owner was our server and he was very attentive and concerned with our well being. I have been in places were this is simply not the case when it is slow.

The menu seemed somewhat limited to me but the prices were good (keep in mind I am talking about the lunch menu). The chicken sandwich I got was quite good. The chicken was a fairly thin cut but it was very tender and well flavored (not quite grandma's motherland cooking but close enough). Where Layaly really shines is in its desserts. I had some of the best rice pudding I have had in a long time. It was nice and thick unlike the runny stuff you usually find, which seems more like heavy cream with sugar and rice dumped in it as an afterthought. This pudding was gourmet.

I don't know if it is ever busy, because most of the times I walk by it is kind of off peak hours, but I hope they stay in business. I plan on going back for dinner soon.
author: Peter F.

description:
The food here is reliable, delicious, and affordable!  I can always count on Layaly to satisfy my baba ganoush craving.  The pita is fresh and warm, and they are never stingy with replenishing it.  Salads are refreshing and I'm a fan of their fries.  I still have a lot of other things to try on the menu!

Parking usually isn't too bad during lunch hours, but during the weekend, it may be harder as there are many restaurants in that area.
author: Michelle W.

description:
We went to Layaly for dinner and it seemed fairly inexpensive from the menu on the door; however, when we got inside, the prices had skyrocketed. 

Don't go here if you are hungry because the portions are EXTREMELY small for the price. I got the greek salad ($8) and there was barely any lettuce. Also, they couldn't seem to make a falafel sandwich, plate or pita for dinner (claiming that everything was put away at lunch); however, the falafel APPETIZER seemed to come on top a piece of pita (why they couldn't even try to accommodate is beyond me).  

Overall, I would not go back for a second visit unless they lower prices or jack up their portion size.
author: Julie G.

description:
Really fresh and flavorful food! Generous juicy cubes of meat on the kabobs, hot toasted pita triangles, and satisfying portions, filled my head with question marks of why the place wasn't packed. But, being that it's relatively new and on a strip that's predominantly Asian-fared, no doubt that people will sniff it out from beyond the 'hood, once discovered/established. 

Very reasonable prices for the quality of dining experience you get. Even the fries were excellent!  I'll definitely find my way back, even if it's out of the way.
author: Bibi B.

description:
My girlfriend and I come here probably once a week. The service and food are ALWAYS consistently awesome. The meats are tender and flavorful;  I like the lamb kabobs the most. We often get the Meza Platter which has hummus, baba ganush, tabouli, a labane dip and a couple more. I am Israeli so I have a critical eye when it comes to hummus! It has never failed me. Another favorite of ours is their baked eggplant topped with Layaly's own special marinara sauce and cheese. BUT WAIT!....... Their Turkish coffee is worth the price of the meal :-) 

If you are lucky, the waitress will read your coffee grinds.
author: Jennifer And Uri W.

description: Went there recently for my office holiday lunch.  We all (7 people) chose items off the dinner menu because it came with bigger portions.  In the beginning we started with the Mezza Platter and it was very good with a wide variety of different appetizers.  We all decided to have kebabs and ended up sharing so I got to try the lamb, beef, chicken, and kofte.  All were really tasty.  The service was fine. She refilled our glasses with water quite often which was great.  Prices are very reasonable.  This was the first time we all had Mediterranean food and we will definitely revisit this great restaurant!
author: Stephen W.

description:
I went here the other night for a small dinner with pops and the bro, and I think we ended up doing alright there.

The hummus was fairly standard, the falafel was hot and crispy (mmm), there wasn't enough pita bread (standard at most Medeteranian places), and the kebabs were a little over priced.

I ordered my lamb kebab medium, and it came that way which was a treat honestly. The fries with it seemed like real fries, but they weren't that great, so I guess next time I'll have the rice.

Our waitress was very friendly, but didn't know a whole lot about the food.

Their wine selection seemed reasonable too, although I didn't have anything. I'm gonna come back another night, especially since its convenient.
author: Tom S.

description:
The food was a little pricey and the portion are small.   But the food was pretty good so I would definitely come back again.  I would probably skip dessert next time.

Meza platter - this was delicious.  They gave us a ton of warm pita bread 
The entree comes with salad and rice or french fries.  We were not a fan of the dressing used on the salad but the rice and the french fries was really good.

Rack of Lamb - really good
Mixed grilled plate - the shrimp was really good but everything else was just ok
Lamb on a skewer - my brother liked it
Salute Chicken - a couple pieces of the chicken was a little tough but the bowl that it was served in kept the chicken nice and hot the whole time.  The sauce it was cooked it was really good and went really went with the rice.

They spent a lot of time with the presentation on their dessert. 
Rice pudding -this was really bad.  I love peppermint flavor but not in my rice pudding
Double chocolate mousse? - this was ok
La trie ***?  this was ok
author: L C.

description:
I want to throw in yet another good word for Layaly. The Meza platter satisfies and the warm pita triangles are perfect for when you're not eating bread but you really need to cheat. I will say that both the Lamb kebob and the rack of Lamb aren't as tender as I would like so I've settled on the Kofta kebob which is delicious. If you like yogurt with your meat, their Hydari is sooo good.
The mint tea with sugar makes me happy AND there's a very sweet and lovely brunette waitress there during the day. I'm sold.
author: Nina M.

description: Great food ! try the mixed grill its phenomenal
author: Sulaiman B.

description: I was delivered food  from this restaurant using GrubHub. I made it clear in my order of a falafel, fries and a salad ($24) should have NO TOMATOES (I am allergic). The meal arrived 50 minutes later and both the salad and falafel had tomatoes, the fries were cold, and there were no utensils or napkin. I was in a hospital ER and had no access to cutlery to eat the salad. I called Layaly and was told a new falafel would be sent out on a rush. 30 minutes later, the same delivery person arrived, handed me the to-go container and began to rush away. I said, "Wait! Where are the utensils/napkin?" He shrugged his shoulders and said I had to request them when I placed my order and immediately left. I was unable to eat the salad (feta cheese in fine crumbles, oil-based dressing) and upon further inspection, found cherry tomatoes halved on the very bottom. Being in a hospital Emergency Room could have been handy in that had I eaten the salad, I would have gone into anaphylaxis. The food? The falafel was smallish and rather flavorless, the fries were not bad and salad at least looked good. I will never order or eat at LAYALY again.
author: Michelle M.

description: Would love to give it more stars, but I didn't get what I expected.  On the menu when one orders Musaka you expect lamb.  When I started eating it, all I got was potatoes!  MMM...when confirmed with the waitress that Musaka is suppose to have lamb in it, she said it was a vegetarian Musaka.  Then say so on the menu.  It is not "Musaka" but a "Vegetarian Musaka!"  didn't think I had to read every ingredient on their menu.  I know what is in Musaka.  Should have expected something was off when Moussaka was spelled wrong.  Won't be going back.
author: G J.

description: Just discovered this spot today- what a find! Great food, nice decor, and the two guys who run it are absolutely hilarious. They talked us into an after-meal Hooka in the back, which was a nice way to relax after eating. The back area is a very cool space- they keep it open till around midnight so if you're looking for a hooka spot I recommend it. Apparently they also show soccer matches back there in case you are a sports fan. I'll definitely head go back.
author: Megan C.

description: layaly has such amazing food and it's priced well too! The owner is awesome and  the service was superb!! I'll have to come back the next time I visit SF.
author: Natalie M.

description:
Had an excellent lunch at this lovely restaurant the other day. It was quite empty and I wonder why more people haven't discovered it. 

The Meze Platter was fresh, flavorful and beautiful to look at. The contrast of the various spreads -bright yellow squash,  red tomato, green tabouli, clean white lebneh, earthy smoky eggplant, with dark brown falafel in the center, were a delight to the eyes as well as the palate. There is enough to easily satisfy 4 as an appetizer.  I had the lentil soup which was flavorful and filling but perhaps a tad too thick for my liking. My friend had the salad which she thought was crisp and loaded with flavor. It came topped with crunchy pita triangles.  All in all a great place and worthy of a repeat visit to try some of the meat dishes we didn't get around to.
author: Ash A.

description:
Layly serves great mediterranearn cuisine at a reasonable price. We came here for dinner Saturday night because, thanks to Yelp, and had a great time. 

The restaurant is small and intimate, but the service was quick and attentive. The food was very tasty. I had the Biety Kabob, which was awesome!
author: R H.

description: Deliciously tender and flavorful lamb kabobs and rice. The tabbouleh and ezme were only ok. but came with warm fluffy pita that i really enjoyed. The only rub is that its a bit pricey for the portion size, but the quality and taste make it an occasional indulgence.
author: Stacy T.

description:
The lunch special ($7) is a great deal: kebab of the day, rice, and salad. Pretty yummy. The kefta kebab is one of the best I have ever had, and the chicken kebab is moist and tender. Went once for dinner and got the mixed grill for two. All the meats were delicious (particularly the lamb), but the order was so large, we brought half the meats home. This is not a complaint, by the way.

We live in the neighborhood, and it is about a block from our apartment. Will definitely go back.
author: Geri J.

description:
wow, was really surprised by this place.  love it for the below reasons and for sure will be going back:

-clean
-spacious
-friendly service
-appetizer sampler was so good, we mopped every drop off with our -piping hot hummus (i think it's unlimited refills)
-entree sampler was also awesome - everything was cooked just right, -not greasy, and tasted really fresh.
-greek salad was classic, yet tasty and a  good portion

overall, a pleasant experience and delicious food.
author: Josie M.

description: The food at Layaly is delicious and very fresh. The service and atmosphere is inviting. I have brought many of my friends to eat at Layaly and they keep returning to eat there as well. Then they bring their friends and family because they like it so much. That alone says something about the restaurant. Try it out and I guarantee you will also go back again and again.
author: Ilana G.

description:
I wanted to like Layaly more, really I did. It's such a lovely restaurant, both inside and out. Clean, bright and welcoming ambiance. The service was fairly quick and waitress friendly and attentive (water glass always full). Those are the good attributes... 

Unfortunately, not much good can be said about the food. My companion and I ordered the filo wrapped appetizer with cheese and herbs. When it arrived I thought maybe they had the order wrong as they appeared more like mini egg rolls. Edible, but a bit on the bland side, and soooooo not what I expected. The chicken kabobs I ordered were nothing spectacular. In fact, the chicken wasn't seasoned enough and was quite dry. The vegetables weren't very memorable to say the least. Thank goodness for the yogurt sauce that I used to drizzle over the kabobs...but even that was below par. The order came with fries and while I enjoyed them (probably the best thing we ordered), they did taste very frozen (think they didn't even thaw them, they just put straight in the deep fryer). My companions meat dish looked like a stew and when asked how it tasted, he proclaimed, "Not super flavorful." And that my friend, is exactly how I would classify the entire meal..."Not super flavorful..." 

Again, too bad because it's moderately priced, nice venue and service. Maybe it was an off day or we ordered wrong?
author: Marie B.

description:
I finally found a place that serves lamb kebabs just the way I like them.  Nice portions too, and the grilled vegetables had great flavor.  I tried several appetizers too ... 2 of them were good, the other was just ok.  The dining area is pleasant, comfortable, and nicely decorated (love all the dark wood).  

Only 4 stars because I originally wanted fish but they were out of fish :(

And, the restaurant was pretty empty when I was there and an employee must've been smoking out back because the restaurant smelled of smoke during the last 10 minutes of my meal.
author: C C.

description: Beautiful place excellent service the food very very good.great music and it's quiet and comfortable..The taste and flavor for the hookah great. beautiful and comfortable light ,that a great experience
author: Rami A.

description: We stopped there for lunch and loved it! Prices are really reasonable for what they serve and the food is great. The stuffed eggplants, lamb Kebab and wraps are mouthwatering!!! :)
author: Silvia M.

description:
Layaly depends on the day you go. We went a few times when the owners and their friends were hanging out after hours. That's when you want to be there. They flirted with my sister, and one of them even ran across the street to get us a pack of cards. 

We tried going one time when the owners weren't there, and it didn't go too well. I don't remember exactly what happened... but I think it was after hours and they wouldn't let us stay for hookah.
author: Ryan B.

description: Love this place. Delicious food, great ambiance, and friendly service.
author: Jessica P.

description: Layaly is DELICIOUS. My fiance and I love exploring all the restaurants in our neighborhood, and we wound up at Layaly one weekday evening. It was DELICIOUS. I was definitely a fan. Unfortunately, it's a bit pricey and I found it to be pretty loud inside, despite the fact that it was less than half full. Still, great food, great service... what more could you want? And, the house cab was REALLY good... and cheap :). Next time you're on this block, and if you can resist the Indian food across the street (which for me, is TOUGH), try out Layaly!
author: Bridgette A.

description: I really don't have much to say about this place.    Its never busy, the food is not that exciting... actually the place is not that exciting... its not very welcoming.  I've eaten  this style of food many times all over California and I love it.  My guess is that this place will morph into something different.  If you are good along Clement, you should be packing them in nightly... this place doesn't do that.     A restaurant should always start with the food, not the decor.  The decor is nice, but in SF, decor is a hard thing to sell of your food doesn't back it up with a punch!!  The food is not bad, but it doesn't want to make me come here again and again. There is something missing here, I just have visions of this place being empty all the time.
author: Demanding T.

description: Really yummy food and GREAT service!  Just don't get the baklava unless you're ready to pay like $7 a piece for it!  The falafel is so crunchy and delicious!  It would be a nice a place for a date because the entrees are nice to share and it's a place you could easily sit and talk for hours drinking wine, snacking on the yummy tidbits and enjoying each other's company.
author: Chloe B.

description: DELISSH -- came here for my husbands birthday and we LOOOVED it! He's middle eastern so he's hard to please and he was impressed! We're definitely going here again!
author: L O.

description:
strip mall
quality food

shopping mall
presentation

fancy mall
prices

disco disco good good!!
sound track
author: Dan M.

description:
Mediterranean food by my house finally HELLS YES!!
I do wish it was more like a cheap falafel type place that I could make  a staple of my diet.  So sick of Gordo's.  But I guess if they have to go all fancy smancy on  my ass I'll take what I can get.  Just not as often as I would like.  Damn my caviar taste, why don't you match my WAMU checking account balance?  You deceive me.
Well, it's good anyway.  A nice sampler plate to start and some kick ass kabobs.  I'm docking a star due to the awkwardness of the service and timing, but its a brand new place so I'm sure it will only get better.  And the owner obviously knows how to work the  I-only-hire-cute-young-foreign-girl angle so noone really minds waiting a few extra measly minutes for their glass of red wine.  Or if they spill an entree in your lap.  Or rub hummus all over your back.  It's okay, YOU ARE SO CUTE with your little bangs.  Aww.  Never mind about that star, I GIVE IT BACK!
author: Starla D.

description: Went here for lunch.  Had a nice salad as well as a chicken kabob.  The Salad was great but the chicken had some kind of weird clove spice to it that I didn't like, although it was cooked well and was tender and juicy.  Don't miss the authentic Turkish coffee.
author: Mitch A.

description: The food was simply delicious. The waitress was friendly and very competent.  And the prices are reasonable.  What a find!
author: Margery N.

description:
I've eaten at Layaly a number of times with friends and family in the past and was very impressed with the food. I got a 25% coupon in a mailer recently and decided to take my wife there again. I found out when we got there that the restaurant was under new management and I was disappointed that the quality of food was not the same. 

We started with chicken soup and it was really salty. Next we tried the Layaly Mixed Grilled because I wanted to see how the new owner prepared the various meats. (I didn't realize until we got home that our entree suppose to come with salad. They didn't give it to us.)  I recalled that the meats in past visits were cooked to perfection but this evening everything was overcooked and dry. 

I'm at a lost on why our dinner experience was so different. It could be a cook's bad night, my use of the coupon (hint: don't present it until they finish serving), or new management.
author: David Y.

description: Layaly is a hit or miss joint.  I would definitely give the green light to the Haydari, the Hummus, and the Layaly mixed grill, although the lamb, which was spot on in terms of texture, was a little bland, which is also why I wouldn't recommend the lamb kebab.  The beef tantoni was also a bit of a let down, you can get twice the amount tomato beef fried rice for half the price.  The beer is cheap ($3), the service is great, and the dining area is spotless.  I'd give Layaly an additional star for upping the flavor and another star for lowering the price.
author: Tony L.

description: I think the food here is pretty good but they might be asking a bit much for it. The lamb kebab was good and the meat was done in the manner that it should have - but the fries were not particularly great. Also I thought the sauce with the kebab probably could have been better. The falafel appetizer was good - I cut up the little balls and put them in the small slices of pita for some mini wraps. Hummus appetizer was pretty good but it was nothing extraordinary. The service was friendly and prompt, so I will probably come back here in the near future to check it out again.
author: Sven S.

description: Decent price for good food. The place is quiet and the server was very helpful. Didn't even know they have a hookah bar until the waiter mentioned to us. Definitely a must try.
author: Bob C.

description: The service here is always great and the place is quiet. The quality of the food is very good, however, the menu is pretty basic. However, if you are in the mood for a tasty falafel wrap, this place will suit that craving. I go mainly because it is the only Mediterranean restaurant in the neighborhood.
author: Holly F.

description: If you are a table of two, I recommend the meza platter and the skewer combo. This makes for the perfect night out! The food is all so good!
author: Laura C.

description: Healthy Mediterranean food. Fresh vegetables and meat. Not oily. Tasty seasonings. Decent prices.
author: Robert S.

description: The flavors need to be more developed, they were too mild for me. I felt the baba ganoush could of used a little more garlic and the yellow squash dip was also missing some flavor. The staff was nice and the place was clean.
author: Ericka A.

description:
don't get me wrong. i thought the food was good. unfortunately, this long awaited opening just doesn't quite do it for me. though i think they did a decent job on my kafta kabob, i think for the amount you pay vs the amount get is just not worth it. i'm hoping that the owner will just be working out the kinks with his pricing, staff (waitresses need mad training, but you honestly can't blame them), and quirks that are plaguing this place during its first couple of opening weeks. 
on the bonus side, the owner did say he was going to open a hookah bar on the back patio. i may return to try the hookah. good luck to them, and i hope they figure it out :)
author: Aly L.

description:
Finally, we were able to check this restaurant out...I was suprised with the cleanliness of the restaurant and the very cozy design they have. I'm very impressed :) We didn't know it would a small fancy restaurant. 

The food was great. We ordered the following: 
- eggplant hummus (don't ask me how to pronouce or spell the real name of it b/c I can't.) This very simple dish but delicous. It came with small, cute and warm triangle pita bread. 
- kofta kabab- This is very delicious. How come when I make this it doesn't come out that way ;) 
- Mix plate (chicken kabab, shrimp and lamb)- The shrimps definitely had some kick to it. The chicken was cooked at the right temperature and very tender and so as the lamb. 

The customer service was great and food was fantastic. The price is about right...come and check it out.
author: JM M.

description:
Fattoush is what I would call this place.  They're specialty is the Layaly salad..hence their name, but I personally know this salad better as Fattoush.  Being of Lebanese origin myself, I'm always on the lookout for a good simple traditional middle eastern place where the flavours seem familiar...and this place is it.  The prices are good, not cheap, not over priced.  And the food has a lot of flavor and the portions are just right.
We went for dinner, the Layaly salad was great! The fallafel was very flavorful, hummus was o.k....throw in some garlic into that and it would be much less bland.  And the kofta kebab was juicy and yummy.  Rice was very much like the pilav I make at home...which was a good thing for me.  
I'm surely going to go back over and over again since it's right near my house....I have to try the tabouleh next...that's always the real test.
author: Hagop K.

description: My wife and I are big Troya fans. We were here for lunch and the food was amazing. Would have preferred that they had unsweetened tea for those that are trying to cut back on sugar. However the food is very good - dare I say almost as good as Troyas? Try it out.
author: Glenn I.

description: They deliver now, new owners (much better)... Good mix grill, rice with vegetables. I am looking forward to go to the restaurant to try some more food and have some hookah. I met one owner and he is very nice and cares about what the customer wants.
author: Sophia A.

description: Price matters -- this is standard Middle Eastern food with a 50% to 100% surcharge for cloth napkins. Truly Med should open a shop down the block and kick their butts. If you're going to spend this much, kick it up a little more and head over to Aziza, where the dishes have some originality to justify the cost structure. Places like Layaly exist so the upscale ooze from Lake can eat somewhere "comfortable."
author: OuterLands X.

description: The food was delicious. I had the stuffed eggplant and lentil soup. The soup had an olive oil drizzle and lemon wedge on the side. I've never had lemon juice with lentil soup before, and now I don't think I'd have it any other way. I'm a vegetarian who usually avoids eggplant, but I'm glad I tried it. The flavors of the tomatoes, onions, and feta were subtle and delicious while not over-powering. The mint tea was also perfect for the cold day. I'm definitely coming back and trying more food and the hookah lounge!
author: Kat O.

description: This is I think the best Middle Eastern restaurants we have been. The lamb couscous is to die for. Great ambiance of a bistro. Absolutely amazing food!!
author: Connie M.

description: I have two words:  MEZA Platter.  Get it.  It is by far the most wonderful thing on the menu.
author: Natalie S.

description: So good -- do yourself a favor and order kabobs for delivery.  Ourstanding flavors and so much food!  We come back to them all the time.
author: Mary F.

description:
So my friends and I have heard marvelous things about this place, especially since the new owners have taken over.  We decided to go finally after our hookah craving was becoming unbearable to live with.  Boy were we glad to make the drive over there.  The restaurant itself is charming, inviting and perfectly lit. One of the nicest waitresses that I had ever had made sure that everything was just right, including waterglass always full, wine glass always full and pita bread galore.  The food did not disappoint either and man was there plenty of it. I asked the owner, who came over a few times to make sure everything was alright, what his favorite dish was and ordered that. A beautiful melding of lamb and beef on a skewer, grilled to perfection with an array of grilled vegies was magnificent and I could see why he loved it as well.  My friends got the Ahi tuna seared salad, which should not go unmissed. At 9 pm the hookah came to our table and we could not help but try to invite ever waitstaff person to join us...they graciously denied us, but just the fact that we felt like we were old friends in this new place gave us the motivation to visit again and again. 

In short if your looking for fantastic service, phenomenal food, delicious hookah and penny pinching prices, DO IT.
author: Ashley W.

description: I love this place.  The food is wonderful, and moderately priced.  I don't know what else to say.  Try it!
author: Raphael R.

description: Have only been here once - Best falafel sandwich in the City. period.
author: Leslie R.

description: All I can say is: YUM!  For a girl that loves trying many different things during my meals, I found the meza platter to be amazing!  (I must say that I'm partial to the Haydari dip.)  The lunch specials are great-not too big, not too small, just right.  The place itself is cute, and I'm surprised that of the times I've gone there may have been only one or two other tables occupied.  Ordering take-out is always a nice option too...now, if only I can learn to pronounce the items I like on the menu.  In the end,  I would like to see more vegetarian options on the menu, but overall, I would say, give this place a try.
author: Alvina W.

description: Oooh, very good food.  Delicious pita and hummus!  I had the chicken skewers, served with rice.  Okay, I don't know what's in it, but the rice is soooooo good!  Our server was super nice, too.  The restaurant was not busy, which was nice too.
author: Sarah F.

description: I ate lunch here today with 3 friends. We all liked it a lot. The restaurant was clean and well-lighted and the atmosphere was friendly. The menu looked so good we all had a hard time deciding what to order. All the wraps and kebabs looked fantastic. 3 of us decided on wraps (1 salmon, 1 falafel, 1 chicken), and the 4th person got the kebabs. We were all really happy with our meals. Parking was a little tough, but it was worth it.
author: Janelle G.

description: Their homemade hummus is unbelievable!  As well the lemon chicken soup hits the spot.  This is a great local spot without a ton of tourists and lines.
author: Heather K.

description: Amazing food---best mediterranean in the City.  Wonderful service and a great place to spend an evening.  I recommend the mezza platter and the mixed grill platter.
author: Raman R.

description: This place needs a bit of improvement.  We ordered lamb, salad and chose the rice over the french fries.  (What is with the french fries?  There does not seem to be any other kiddie food on the menu)  The lamb was a little on the tough side and didn't really taste like lamb.  The rice was icky.  It just tasted like white rice.  The salad was ok, but I forgot to ask for the dressing on the side.  The dessert menu needs something that contains phyllo dough.  The noise factor was through the roof.  While tile floors are pretty, carpeting would help to dampen the noise (and make it easier on the feet and knees of the waitstaff wearing high heels).
author: Amy M.

description: Two of us went last night to Layaly, trying it for the first time with a Groupon offer and buoyed by some of the terrific reviews here. We had a perfectly good experience. The waitress / host was a charmer: efficient and clear and a nice personality. The food was good, not exceptional. I found the crab cakes tasty, my friend thought they were overseasoned - too much fenugreek. It was served with a tasty dip on a bed of nice greens. We each had skewers: mine were salmon and his, lamb. Both were well seasoned, tasty, overcooked and dry. Portions were generous; we each had a skewer left to take home. The accompanying rice was  just OK, the right texture and flavorless. The grilled zucchini and mushrooms were the best part of the meal for me. I thought they were terrific. Baklava was fresh and only OK. With our Groupon offer, it was a very good value. Without it, we would have been unhappy to have paid $60+ for this meal, with no drinks. Our waitress actually never asked about beverages and we didn't really think about it until halfway through the meal when it didn't seem to matter. She kept us well watered.
author: Donald O.

description: We went here for hookah once after discovering our first choice wasn't open. The hookah tasted good, and stayed lit relatively well. The owner was there and was extremely personable. My first criticism was that we had to move halfway through our smokefest from the back room to the front. Totally a buzzkill, and I guess they do that because of trying to adhere somehow to a weird rule or something. The guys explanation really didn't make that much sense. Secondly, the beer and wine was sub-par and too much money. I know the prices get jacked up on alcohol to drink at a place like that, but I was drinking some 2 buck chuck for like $8 dollars. They only have 3 beers, and none of them really interest me. The price was a little bit high, especially considering they're in an area surrounded by many college students. Don't expect anything to look exotic or even exciting. The place is pretty drab. If you want to have a smoke in the area, though, I guess they're worth a try. I'm not really impressed.
author: Alexander W.

description: What I had: Hummus, Falafel, Chicken Skewers with Fries and Side Salad, House Wine, and Pita.  It was all really good and fresh.  Chicken was tender, hummus was creamy, none of my fries were soggy, and the falafel was delicious.   The atmosphere was quiet and the server was really nice.  An all-around postive experience, and I would eat here again.
author: Kari L.

description: I ordered delivery from this place.  The food was good, and if I were in the neighborhood and hungry I would certainly go there, but I think that Tuba (Turkish), Park Gyros (Turkish), Lavash (Persian), and Mazzat (Lebanese) are superior choices.  That being said, I haven't sat down at this restaurant and the experience could be different. I ordered the soup, falafel, kibbeh, borek, haydari, and the mixed grill.  I found the food to be clean, fresh, and nicely seasoned.  My favorite of the order was the shrimp, which had excellent flavor, followed by the haydari.  The falafel was ok, as were the kebabs.  The lentil soup was good but not great. I would not recommend the kofte or kibbeh- and definitely steer clear of the borek.  The borek, which was my least favorite had so little filling that it was almost hollow inside.  At first I thought it was a freak borek, but all the others in the order were the same.
author: N A.

description: I'm glad this place is close to me, and they deliver. There prices could be cheaper, especially considering the neighborhood, but the food is good.
author: Ryan M.

description:
helloooo...is there anybody in here??

last time i came here for lunch, not one soul was to be found. hmmm...not sure why this place hasn't caught on yet, but the food is quite good and the ambience is very clean and pleasant. It's not everyday you find a decent mediterranean restaurant in the richmond.  you'll find that i get all giddy when there is another non-asian restaurant to open up in my neighborhood. don't get me wrong, i love my asian food, but sometimes you just need a little variety.

anyway, on to the food.  the lunch menu is limited, but everything we ordered tasted very fresh and flavorful.  all the kebabs are delicious and they come with rice or fries and a light salad. The fries are made from real potatoes(no, not like the soggy in&out kind), are light and crispy, and just the way i like it.  if you want a non-meat item , i would order the eggplant sandwich, and I absolutely abhor eggplant, but this sandwich defies reason.
author: Jen C.

description:
My husband and I had lunch here yesterday afternoon at 3:30pm and it was delicious!!!
Our server couldn't be more more gracious.  First rate.  
The food was fresh and well prepared.   The atmosphere is relaxing and uncluttered.  This place is a gem!!!  We will be back!
author: joanne b.

description:
Great service.
Great atmosphere.
Great little hookah bar lounge area in the back.
Get the kenafe for dessert.
author: A B.

description:
what saved this review was the hummas... mmmm so good... and the pita bread was warm and fresh... the worse thing you can do to hummas is serve stale pita bread...so props to that 

but the service... the girl seemed nice but not attentive at all... so it was hard to get her attention for something as simply as the bill or letting her know I was finished with one dish and wanted another 

the squash dip... from the description it would make your mouth water... I tried a little and couldn't taste a thing... then i slopped a blob of it on some pita and STILL couldn't taste anything...let's just say cardboard has more flavor 

I'll go back though....for the hummas
author: Peta C.

description: My friend and I walked into this restaurant by chance. We were going to order something to go, but the owner started talking to us about his collection wine. His friendliness won me over and made me want to stay for lunch. We ordered an appetizer platter and a falafel. The food was outstanding and the service was superb. This place is totally out of the way for me, but I would go back in a heartbeat.
author: Pepper R.

description: I give it a solid B+.  The food was tasy, prices were decent, and the service was great.  However, it was really nothing to rave about and the food was a bit forgetable.  But, if your in the neighborhood and want some mediterranean food, this is a good choice.
author: a e.

description: I love this place! Food is amazing! Make sure to try the hummus sampler platter with hummus and yogurt dip and other various dips so you can decide which is your favorite because you will definitely come back.  The deserts are pretty and tasty, and if you sit on the back patio you can enjoy a fabulous hookah
author: Janet H.

description: One of the best times I've had at a restaurant! Wednesday night it was very slow there but the food was THE BEST middle eastern food I've ever had with outstanding Hummas and Kebbobs. Arabic coffee was nectar of the Gods! waitress was super nice and helpful and the owner? Ahkmed (forgive spelling error) was a gentleman and stayed just for us to finish Hookah. Hookah was my first time and it was great! Had mint-Mellon.  Unfortunately a new wacky SF law will probably shut down most Hookah in the city by March. Well. I'll still come to Layaly for the great service and food.
author: David H.

description: Good food - had the mixed grill, Greek salad, hummus and falafel.  Presentation was exceptional (hummus was served on a wide white bowl, draped in olive oil, with a beautiful scallion(?) garnish!), quite fancy I must say, since I usually go to Sunset Deli or Yumma's.  Sunset has them on the falafel and Yumma's on price, but for a nice sit down Middle eastern/Greek meal, in a pretty atmosphere with an extremely pleasant wait staff - this is the place! Don't forget to have the Turkish coffee - twas delish!
author: Rita W.

description: I went here the other day for dinner and I really liked everything.  The food was SO GOOD, especially the hummus and the chicken kabobs. Oh and I forgot about the pita bread! It was really fresh and soft, and it was perfect with the hummus. The two guys that own this place are really friendly and super attentive.  They also have a hookah lounge in the back with a variety of flavors of shisha.  It was a little cold in the lounge, but I recommend the white peach- it was really tasty! I definitely want to go back soon, I found the prices really reasonable for the food.
author: Kate D.

description: A really pleasant experience. Reasonable prices for the food quality and comfy (and clean!) setting. The meza platter even won over my previously hummus-hating husband. Yummy hot pita, refilled as often as we wished. The mixed grill was a good first time dish - shrimp, kofta, beef or lamb skewer, really juicy chicken - mmm. Served with salad and tasty rice (or fries, but the rice is delish!) Servers were very nice, though one was a little inexperienced - and the parking is always a problem in the neighborhood, but it's well worth the trouble to drive around or walk a couple blocks!
author: Gale H.

description:
We just wandered in after a day at Baker Beach and this place was so great - spotless, the food awesome, the service excellent, the prices soooo loooow... that after demolishing half the Greek salad we shared my sweetheart said "I want to buy a lottery ticket here."  

"Hmm?" I queried, digging more warm pita into perfect smooth fresh hummous... 

"Because they wouldn't stoop so low as to sell a loser." he said, before biting into his lovely warm falafel sandwich with a side of fries and four pickle slices.  

We will look forward to it for after every nekked beach day.
author: Harley B.

description: Food is excellent. Nicely spiced and flavorful. We had the stuffed eggplant and the biely. Both were very good, a nice combination of tastes. Dinners come with fresh green salad that had a variety of real greens, not just iceberg or romaine. The turkish coffee is among the smoothest and richest coffee I've had in SF - and I'm a Blue Bottle drinker. Neighboorhoody atmosphere and confortable. Will definately go back.
author: Christina H.

description: Perhaps a bit out in the boonies, but well worth it.  Get the mezza platter and the kunufe you will go home happy.  We have been many times, and the owner always remembers us, and even the wine we have ordered before.  They have even made special dishes when the menu didnt have exactly what we wanted.
