And, it has never been crowded.  You can usually get a gift certificate at restaurant.com, if you are wary of trying new places at full price.
author: Megan G.

description: Good food, really like the hummus.  A really fun place to hang out later for hookah.  The guys there are really cool and make it fun.  They taught us this card game that my friends and I play when we go.  Mohammad is a character; he always shows us a new card trick or magic trick each time.  Ask him about the toothpicks...
author: Henry C.

description: crisp small restaurant...outer richmond location....looking clean 'n' showing the tamed side to middle eastern cuisine....beautiful 'n' cozy the establishment....starting with $three stella (corona 'n' heineken the only alternative) 'n' lemon humus with toasty flat bread...creamy 'n' smooth with the taste of lemon...a marvelous combination in perfect harmony.....looking to maximize first time experience...budget efficient "mixed" the choice....samplin' of lamb, kofta 'n' chicken kabobs....fries for the side....house salad to compliment......notice the vinaigrette dressed salad greens pickin' a bit bitter for liking....but, fries 'n' ketchup a perfect golden brown treat.....for meal...kofta excellent 'n' seasoned right.....lamb most succulent, tender 'n' moist....finding chicken a mistake...not a fan of white meat poultry....a deal 'n' trade to taste the beef...losing out on the trade 'n' finding lamb definitely much better....overall..roughly $twenty per person meals....atmosphere 'n' service excellent...food good....
author: Hen A.

description: i really like this place, the food is good, love the atmophere! the waitress is very polite, and LOVE THE HOOKAH LOUNGE!!! i got the strawberry, and sex on the beach flavor, it took an hour to finish with 3 other people, and we were hella chillaxing!
author: Jessica C.

description: quality of meat was great, but the portions were really small for the price....and my clothes smelled like grilled lamb for a week.  there's better around...
author: Tabatha Y.

description: great service but tasteless dishes. The entrees looked more appealing to the eyes than to the palate. Portion size was quite small for the price. I ended up  eating at king of thai 90 mins later.
author: cj d.

description: Great customer service, fresh and delicious cuisine, comfortable atmosphere gives this place a solid five stars! We started with the Meza platter and tried the beity kabob...mmmmmm! Salad was light and refreshing...not lathered in fatty dressing like most restaurents. Amazing find and definitely something I'd take my guests to when they visit.
author: Danielle L.

description: Hmm, pretty good.  I can't say  it is the best and no where near the best Truly Med on 16th Street.  My whole in the wall beats it hands down.  I'm in the hood so it's good for that but not the best.
author: Misti L.

description:
I gotta say,  I looooove Mediterranean food!  So, I was pretty excited to find this restaurant in our semi-new neighborhood!
Layala offers a wide selection of Mediterranean/Middle Eastern food in a nice, warm atmosphere.  I love the food, it's always super fresh, light and delicious.  I'm not sure how long this restaurant has been open, I couldn't find a review on it.  Anyhow, 5 stars for freshness, very friendly service, consistent quality, and for being affordable at a high quality.  I had dinner here a few times, the kebabs are all very tasty and juicy, the appetizers are diverse and great, and the salads come with a simple and delicious lemon-juice-and-olive-oil vinaigrette.  Tonight I tried the grilled fish, served as kebab and superb (halibut, turned out to be on the expensive side - A.Q.) .  Oh yeah, don't forget to finish up with Turkish coffee and homemade baklava! :)  
Had lunch here as well, great sandwiches and salads!
Did I mention the food is very fresh?!
author: J R.

description: We live in the neighborhood and haven't been to Layaly in a couple of years.  We will definitely be back.  We ate there Friday night and had a great mean.  I had the cod with cous cous.  My son had the prawns and my wife had the eggplant.  The cod was probably the best I've ever had.  It was charred and tasty on the outisde; moist, juicy and tender on the inside.  My son (12 yrs old) stated his shrimp were the best ever and he's had lots of shrimp.  My wife really liked her eggplant until she tasted my cod.  Then she wanted that.  Portions were good - we were quite full when we left.  Everything seemed to be freshly made frorm scratch.  The dolmas appetizer were warm and quite tasty.  Nothing at all like those from a can.  The baclava was also warm and tasted home made.  It was so good, we had to get another order even though we were quite full.  Service was good and attentive.  I'm surprised they weren't busier given how good our meal was.  I did note the sign said "under new management" which could explain why my review differs from earlier ones.  We will be back within a month, I'm sure.
author: Joe J.

description: Everything was fresh and delicious!! The service was impecabble, ample portions and relatively inexpensive for a healthy, delicious meal.
author: Tim K. M.

description: Layaly always makes me happy.  It sounds good and always *is* good.  The Sitto here is always served  with fries or rice and sometimes both. The hummus is excellent  and authentic. The bread is warm and very flavorful. The seafood offering here is just as good what a usual top notch seafood place would offer and the priced accordingly. I almost always get the   Lamb Kabobs, so good and juicy.  It's reasonably priced, too.
author: Ron B.

description: cute atmosphere, attentive service (well, i hope so...we were the only ones in there!), great falafel and tahini, and elegant presentation. a little pricey for lunch, but well worth it!
author: N. M.

description:
Our party of one vegetarian, one vegan and one very light eater chose this restaurant on New Year's Eve mainly because it was within walking distance to our homebase, and Mediterranean food tends to be veg-friendly and filled with tapas-style offerings. We were not disappointed: the light eater had the chicken soup, which she pronounced good; the vegan had the vegetable kebab, which he thought was tasty but looked to me like grilled eggplant, onion and potato piled rather gracelessly onto his plate.  I (the plain ol' vegetarian) had the stuffed eggplant, which was filled with a mixture of tomatoes, chopped eggplant, onion, and other savory vegetables. I thought my dish was quite good, though the eggplant's skin was tough and hard to cut.  We also all had dessert: the light eater and I split a chocolate mousse and the vegan had the baklava. We all thought the desserts were exceptionally good. 

However, this place really needs to be more attentive to service. When we walked in, our waiter was having a loud conversation with a friend, who was complaining about the lousy economy and how bad business was at the restaurant. We were the first customers in at 5 p.m. and were promptly seated and given menus. But the friend continued his long and impossible to ignore bitching about the economy, and our waiter was obviously preoccupied with talking, not serving. I had to prompt him to tell us what the fish of the day was (environmentally incorrect Chilean sea bass) and what the evening's specials were. I was also irate at being forced to listen to the conversation at the waiter's station: customers are NOT passive cows who don't understand or care what the staff is chattering about. I may not agree with your opinions, and I certainly don't like being ignored while I try to decide what to choose what's on my menu. Once the friend left, the waiter finally began to focus on serving us. But we waited 20 minutes too long to order. Things like this are the death of a restaurant, even if the food is good.
author: Eleanor T.

description: This was our first time there and it will not be our last. The food was flavorful, rich, wonderfully spiced and the bread was AMAZING!  My wife had the mixed grill and I had the beef tantoni, both were excellent. The portions were perfectly sized and we both left full and very happy. But most of all was the wait staff who was friendly and nice and open. They treated us like family and made us feel welcome and very happy. I will be bringing out-of-town guests here whenever possible and recommending it to all others. Great restaurant, great people!
author: Aaron S.
